Strong problem-solving skills
Ability to work both independently and as part of a team 
Strong organizational and time management skills
And‚Ä¶ What Makes Us Special?
As well as a 
competitive salary 
and a 
yearly bonus
, we offer:

Over 300 euros to set up your home office and additional monthly home office allowance.

Ticket restaurant and Health Insurance with the flexibility to exchange it for other benefits. 
Life and accident insurance.

2000 referral bonus if you bring other talented people like you to the company. 
Special banking and insurance conditions plus Exclusive Employees discounts

Different social clubs such as hiking, investment, beach volley and many more

Via Augusta, Barcelona.

Apply 
by sending your
 CV in English
.

Position Overview
The Data Scientist is responsible for discovering the information hidden in vast amounts of data and supporting the business in making smarter decisions thereby driving significant business efficiencies. The primary focus will be in applying data mining techniques, doing statistical analysis, building high quality prediction systems and collaborating with key business stakeholders to optimize and streamline reporting and metrics, and implement solutions to create better business value.
Key Duties/Responsibilities
Work on the process of translating technical objectives into defined problems that can be solved by applying data science.
Design algorithms to address current technical problems.
Work closely with COE Team members to apply advanced analytics, modelling and simulation to replicate and anticipate issues. 
Uncover new technical problems that need to be solved and support better decision-making.
Communicate data analysis and insights using rich visualization tools (e.g. Tableau; MicroStrategy; R; Power BI) and leverage data to present compelling cases to optimize solutions.
Perform exploratory data analysis, generate and test working hypothesis, and uncover important trends and relationships.
Provide expertise on mathematical concepts and inspire adoption of advanced analytics.
Educational Requirements
A recognised Degree in Applied Statistics, Maths or a related quantitative discipline.
Master‚Äôs Degree in applied statistics, applied maths, or related quantitative discipline preferred.
Previous Work Experience & Skills
Minimum of 2 years of relevant experience
Experience with relational databases, information and insights.
Experience with modelling software, data mining techniques and methodologies.
Experience with visualization software (Tableau, MicroStrategy).
Experience leveraging cloud platforms and developing in SQL.
Superior critical thinking, analytical and problem-solving skills.
Passionate, creative and forward-thinking individual.
COMMUNICATION COMPLEXETIES
Must be able to communicate complex solutions to nontechnical stakeholders in a way that can easily be understood. Data-science software tools can help visualize findings, but strong verbal communication skills are required to tell the story clearly.
Work closely with Centre Of Excellence team members to apply advanced analytics, modelling and simulation to replicate current issues and develop solutions. 
Communicate data analysis and insights using rich visualization tools
Able to inspire adoption of advanced analytics through effectively communicating the benefits.
CULTURAL DIVERSITY
Establish a worldwide network of contacts within the Company with broad culture diversity.
Ability to work within multi-cultural organisation and to leverage diversity.
Skills
Data Analysis; Data Science; Structured Query Language (SQL); Tableau (Software); Data Mining

description:
Position
Data Scientist
Job Responsibilities
The position is based in our HQ in Rome and part of the Global team.
The Data Scientist's mission is to empower Fendi with data-driven insights that fuel strategic decision-making, enhance customer understanding, and drive business growth. By leveraging analytical expertise and a deep understanding of the business, the Data Scientist's will identify opportunities for optimization, improve operational efficiency, and contribute to Fendi's continued success in the luxury fashion market.
As part of the LVMH Group, this role also involves collaborating and interfacing with other entities within the group, providing a broader perspective and exposure to a diverse range of business challenges and opportunities.
Main Responsibilities
Proficiency in machine learning and artificial intelligence algorithms with a strong understanding of their practical applications. 
Design, develop, and deploy AI/ML models to address complex business challenges, optimize operational efficiency, and deliver actionable strategic insights. 
Expertise in analyzing large, diverse datasets using advanced statistical and AI techniques to identify key trends, patterns, and correlations, transforming these insights into clear, data-driven recommendations for business stakeholders. 
Proven experience working with customer and sales data, particularly within a retail/consumer environment, to drive targeted business outcomes. 
Expertise in data collection, cleansing, and comprehensive analysis of large datasets from various sources, including customer, sales, and operational data repositories. 
Conduct ad-hoc data analysis to address specific business inquiries and support informed decision-making processes across the organization. 
Measure the impact and effectiveness of strategic initiatives and marketing campaigns using appropriate metrics and rigorous statistical methodologies. 
Measure the results of initiatives and campaigns using appropriate metrics and statistical methods. 
Collaborate closely with business stakeholders to understand their requirements and translate them into clear, well-defined data analysis projects. 
Communicate complex findings, insights, and strategic recommendations to both technical and non-technical audiences in a clear, concise, and persuasive manner. 
Actively participate in cross-functional projects, providing data-driven insights and support for key business initiatives. 
Manage relationships with data vendors, ensuring service level agreements (SLAs) are met and data quality is maintained. 
Profile
Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Mathematics, Statistics, Economics, or a related field. 
3-5 years of experience in a data scientist role. 
Proficiency in Python and R programming languages. 
Experience with data visualization tools, mainly Power BI. 
Preferably experience with Dataiku. 
Strong SQL skills and experience with relational databases. 
Familiarity with cloud computing platforms, preferably Google Cloud Platform (GCP). 
Knowledge of statistical modelling techniques. Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills. 
Strong communication and collaboration skills. 
Ability to work independently and as part of a team and perform under pressure in a fast-paced. 
Evidence of successful delivery of data driven analysis and recommendations to drive forward business performance. 
Critical thinking and attention to detail, extremely organized and high attention to luxury and detail 
Demonstrated interest in keeping up with emerging technologies and the data trend. 
Fluency in English and Italian are a mus 
Additional Information
LVMH is committed to non-discrimination and respect of each person‚Äôs singularities. We recognize and recruit all types of talent

Minimum qualifications:
Master's degree or equivalent in a quantitative discipline such as Math, Economics, Statistics, Engineering, Sciences, or equivalent practical experience.
3 years of experience using analytics to solve product or business problems, coding (e.g., Python, R, SQL), querying databases or statistical analysis, or a relevant PhD degree.
Experience working with marketing and media data and transformations required for analytics.
Preferred qualifications:
Experience delivering marketing mix modeling and Geo-Experiments end-to-end.
Understanding of Bayesian approaches and modeling frameworks.
Proven ability to generate practical solutions for marketing analytics problems and use results to drive business change in partnership with cross-functional stakeholders.
About The Job
Find the user. Find the magic. Connect the two. At its core, marketing at Google starts with the user and ends with technology, bringing both together in unconventional ways. Our job is to demonstrate how Google‚Äôs products solve the world‚Äôs problems ‚Äì from the everyday to the epic, from the mundane to the monumental. And, we approach marketing in a way that only Google can ‚Äì break the rules, redefine the medium, make the user the hero, and ultimately let the technology speak for itself.
As a Business Data Scientist in the Marketing team, you will support your team by delivering pieces of project work including supporting the implementation of data science solutions, supporting the improvement of data pipelines, or helping your team develop evaluation metrics that provide insights to the business. Specifically, as a Marketing Mix Modeling (MMM) specialist you will play a strategic and technical role in driving all things media, marketing, analytics, and partnering with internal teams to evaluate strategic initiatives. Using first-party and third-party data sources, you will create innovative solutions to demonstrate the effectiveness of Google‚Äôs media investment. At Google-scale, this implies working on our industry‚Äôs toughest challenges. Regardless of geographic location, the role will maintain a global scope and requires working with teams operating across regions and marketing entities.
Responsibilities
Provide support in media strategy, measurement, and optimization that requires expertise in advanced analytics work, with special focus on Marketing Mix Models (MMMs). 
Partner with internal teams in advanced analytics work including experimentation, measurement, and modeling. 
Identify patterns and behaviors that are effective predictors of performance and critical drivers for a successful media plan.
Deliver customer-centric, data-driven approach, based on a people-based marketing strategy to build, segment, and test audiences for best business results. 
Develop evaluation frameworks for large-scale models, new metrics, and investigate anomalies. Frame and solve ambiguous problems by scoping technical priorities and innovating on statistical methods.
Google is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. See also Google's EEO Policy and EEO is the Law. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know by completing our Accommodations for Applicants form .

description:
Company Description
At Nielsen, we are passionate about our work to power a better media future for all people by providing powerful insights that drive client decisions and deliver extraordinary results. Our talented, global workforce is dedicated to capturing audience engagement with content - wherever and whenever it‚Äôs consumed. Together, we are proudly rooted in our deep legacy as we stand at the forefront of the media revolution. When you join Nielsen, you will join a dynamic team committed to excellence, perseverance, and the ambition to make an impact together. We champion you, because when you succeed, we do too. We enable your best to power our future.
Job Description
Data Scientist - Campaign Analytics Support and Automation
WHAT IS THE ROLE?
We are a nimble team of analysts, architects, and data engineers, all with a strong analytical background, working in the landscape of media analytics. Our goal is to provide the best solutions to internal stakeholders all around the globe, driving process improvements and automations. We continuously invest in our team‚Äôs development, providing robust opportunities for growth of both hard and soft skills.
You will play a pivotal role in our team, helping build pipelines, applying statistical techniques to solve problems, and driving sustainable automation and code development. In collaboration with your teammates, you will provide support and insights to internal partners, ensuring processes are sustainable to drive growth efficiently.
IS THIS FOR ME?
You are curious, persistent, logical and have a growth mindset ‚Äì a true data enthusiast at heart. You have an entrepreneurial and solution driven mindset and enjoy providing valuable answers to difficult questions. You own your solutions from design to implementation, and onwards.
You love turning needs into solutions, designing models to support decision-making. With your experience you are able to work independently and collaboratively, train others as required and make data driven decisions to get the best solution. You are passionate about the future trends of data practice and dare to design and deliver new solutions for known and new challenges.
Primary Role Responsibilities
Write and review code in collaboration with other team members to process structured and unstructured (client) data using advanced analytical solutions
Use and fit different mathematical and econometric models for explanatory purposes that lead to better decisions, and translate these model outcomes into actionable insights and business value. 
Create high-quality data visualizations for internal and external purposes
Present and explain technical solutions or results in a stakeholder-friendly way.
Make key (technical) decisions in a project and take accountability for these decisions. 
Communicate and collaborate effectively with others (e.g. other team members, project or tech leads) to discuss complex data-driven and code-related matters
Qualifications
Several years of experience working as a Data Scientist or in a related role
Master‚Äôs degree in Econometrics, Computer Science, Mathematics, Applied Statistics or a related quantitative field
Spoken and written proficiency in English
Several years of programming experience in Python
Experience with or exposure to data analysis tools and libraries such as NumPy, SciPy, scikit-learn, pandas, matplotlib etc.
Experience with version control systems such as Git
A keen eye for data properties and how to sense-check them
Aptitude for problem solving, also when confronted with imperfect data or knowledge
Strong communication and collaboration skills, with the ability to effectively interact with stakeholders at all levels of the organization
Demonstrated ability to work with globally dispersed project teams
Excellent organization, analytical, interpersonal, and influencing skills
Open to constructive feedback and readiness to adapt
Familiarity with at least one of the cloud providers (e.g. AWS) is a plus
Experience with Docker is a plus
Experience with Airflow is a plus
Familiarity with the media and marketing industry is a plus
Familiarity with Bayesian statistics is a plus
Additional Information
Please be aware that job-seekers may be at risk of targeting by scammers seeking personal data or money. Nielsen recruiters will only contact you through official job boards, LinkedIn, or email with a nielsen.com domain. Be cautious of any outreach claiming to be from Nielsen via other messaging platforms or personal email addresses. Always verify that email communications come from an @nielsen.com address. If you're unsure about the authenticity of a job offer or communication, please contact Nielsen directly through our official website or verified social media channels.

description:
A data-driven company in the building energy efficiency sector, founded in 2023, is looking for an 
Energy Data Scientist
.
The company helps hotels and other energy-intensive businesses reduce energy consumption by 10-20% using data collection, smart analytics, and digital twins.
Their platform integrates with building systems to detect inefficiencies ‚Äî such as pool pumps running unnecessarily or mismatches between HVAC operation and occupancy ‚Äî helping clients reduce costs by up to 30% and lower emissions.
They also support carbon footprint tracking (Scope 1, 2, 3), ensure compliance with sustainability standards (CSRD, ESG, B Corp, Green Key), and enable automated reporting.
You are offered a remote position based in Cyprus.
Your tasks:
Develop ML models to detect energy inefficiencies from smart meter data
Forecast energy consumption and optimize HVAC system performance
Build internal analytics workflows and scalable data pipelines
Collaborate with domain experts to turn insights into real-world actions
Explore and implement advanced ML/DL methods to drive innovation
Requirements
4+ years of experience in Data Science, ideally in energy, IoT, or smart buildings
Strong skills in Python, SQL, and time-series modeling (e.g., ARIMA, LSTM, Prophet)
Experience with machine learning and deep learning frameworks (e.g., TensorFlow, PyTorch)
Familiarity with large datasets, cloud environments (e.g., GCP), and model deployment
Excellent communication and data visualization skills
Master's or Ph.D. in a quantitative field (e.g., Math, Statistics, Computer Science)
English C1+
Benefits
Competitive salary from your competencies
Full-time remote position with occasional travel
Official employment in Cyprus, fully compliant with local labor laws
The role includes paid vacation and sick leave, aligned with standard practices for full-time positions
Stable, fast-growing company with a flat organizational structure

As the world‚Äôs pioneering local delivery platform, our mission is to deliver an amazing experience, fast, easy, and to your door. We operate in over 70+ countries worldwide, powered by tech, designed by people. As one of Europe‚Äôs largest tech platforms, headquartered in Berlin, Germany. Delivery Hero has been listed on the Frankfurt Stock Exchange since 2017 and is part of the MDAX stock market index. We enable creative minds to deliver solutions that create impact within our ecosystem. We move fast, take action and adapt. No matter where you're from or what you believe in, we build, we deliver, we lead. We are Delivery Hero.
Job Description
We are looking for a Senior Data Scientist to join the Logistics Optimization team on our journey to always deliver amazing experiences.
The Optimization Tribe's purpose is to maximize Delivery Hero's logistics performance. We achieve this by owning and continuously improving the sophisticated algorithm that solves the real-time vehicle routing problem, assigning orders efficiently every minute. This directly impacts DH's core efficiency and customer satisfaction KPIs, influencing decisions for stakeholders from Operations to Product.
As a Data Scientist, your value lies in tackling these fascinating problems head-on and building ML products which shape the algorithm's logic and decisions to meet our long-term goals of best-in-class efficiency and service, making a tangible impact across the Delivery Hero network.
Lead the conceptualization and design of advanced modeling solutions (ML, Statistics or Mathematical) to tackle complex, large-scale Logistics challenges, ensuring alignment with business value and stakeholder needs. 
Take ownership of developing, implementing, and automating robust data science models and pipelines, including feature generation, retraining, and prediction deployment, leveraging tools like BigQuery and Spark as needed. 
Actively drive technical discussions and problem-solving sessions, contributing significant expertise and innovative ideas to overcome the toughest modeling hurdles alongside your Data Science peers and squad lead. 
Translate sophisticated analytical findings and model outcomes into clear, actionable insights for stakeholders, demonstrably driving value and improvements in key business metrics. 
Proactively engage with Data & ML Engineering and Tech teams to define critical data requirements and influence technical roadmaps, ensuring the necessary data infrastructure for impactful projects. 
Make a significant impact within our fast-paced, global organization by delivering high-quality solutions, sharing knowledge, and contributing to the team's overall growth and best practices. 
Qualifications
You have significant experience (ideally 5+ years) designing and implementing diverse machine learning models (e.g., regression, classification, tree-based ensembles) to solve real-world business problems, backed by a strong theoretical foundation in statistics and probability. 
You possess expert-level Python skills (incl. pandas, scikit-learn, etc.), proficiency in SQL, and demonstrable experience building robust, maintainable, and automated ML pipelines using Big Data technologies (e.g., BigQuery, Spark) and workflow orchestration tools (e.g., Airflow, Metaflow), applying software engineering best practices. 
You excel at translating ambiguous business requirements into well-defined technical problems and data science solutions, critically evaluating assumptions and ensuring data quality throughout the process. 
You are a strong communicator, capable of clearly explaining complex technical concepts, model intuition, and business implications to diverse audiences (both technical and non-technical stakeholders). 
You are a proactive team player with proven experience collaborating effectively with peers and cross-functional teams (like Data Engineering and Tech) in a fast-paced, dynamic environment. Fluency in English is required. 
Nice to have: 
Deeper experience applying Operations Research techniques to solve optimization problems relevant to logistics. 
Proven track record in designing, implementing, and analyzing complex experiments (beyond standard A/B tests) or applying causal inference methods. 
Experience building interactive data visualizations, applications, or dashboards using libraries like Streamlit, Plotly Dash, or similar tools to communicate results effectively. 
Additional Information
Ensuring you and all our Heroes are looked after, happy, and healthy is always on the menu. Because if you‚Äôre in good shape, then we‚Äôre in good shape.
Make the most of our hybrid working model and join the team for face-to-face connection and collaboration in our beautiful Berlin campus 2 days a week
We offer 27 days holiday with an extra day on 2nd and 3rd year of service
We will support you in developing yourself and your career growth opportunities: 1.000 ‚Ç¨ Educational Budget, Language Courses, Parental Support and access to the Udemy Business platform to explore a variety of online courses. 
Get moving and release those wonderful, mind-boosting endorphins: Health Checkups, Meditation, Yoga, Gym & Bicycle Subsidy
Cash. Dough. Cheddar. Whatever you call it, we‚Äôll help you with it: Employee Share Purchase Plan, Sabbatical Bank, Public Transportation Ticket Discount, Life & Accident Insurance, Corporate Pension Plan
The power of getting together over some food is unrivaled. Here are a few ways to help you do that. All the yum: Digital Meal Vouchers, Food Vouchers, Corporate Discounts. Courses. 
Ready to join our team?
 If you‚Äôre excited to grow, collaborate and be part of the world‚Äôs leading delivery platform, we‚Äôd love to hear from you. Apply today!
We believe diversity and inclusion are key to creating not only an exciting product, but also an amazing customer and employee experience. Fostering this starts with hiring - therefore we do not discriminate on the basis of racial identities, religious beliefs, color, national origin, gender identities or expressions, sexual orientations, age, marital or disability statuses, or any other aspect that makes you, you. We encourage you to let us know if you need any accommodations or specific accessibility support to ensure a smooth interview experience‚Äîjust include it in your application. You're welcome to share your pronouns (he/she/they) right from the start so we can address you respectfully from our first contact.
industries: Software Development and IT Services and IT Consulting

description:
About The Role
As a Junior Data Scientist, you will get involved on projects that encompass the foundational principles of data science, such as Machine Learning, Experimentation, Statistical Modeling and Causal Inference.
Most of your actions will hinge on these core and essential activities: aligning on business objectives, formulating problem statements, collecting, cleaning and structuring data, conducting analytical explorations, applying techniques for inferential and predictive modeling and effectively communicating outcomes.
You will work on projects of varying sizes and time horizons, aligning your prioritizations with the Operations Coordinator. You will translate business questions into testable hypotheses and rigorous experimental designs, or into mathematical models and ML algorithms.
You will deliver your work iteratively and incrementally, ensuring i) your code follows the best practices in terms of quality, reusability, optimization, ii) your analyses are robust, valid, reliable, scalable and impactful, iii) your deliverables are properly maintained and adapted to evolving requirements.
You will investigate opportunities in various topics, such as: Market Expansion with randomized controlled trials (RCTs) or ML models for product launch; Market Health models or DnD models for policy evaluation; Audits with regression discontinuity design (RDD) or reinforcement control learning for auditing threshold; Document Processing with natural language processing (NLP) or optical character recognition (OCR) for document classification.
About The Team
Backing Uber's creativity with operational efficiency. This is the Team's mission statement.
On request of Local, Central, Regional & Global Ops, the Team centralizes work, in Krakow CoE, around:
 Business Processes (design, execution, enhancement, optimization) 
 Analytics & Automation (query, deepdive, self-operating dash., process automation) 
 Data Science (modeling, causal inference, experimentation, machine learning) 
This experience gained as Junior Data Scientist may also, going forward, open doors to plenty of new opportunities across the world, via the Uber Mobility Program.
What You'll Do
 Formulate business questions into testable hypotheses and rigorous experimental designs 
 Collect and clean data, analyze experiments, infer causality and estimate effects 
 Use Statistical Modeling and ML to find patterns and make predictions from large datasets 
 Engineer features, deploy models and improve them as needed 
 Visualize and report your findings to Stakeholders, adapting your communication to a variety of audiences 
 Communicate findings to Stakeholders, adapting your communication to a variety of audiences 
 What you'll need 
 Knowledge of causal inference, experimentation and econometrics statistics methods for analytical problems 
 Ability to design, conduct and analyze experiments to infer causality and estimate effects 
 Understanding of statistical modeling and ML to find patterns and make predictions from large datasets 
 Skilled in SQL and Python (Pandas Library, basics of OOP and API endpoints) 
 Hands-on experience in common ML frameworks, tools & libraries (scikit-learn, scipy) 
 Knowledge of ML methods (Neural Networks, Naive Bayes, SVM, Decision Forests, etc.) 
 Ability to engineer features, deploy models and improve them as needed 
 Ability to visualize and report your findings to Stakeholders, adapting your communication to a variety of audiences 
 Motivation to learn all along the way and improve continuously

posting_title: Data Scientist / Machine Learning Engineer - AI at Massive Scale
description:
Help us push AI further ‚Äî and faster
LoopMe's Data Science team builds production AI that powers real-time decisions for campaigns seen by hundreds of millions of people every day. We process billions of data points daily ‚Äî and we don't just re-apply old tricks. We design and deploy genuinely novel machine learning systems, from idea to prototype to production.
You'll join a high-trust team that has a 
5-star Glassdoor rating
 led by Leonard Newnham, where your work moves fast, ships to production, and makes measurable impact.
¬†
What you'll do
 
Design, build, and run large-scale ML pipelines that process terabytes of data
 
Apply a mix of supervised learning, custom algorithms, and statistical modelling to real-world problems
 
Ship production-grade Python code that's clear, documented, and tested
 
Work in small, agile squads (3-4 people) with DS, ML, and engineering peers
 
Partner with product and engineering to take models from idea ‚Üí production ‚Üí impact
 
Work with Google Cloud, Docker, Kafka, Spark, Airflow, ElasticSearch, ClickHouse and more
 
¬†
What you bring
 
Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Maths, Engineering, Physics or similar (MSc/PhD a plus)
 
3+ years' commercial Python experience
 
Track record building ML pipelines that handle large-scale data
 
Excellent communication skills ‚Äî comfortable working across time zones
 
A curious, scientific mindset ‚Äî you ask "why?" and prove the answer
 
Bonus if you have:
 
Experience with adtech or real-time bidding
 
Agile / Scrum experience
 
Knowledge of high-availability infrastructure (ElasticSearch, Kafka, ClickHouse)
 
Airflow expertise
 
¬†
About the Data Science Team
We're 17 ML engineers, data scientists, and data engineers, distributed across London, Poland, and Ukraine ‚Äî acting as one team, not a satellite office.
What sets us apart:
 
Led by an experienced Chief Data Scientist who codes, leads, and listens
 
Inclusive, supportive culture where ideas are heard and people stay
 
Strong values: open communication, continual innovation, fair treatment, and high standards
 
Track record of publishing award-winning research in automated bidding
 
Don't just take our word for it ‚Äî check our Glassdoor reviews (search "Data Scientist") for a real view of the culture.
¬†
About LoopMe:
Do you want to work with patented-AI technology and develop high-performance solutions?¬†If so, we have the perfect job for you at LoopMe!
We are a global team of skilled engineers who develop and maintain real-time bidding platforms for leading advertisers worldwide. Leveraging technologies such as Java, Postgres, Clickhouse, Kafka, you will be instrumental in scaling performance, optimizing cloud infrastructure, and creating innovative features across our product portfolio.¬†
As the market leader in AI, LoopMe uses agile methodology to deliver product features at a fast pace.¬†Join us and be a part of our mission to push the boundaries of what is possible in the advertising industry!
¬†
What we offer
 
Competitive salary + bonus
 
Billions of real-world data points to work with daily
 
Flexible remote/hybrid options
 
Learning budget and career growth support
 
Friendly, transparent culture with strong leadership
 
¬†
Hiring process
 
Intro with Talent Partner
 
30-min technical interview with Chief Data Scientist
 
Panel with 2 team members (technical, culture & collaboration)
 
Offer - usually within 48 hours of final round
 
¬†
Are you ready to design and deploy AI systems that run at truly massive scale?

Join Us for a Unique AI Writing Assistant Project!
Are you passionate about cutting-edge AI, large language models, and shaping the future of creative technology? Join 10Clouds as we develop a 
custom AI writing assistant
 for a renowned philosophical author. This is not your average AI project‚Äîyour work will empower an award-winning writer to maintain their signature style, structure, and tone across entire manuscripts, with privacy and context memory at its core.
What makes this project special?
You‚Äôll help build a fully private, fine-tuned AI that mimics a specific author‚Äôs voice‚Äîno stylistic drift allowed!
Work closely with a highly technical, multidisciplinary team at 10Clouds, a leader in AI product development.
Deliver a 
real
, production-ready solution with a deep focus on privacy, autonomy, and quality.
The stack includes cutting-edge LLMs (LLaMA 3, Mixtral), Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG), FastAPI, Qdrant/Weaviate vector search, and a custom web editor for writers.
Your Responsibilities:
Analyze client requirements and help design the optimal system architecture.
Prepare and process text data for model fine-tuning.
Fine-tune large language models (e.g., LLaMA 3, Mixtral 8x7B) using LoRA or similar methods.
Develop a robust RESTful API for text generation and session management.
Implement intelligent knowledge retrieval/search using RAG techniques.
Build a responsive, user-friendly web interface for long-form creative writing.
Integrate document context/version management features.
Deploy and monitor infrastructure on cloud (AWS/GCP) with Docker and FastAPI.
Test, quality assure, and optimize the system for tone consistency and usability.
Maintain documentation and support seamless project handover to the client.
Requirements:
Hands-on experience with large language models (preferably LLaMA or Mixtral).
Practical knowledge of fine-tuning techniques (LoRA, transfer learning).
Advanced Python skills; experience with FastAPI, Docker, and CI/CD.
Familiarity with vector databases (Qdrant, Weaviate) and RAG algorithms.
Proven background in API development and microservice architecture.
Proficiency in deploying cloud solutions (AWS or GCP).
Experience with web development tools (React/Vue, responsive design).
Independence, Strong Communication Skills, And Client-facing Experience.
Bonus: QA/testing in AI, UX/UI design experience.
If you‚Äôre ready to work in a highly collaborative team, build deeply personalized AI, and shape the way authors harness next-generation assistant technology, we want to hear from you!
Apply now and help us push the boundaries of what's possible in AI-powered writing!

About Translated
Translated is a leading company in AI-enabled translation services. We are on a mission to allow everyone to understand and be understood in their own language.
Our success stems from a unique blend of the world‚Äôs #1 adaptive neural machine translation technology (IDC MarketScape 2022), the largest network of vetted, native-speaking professional translators, and top-ranked AI-enabled text, audio, and video translation tools (Gartner, 2022).
By leveraging a seamless symbiosis of artificial intelligence and human creativity, we design custom localization projects that were previously unthinkable, helping more than 280,000 clients grow their businesses worldwide.
We‚Äôre looking for a passionate AI Scientist to join the Translated team in our HQ in Pi Campus, Rome. Our team is developing the next-generation Machine Translation System, with the ambitious goal of reaching the singularity that we define as the quality of the top-1% professional translator and making it available to millions of people worldwide.
What You‚Äôll Do
Product-driven research: apply the latest research to improve the quality of our Machine Translation solution and make an impact on our latest product.
Autonomously manage the full project lifecycle, from planning to deployment, providing key insights and technical directions.
Utilize an HPC cluster for scalable, multi-node training tasks to accelerate model development and quickly evaluate research ideas.
Collaborate with a multidisciplinary team of product owners, designers, developers and system administrators.
Participate in continuous learning opportunities to stay ahead in the fast-evolving field of AI and Machine Translation.
Qualifications Required
MSc in machine learning or a related field and 3+ years of industry/research experience (a PhD is considered equivalent).
Proven experience in fine-tuning Large Language Models using distributed training frameworks and libraries (e.g., DeepSpeed, FSDP, Transformers).
Proficiency in Python and experience with at least one deep learning framework (e.g., PyTorch).
Proactive, self-driven and enjoys solving complex problems, not just in the primary area of responsibility but across boundaries.
Excellent communication and teamwork skills, with the capacity to convey technical concepts to non-expert audiences.
Ability to iterate quickly and make decisions based on results and data analytics.
Additional Preferred Qualifications
Experience developing Machine Translation models is a strong plus.
Experience with modern LLM alignment techniques, such as Reinforcement Learning from Human Feedback (RLHF), DPO, and GRPO.
Experience with job scheduling and workload management systems, particularly Slurm.
Headquarter
Translated is hosted at Pi Campus, a working environment immersed in nature where 7 luxury villas have been converted into functional offices to foster talent growth. Pi Campus is also a venture firm created by Translated to reinvest part of its profits into promising AI startups.
Benefits and Perks
Gym
Swimming Pool
Kickboxing, TRX, and Pilates classes
Table Tennis and Football table
Kitchen and snacks
Bonuses and incentives for employees who quit smoking or adopt a child.
Learn more about our company: https://translated.com/work-at-translated-onboarding
Diversity statement
At Translated, we proudly embrace and celebrate each individual's unique qualities to our team, regardless of race, sexual orientation, gender identity, or any other differences. We recognize that these diverse perspectives empower us to overcome challenges, foster innovation, and drive excellence. As an inclusive and equal-opportunity employer, we are committed to cultivating an environment where everyone feels welcome, valued, and supported to achieve their full potential.
Privacy Policy

A data-driven company in the building energy efficiency sector, founded in 2023, is looking for an 
Energy Data Scientist
.
The company helps hotels and other energy-intensive businesses reduce energy consumption by 10-20% using data collection, smart analytics, and digital twins.
Their platform integrates with building systems to detect inefficiencies ‚Äî such as pool pumps running unnecessarily or mismatches between HVAC operation and occupancy ‚Äî helping clients reduce costs by up to 30% and lower emissions.
They also support carbon footprint tracking (Scope 1, 2, 3), ensure compliance with sustainability standards (CSRD, ESG, B Corp, Green Key), and enable automated reporting.
You are offered a remote position based in Cyprus.
Your tasks:
Develop ML models to detect energy inefficiencies from smart meter data
Forecast energy consumption and optimize HVAC system performance
Build internal analytics workflows and scalable data pipelines
Collaborate with domain experts to turn insights into real-world actions
Explore and implement advanced ML/DL methods to drive innovation
Requirements
4+ years of experience in Data Science, ideally in energy, IoT, or smart buildings
Strong skills in Python, SQL, and time-series modeling (e.g., ARIMA, LSTM, Prophet)
Experience with machine learning and deep learning frameworks (e.g., TensorFlow, PyTorch)
Familiarity with large datasets, cloud environments (e.g., GCP), and model deployment
Excellent communication and data visualization skills
Master's or Ph.D. in a quantitative field (e.g., Math, Statistics, Computer Science)
English C1+
Benefits
Competitive salary from your competencies
Full-time remote position with occasional travel
Official employment in Cyprus, fully compliant with local labor laws
The role includes paid vacation and sick leave, aligned with standard practices for full-time positions
Stable, fast-growing company with a flat organizational structure

(Relocation to Abu Dhabi)
ClearPeaks is a specialist consulting firm delivering services and solutions in "Everything Data" - Business Intelligence, Advanced Analytics, Big Data & Cloud, and Web & Mobile Applications. Founded in 2000, we have been a trusted partner to our customers in over 15 industry verticals and functional areas, with operations spanning Europe, Middle East, the United States, and Africa.
ClearPeaks is part of a strategic alliance with synvert, a group of six successful full-service Data & Analytics (D&A) consulting firms, with a clear goal to become one of EMEA's largest D&A consulting companies.
Our services are based on the latest market-leading enterprise technology platforms, and delivered by a dynamic team of expert consultants. Our strength lies in our ability to efficiently deliver customer insight and value, gained through our decades of experience with real-world challenges.
As a Data Scientist, you will be responsible for identifying and implementing AI opportunities. We are seeking a highly talented, self-motivated, and customer-oriented candidate to join us.
Responsibilities
Hands-on implementation of Machine Learning use cases, AI agents to automate business workflows, propensity modelling to roll out marketing campaigns, forecasting for demand prediction and assortment optimization.
Deploy, maintain, and monitor AI solutions. Design scenarios, schedule jobs to run batch models or APIs for on-demand serving
Present to technical and or business stakeholdersPrepare and carry out presentations with the key business stakeholders involved in the projects to show the results of ML models to a non-technical audience and how they bring value to the business.
Gather business requirements from business users, and technically implement them to meet the requirements.
Defining business requirements, Document them, create wire frame, Communicate to Developers, Monitor Development, conduct internal testing and validate every KPI Numbers & Formulas.
Own and develop relationship with partners, working with them to optimize and enhance our integration.
Report on common sources of technical issues or questions and make recommendations to product team.
Communicate key insights and findings to product team.
Requirements
4+ years of prior experience in a Data Scientist role
Strong Data Engineering skills and software development skills
Expertise in Python and any one of the associated frameworks (scikit-learn, Tensorflow, PyTorch, h2o, etc.) for ML and DL
Expertise in the concepts of Statistics, Machine Learning and Agent-based AI
Knowledge in ML-Ops (deployment of models, model performance monitoring, data drift, rest API integration, simulations, etc.)
At least 3 Machine Learning project implementation experience in production
Excellent communication and collaboration skills, able to explain complex effects and impacts in simple business terms.
Knowledge of optimization techniques (OR, MIP, ...) is a plus
Knowledge on DataIku is a plus
Our offer to you!
Be part of an international and talented team, enjoying an excellent work environment where people are passionate about what they do.
Possibility to grow inside the team
25 vacation days

About us:
Planner 5D
 is a global hub for home design, uniting over 100+ million users in 230 territories around our planet (yes, we have 2 users connecting from Antarctica each month!). Our platform simplifies the home renovation process from concept to execution, and this process has never been more straightforward with our cutting-edge software. You don't need to be a professional designer to enhance your home or workspace. We are dedicated to streamlining the design experience, making the customization of dream homes accessible to everyone.
Our cross-platform presence spans Web, iOS, Android, Windows, and MacOS, ensuring seamless synchronization for our users. Planner 5D is more than just software; it's a vibrant community of enthusiastic and product-oriented professionals. From diverse backgrounds, our team collaborates across time zones, fueled by a shared passion to revolutionize the home design market.
We are constantly looking for like-minded talent eager to take ownership and drive innovation within our expanding suite of tools. Join us in shaping the future of home design.
At Planner 5D we are searching for a Senior Python Engineer who will join our team and will be building production-ready systems that directly support our product.
Responsibilities:
Design, build, and maintain scalable services that support the AI lifecycle, working closely with the research team to translate cutting-edge ideas into production-ready solutions
Develop tools for pre/post-processing data for AI and other usage
Develop tools for collecting and processing data
Design scalable pipelines for data collection, processing, and transformation powering next-generation AI systems 
Bring new models and features to production at scale with Triton Inference Server, ONNX, and TensorRT
Work across the spectrum from rapid MVPs and experimental prototypes to robust, long-term production-grade solutions
Work closely with ChatGPT API, LangChain
Required knowledge of:
Proficient in Python as the primary language with strong problem-solving and analytical skills
Demonstrated ability to design, deploy, and manage scalable backend platforms in production
Understanding Docker and Kubernetes concepts
Practical experience managing challenges throughout the AI/ML lifecycle, from deployment and orchestration to model management
Ability to translate complex business domains into software models using Domain-Driven Design, supported by SOLID and clean coding practices
Ability to adapt quickly, learn new tools, and work independently on complex problems
Computer Science or Math degree
English Intermediate+
Would be a plus:
Experience with algorithms, data structures and graphs
Knowledge of other programming languages (e.g., Kotlin, Java)
Deep experience in mathematics (especially linear algebra), geometry, computer vision 
Understanding of 2D / 3D technologies and software (for example OpenGL, WebGL, Raytracing, Blender)
What we offer:
 Great work environment that balances freedom and responsibility
 Our team is made up of friendly and passionate enthusiasts who are eager to help and share their knowledge
 We believe in work-life balance, so you'll receive around 30+ days of paid holidays per year
 Company computer equipment by request
 Education courses for our team members, and we're willing to allocate funds toward your training expenses

 Offline company events in Lithuania and online team-building

Note
: We only consider applications from candidates currently based in locations: Lithuania or Netherlands. Visa sponsorship is available if you hold primary residence with work authorization.

At Capgemini Engineering, the world leader in engineering services, we bring together a global team of engineers, scientists, and architects to help the world‚Äôs most innovative companies unleash their potential. From autonomous cars to life-saving robots, our digital and software technology experts think outside the box as they provide unique R&D and engineering services across all industries. Join us for a career full of opportunities. Where you can make a difference. Where no two days are the same.
Your Role
As a Data Scientist, you will play a pivotal role in contributing to the development and implementation of AI models and algorithms to address complex business challenges. 
‚Ä¢ Taking ownership of data science initiatives and projects, demonstrating a proactive and results-driven approach.
‚Ä¢ Analyzing and interpreting complex datasets to extract meaningful insights and providing data-driven recommendations.
‚Ä¢ Collaborating seamlessly with multidisciplinary teams to comprehend business needs, designing, and implementing statistical models and machine learning algorithms.
‚Ä¢ Leveraging big data technologies and distributed computing frameworks for processing and analyzing large volumes of data, or equivalent cloud computing expertise.
‚Ä¢ Developing and deploying predictive models and algorithms in real-world production environments.
‚Ä¢ Conducting comprehensive exploratory data analysis, feature engineering, and model validation.
‚Ä¢ Effectively communicating findings and insights to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
‚Ä¢ Embracing a data-driven, solution-oriented, and critical mindset, fostering teamwork and collaboration.
Your Profile 
‚Ä¢ 2 or more years of experience in data science roles with a focus on statistical modeling, machine learning, and predictive analytics.
‚Ä¢ Proficiency in programming languages, including SQL, Python, and distributed/cloud processing frameworks such as Pyspark.
‚Ä¢ Exhibit familiarity with advanced analytics libraries/frameworks such as Tensorflow, Keras, PyTorch, Scikit-learn.
‚Ä¢ Robust understanding of statistical analysis, hypothesis testing, and various machine learning techniques.
‚Ä¢ Hands-on experience with data visualization tools and libraries such as Seaborn, Matplotlib, or Plotly.
‚Ä¢ Proven ability to work with large datasets and experience in distributed computing frameworks, either on-premises or in the cloud.
‚Ä¢ Excellent communication skills, enabling effective collaboration within cross-functional teams.
‚Ä¢ Analytical mindset, attention to detail, and strong problem-solving skills for addressing complex data challenges.
‚Ä¢ Hold a solid academic foundation in a relevant discipline, such as Engineering, ; AI, or Computer Sciences.
‚Ä¢ Familiarity with cloud platforms (Azure, GCP, AWS is a plus).
‚Ä¢ Mandatory fluency in English.
What you¬¥ll love about us
Join a multicultural and inclusive team environment.
Enjoy a supportive atmosphere promoting work-life balance.
Hybrid work.
Your career growth is central to our mission. Our array of career growth programs and diverse professionals are crafted to support you in exploring a world of opportunities.
Access valuable training and certifications in cutting-edge technologies.
Engage in exciting national and international projects.
Health and life insurance.
Referral program with bonuses for talent recommendations.
Great office locations.
About Capgemini
Choosing Capgemini means choosing a company where you will be empowered to shape your career in the way you‚Äôd like, where you‚Äôll be supported and inspired by a collaborative community of colleagues around the world, and where you‚Äôll be able to reimagine what‚Äôs possible. Join us and help the world‚Äôs leading organizations unlock the value of technology and build a more sustainable, more inclusive world.
industries: Data Infrastructure and Analytics and Engineering Services

description:
About us
Themisphere is a fast-growing early-stage startup on a mission to transform how real estate data is processed and understood. We are pioneering the field of AI-powered solutions enabling real estate professionals to automate complex workflows, streamline data inflows, and enhance decision-making. Our software suite leverages cutting-edge LLMs and NLP pipelines to classify complex real estate data and seamlessly extract critical data points while delivering advanced analysis and performing complex calculations with unparalleled accuracy and scale.
About this role
As LLM / NLP Engineer at Themisphere, you will contribute to the technical charge in building and refining the core models that power our products. You'll work closely with the founders, the Head of AI and the product team to architect end-to-end machine learning solutions, from preprocessing raw documents to training domain-specific LLMs. This is a unique opportunity to shape a greenfield product and influence the technology roadmap of our evolving software portfolio.
Tasks
Develop and fine-tune LLM-based NLP models for document classification and information extraction.
Implement OCR, embeddings, NER, Encoder Only Classification and semantic search techniques to handle a wide range of document formats.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to incorporate user feedback and iteratively improve accuracy and performance.
Maintain up-to-date knowledge of the latest NLP and LLM research and apply best practices to our pipelines.
Requirements
Technical background:
 2+ years hands-on experience in NLP, including working with transformer-based models (e.g., BERT, GPT-4, LLaMa, ...).
Tooling & tech stack:
 proficiency in Python, PyTorch and efficiency tools.
Passionate about tech and AI, actively engaged in the community.
Problem-solving:
 strong analytical skills and the ability to break down complex problems into data-driven solutions.
Adaptability:
 enthusiasm for working in a dynamic startup environment where priorities can shift.
Collaboration:
 excellent communication and teamwork skills, comfortable working closely with product managers, annotators, and other engineers.
Why join us?
Have a direct impact on shaping the company's core product and technology direction.
Work with a team of passionate engineers and seasoned entrepreneurs on an industry-changing mission.
Possibility to grow into a leadership role, since you will be the backbone of the system built.
A lively, open and entrepreneurial culture with flat hierarchies, fast decision-making and efficient communication channels.
If you're excited about pushing the boundaries of NLP and applying LLM technology to transform the largest asset class in the world, we'd love to hear from you.
How to apply:
 
Please send your resume, LinkedIn and/or X profile, any relevant project links and GitHub repos via Join.com.
Let's shape the future of real estate with transformative technology together!
The minimum salary for this position is according to the IT collective agreement (EUR 3.724 gross monthly salary for full-time employment). Your entry level and starting salary will be based on your qualification and experience.

We work with clients across all major verticals, providing industry solutions for Financial Services, Manufacturing, Life Sciences and Healthcare, Technology and Services, Telecom and Media, Retail and CPG, and Public Services. Consolidated revenues as of 12 months ending December 2024 totaled $13.8 billion.

Excellent verbal and written communication skills and the ability to communicate clearly across all levels, both technical and non-technical.

A data-driven company in the building energy efficiency sector, founded in 2023, is looking for an 
Energy Data Scientist
.
The company helps hotels and other energy-intensive businesses reduce energy consumption by 10-20% using data collection, smart analytics, and digital twins.
Their platform integrates with building systems to detect inefficiencies ‚Äî such as pool pumps running unnecessarily or mismatches between HVAC operation and occupancy ‚Äî helping clients reduce costs by up to 30% and lower emissions.
They also support carbon footprint tracking (Scope 1, 2, 3), ensure compliance with sustainability standards (CSRD, ESG, B Corp, Green Key), and enable automated reporting.
You are offered a remote position based in Cyprus.
Your tasks:
Develop ML models to detect energy inefficiencies from smart meter data
Forecast energy consumption and optimize HVAC system performance
Build internal analytics workflows and scalable data pipelines
Collaborate with domain experts to turn insights into real-world actions
Explore and implement advanced ML/DL methods to drive innovation
Requirements
4+ years of experience in Data Science, ideally in energy, IoT, or smart buildings
Strong skills in Python, SQL, and time-series modeling (e.g., ARIMA, LSTM, Prophet)
Experience with machine learning and deep learning frameworks (e.g., TensorFlow, PyTorch)
Familiarity with large datasets, cloud environments (e.g., GCP), and model deployment
Excellent communication and data visualization skills
Master's or Ph.D. in a quantitative field (e.g., Math, Statistics, Computer Science)
English C1+

The role includes paid vacation and sick leave, aligned with standard practices for full-time positions
Stable, fast-growing company with a flat organizational structure

About us:
Planner 5D
 is a global hub for home design, uniting over 100+ million users in 230 territories around our planet (yes, we have 2 users connecting from Antarctica each month!). Our platform simplifies the home renovation process from concept to execution, and this process has never been more straightforward with our cutting-edge software. You don't need to be a professional designer to enhance your home or workspace. We are dedicated to streamlining the design experience, making the customization of dream homes accessible to everyone.
Our cross-platform presence spans Web, iOS, Android, Windows, and MacOS, ensuring seamless synchronization for our users. Planner 5D is more than just software; it's a vibrant community of enthusiastic and product-oriented professionals. From diverse backgrounds, our team collaborates across time zones, fueled by a shared passion to revolutionize the home design market.
We are constantly looking for like-minded talent eager to take ownership and drive innovation within our expanding suite of tools. Join us in shaping the future of home design.
At Planner 5D we are searching for a Senior Python Engineer who will join our team and will be building production-ready systems that directly support our product.
Responsibilities:
Design, build, and maintain scalable services that support the AI lifecycle, working closely with the research team to translate cutting-edge ideas into production-ready solutions
Develop tools for pre/post-processing data for AI and other usage
Develop tools for collecting and processing data
Design scalable pipelines for data collection, processing, and transformation powering next-generation AI systems 
Bring new models and features to production at scale with Triton Inference Server, ONNX, and TensorRT
Work across the spectrum from rapid MVPs and experimental prototypes to robust, long-term production-grade solutions
Work closely with ChatGPT API, LangChain
Required knowledge of:
Proficient in Python as the primary language with strong problem-solving and analytical skills
Demonstrated ability to design, deploy, and manage scalable backend platforms in production
Understanding Docker and Kubernetes concepts
Practical experience managing challenges throughout the AI/ML lifecycle, from deployment and orchestration to model management
Ability to translate complex business domains into software models using Domain-Driven Design, supported by SOLID and clean coding practices
Ability to adapt quickly, learn new tools, and work independently on complex problems
Computer Science or Math degree
English Intermediate+
Would be a plus:
Experience with algorithms, data structures and graphs
Knowledge of other programming languages (e.g., Kotlin, Java)
Deep experience in mathematics (especially linear algebra), geometry, computer vision 
Understanding of 2D / 3D technologies and software (for example OpenGL, WebGL, Raytracing, Blender)
What we offer:
 Great work environment that balances freedom and responsibility
 Our team is made up of friendly and passionate enthusiasts who are eager to help and share their knowledge
 We believe in work-life balance, so you'll receive around 30+ days of paid holidays per year
 Company computer equipment by request
 Education courses for our team members, and we're willing to allocate funds toward your training expenses
 English classes on our corporate platform
 Offline company events in Lithuania and online team-building
 Unlimited free Planner5D subscriptions
Note
: We only consider applications from candidates currently based in locations: Lithuania or Netherlands. Visa sponsorship is available if you hold primary residence with work authorization.

posting_title: Data Scientist - QuantumBlack, AI by McKinsey
description:
Who You'll Work With
Driving lasting impact and building long-term capabilities with our clients is not easy work. You are the kind of person who thrives in a high performance/high reward culture - doing hard things, picking yourself up when you stumble, and having the resilience to try another way forward.
In return for your drive, determination, and curiosity, we'll provide the resources, mentorship, and opportunities you need to become a stronger leader faster than you ever thought possible. Your colleagues‚Äîat all levels‚Äîwill invest deeply in your development, just as much as they invest in delivering exceptional results for clients. Every day, you'll receive apprenticeship, coaching, and exposure that will accelerate your growth in ways you won‚Äôt find anywhere else.
When you join us, you will have:
Continuous learning: Our learning and apprenticeship culture, backed by structured programs, is all about helping you grow while creating an environment where feedback is clear, actionable, and focused on your development. The real magic happens when you take the input from others to heart and embrace the fast-paced learning experience, owning your journey.
A voice that matters: From day one, we value your ideas and contributions. You‚Äôll make a tangible impact by offering innovative ideas and practical solutions. We not only encourage diverse perspectives, but they are critical in driving us toward the best possible outcomes.
Global community: With colleagues across 65+ countries and over 100 different nationalities, our firm‚Äôs diversity fuels creativity and helps us come up with the best solutions for our clients. Plus, you‚Äôll have the opportunity to learn from exceptional colleagues with diverse backgrounds and experiences.
World-class benefits: On top of a competitive salary (based on your location, experience, and skills), we provide a comprehensive benefits package to enable holistic well-being for you and your family.
Your Impact
As a Data Scientist, you will collaborate with clients and interdisciplinary teams to develop impactful analytics solutions, optimize code, and solve real-world business problems across diverse industries. You‚Äôll grow as a technologist by contributing to cutting-edge projects, R&D, and global conferences while working alongside world-class talent in a dynamic, innovative environment.
In this role, you will partner with clients to understand their needs and develop impactful analytics solutions. You will translate business problems into analytical challenges, build models to solve them, and ensure they are evaluated with relevant metrics. You‚Äôll also contribute to internal tools, participate in R&D projects, and have opportunities to attend and present at conferences like NIPS and ICML.
Your work will create real-world impact. By identifying patterns in data and delivering innovative solutions, you will help clients maintain their competitive advantage and transform their day-to-day operations. Your contributions will directly influence business outcomes and drive lasting improvements across industries.
You will be in Amsterdam or Brussels, and collaborate closely with data scientists, data engineers, machine learning engineers, designers, and product managers around the world working on interdisciplinary projects that use math, statistics, and machine learning to derive insights from raw data. You will help global companies transform their businesses and enhance performance across industries such as healthcare, automotive, energy, and elite sports.
At McKinsey, you‚Äôll thrive in an unparalleled environment for growth. You‚Äôll develop a sought-after perspective by connecting technology and business value, tackle real-life challenges across diverse industries, and collaborate with inspiring multidisciplinary teams, gaining a holistic understanding of AI and its potential to drive transformation.
Our Tech Stack
While we advocate for using the right tech for the right task, we often leverage the following technologies: Python, PySpark, the PyData stack, SQL, Airflow, Databricks, our own open-source data pipelining framework called Kedro, Dask/RAPIDS, container technologies such as Docker and Kubernetes, cloud solutions such as AWS, GCP, and Azure, and more.
Your Qualifications and Skills
Bachelors, Masters or PhD level in a discipline such as: computer science, machine learning, applied statistics, mathematics, engineering or artificial intelligence.
0-2+ years of professional experience in applying machine learning and data mining techniques to real problems with copious amounts of data
Programming experience (focus on machine learning): R and/or Python (must), SPSS, SAS, Ruby, Hadoop (valued).
Ability to prototype statistical analysis and modeling algorithms and apply these algorithms for data driven solutions to problems in new domains
Ability to independently own and drive model development, balancing demands and deadlines.
Demonstrated aptitude for analytics.
While we advocate for using the right tech for the right task, we often leverage the following technologies: Python, PySpark, the PyData stack, SQL, Airflow, Databricks, our own open-source data pipelining framework called Kedro, Dask/RAPIDS, container technologies such as Docker and Kubernetes, cloud solutions such as AWS, GCP, and Azure, and more.
Strong communication skills, both verbal and written, in English, with the ability to adjust your style to suit different perspectives and seniority levels. Knowledge of French or Dutch is valued.
Exceptional time management to meet your responsibilities in a complex and largely autonomous work environment.
Good presentation and communication skills, with the ability to explain complex analytical concepts to people from other fields. 
Willingness to travel.

*This is an international staff role based at our Headquarters in Washington, D.C. We offer visa and relocation support.
We improve lives
The IDB Group is a community of diverse, versatile, and passionate people who come together on a journey to improve lives in Latin America and the Caribbean. Our people find purpose and do what they love in an inclusive, collaborative, agile, and rewarding environment.
About This Position
We are looking for an analytical, impact-oriented and visually-savvy Data Scientist to join the Regional and Sectoral Data Group (RSD) within the Research Department (RES).
RSD coordinates and supports the efficient management, governance, and reuse of regional and sectoral data generated or obtained through research, knowledge, and operational work that is not produced in the Bank‚Äôs core systems but remains under the responsibility and/or custody of the IDB. This includes both traditional (censuses, surveys, administrative records) and non-traditional (social networks, digital exhaust, satellite imagery, mobile data, etc.) data sources used across VPS, VPC, SPD and other areas. RSD‚Äôs mandate is to turn scattered datasets into strategic, reusable assets that accelerate decisions safely and consistently across the institution.
As a Data Scientist, you will co-design reusable analytical products (from notebooks to production pipelines), apply statistical and machine learning methods, and translate findings into clear, policy-relevant narratives. You will work closely with data engineers and data governance specialists to ensure solutions are FAIR-aligned (Findable, Accessible, Interoperable, Reusable), privacy-preserving, and ready for pilot-to-production adoption by multiple teams.
What you‚Äôll do
Engage with stakeholders (operations, country teams, researchers) to frame decision problems and turn them into analytical backlogs with clear success metrics.
Analyze complex, multi-source datasets (surveys, admin records, geospatial/satellite, mobile, open data) to detect patterns and produce actionable insights.
Apply statistical/econometric and machine learning techniques (e.g., causal inference, prediction, classification, segmentation, small-area estimation, nowcasting) to support evidence-based and policy.
Build reusable components: features, model pipelines, and production-grade dataflows (in collaboration with data engineers) with version control, testing, and basic MLOps.
Develop interactive visual products (Power BI, Tableau, Plotly/Dash/Streamlit) and clear storytelling to make technical results accessible to non-technical audiences.
Implement data quality checks (schema, range, duplication, drift) and document data lineage/assumptions to ensure reproducibility and auditability.
Work with data governance specialists to uphold privacy-by-design, ethical AI practices, and compliant sharing (e.g., data-use agreements, tiered access).
Contribute to capacity building (playbooks, brown-bags, office hours) with country counterparts and internal teams; promote ‚Äúbuild once‚Äîreuse many‚Äù practices.
Continuously explore and evaluate new tools (including AI/LLMs), keeping a pragmatic focus on impact, robustness, and maintainability
What you'll need
Education: Master‚Äôs degree in Statistics, Economics, Computer/Data Science, or a related quantitative field.
Experience
At least 5 years in data science/analytics/applied research, demonstrating strong skills in statistical modeling, econometrics, machine learning, and quantitative analysis.
Proven experience building data systems and analytical products in international development organizations (e.g., MDBs/UN/INGOs/governments) and/or the private sector (e.g., tech, consulting, civic tech), including work with national statistical offices or government data producers.
Experience integrating traditional and non-traditional data (e.g., surveys + admin + geospatial/mobile) and taking solutions from prototype to pilot/production.
Familiarity with LAC context and working in multilingual, multi-stakeholder environments is highly desirable.
Languages: Proficiency in English and one of the other IDB official languages (Spanish, French, or Portuguese) is required.
Requirements
Citizenship: You are a citizen of one of our 48-member countries. We may offer assistance with relocation and visa applications for you and your eligible dependents.
Consanguinity: You have no family members (up to the fourth degree of consanguinity and second degree of affinity, including spouse) working at the IDB, IDB Invest, or IDB Lab.
Type of contract and duration
International staff contract, 36 months initially, renewable upon mutual agreement.
What we offer
The IDB group provides benefits that respond to the different needs and moments of an employee's life. These benefits include:
A competitive compensation package, including an annual base salary expressed on a net-of-tax basis
Leaves and vacations: 24 days of paid time off + 8 personal days + sick leave + gender-neutral parental leave
Health Insurance: the IDB Group provides employees and eligible dependents with a robust medical benefits program which covers medical, dental, vision, preventive care, and prescription drugs.
Pension plan: defined benefit pension plan that provides financial security and supports employees in planning for their future.
We offer assistance with relocation and visa applications for you and your family, when it applies.
Hybrid and flexible work schedules
Health and wellbeing: Access to our Health Services Center which provides preventive care and health education for employees.
Development support: We offer tools to boost your professional profile such as mentoring, 1:1 professional counseling, training and learning opportunities, language classes, mobility options, among others.
Other perks: Lactation Room, Daycare Center, Gym, Bike Racks, Parking, Spouse Career Program, and others.
Our culture
At the IDB, we work so everyone brings their best and authentic selves to work while finding their purpose. Our people consistently strive for excellence, and we recognize and celebrate the impact of their contributions.
In our efforts to drive innovation, we intentionally include all voices, cultivate a sense of belonging and champion fairness. We welcome individuals from underrepresented groups to join us and share their unique perspectives.
We ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodations to participate in the job interview process. If you require an accommodation to complete this application, please email us at accommodations@iadb.org.

About us:
Planner 5D
 is a global hub for home design, uniting over 100+ million users in 230 territories around our planet (yes, we have 2 users connecting from Antarctica each month!). Our platform simplifies the home renovation process from concept to execution, and this process has never been more straightforward with our cutting-edge software. You don't need to be a professional designer to enhance your home or workspace. We are dedicated to streamlining the design experience, making the customization of dream homes accessible to everyone.
Our cross-platform presence spans Web, iOS, Android, Windows, and MacOS, ensuring seamless synchronization for our users. Planner 5D is more than just software; it's a vibrant community of enthusiastic and product-oriented professionals. From diverse backgrounds, our team collaborates across time zones, fueled by a shared passion to revolutionize the home design market.
We are constantly looking for like-minded talent eager to take ownership and drive innovation within our expanding suite of tools. Join us in shaping the future of home design.
At Planner 5D we are searching for a Senior Python Engineer who will join our team and will be building production-ready systems that directly support our product.
Responsibilities:
Design, build, and maintain scalable services that support the AI lifecycle, working closely with the research team to translate cutting-edge ideas into production-ready solutions
Develop tools for pre/post-processing data for AI and other usage
Develop tools for collecting and processing data
Design scalable pipelines for data collection, processing, and transformation powering next-generation AI systems 
Bring new models and features to production at scale with Triton Inference Server, ONNX, and TensorRT
Work across the spectrum from rapid MVPs and experimental prototypes to robust, long-term production-grade solutions
Work closely with ChatGPT API, LangChain
Required knowledge of:
Proficient in Python as the primary language with strong problem-solving and analytical skills
Demonstrated ability to design, deploy, and manage scalable backend platforms in production
Understanding Docker and Kubernetes concepts
Practical experience managing challenges throughout the AI/ML lifecycle, from deployment and orchestration to model management
Ability to translate complex business domains into software models using Domain-Driven Design, supported by SOLID and clean coding practices
Ability to adapt quickly, learn new tools, and work independently on complex problems
Computer Science or Math degree
English Intermediate+
Would be a plus:
Experience with algorithms, data structures and graphs
Knowledge of other programming languages (e.g., Kotlin, Java)
Deep experience in mathematics (especially linear algebra), geometry, computer vision 
Understanding of 2D / 3D technologies and software (for example OpenGL, WebGL, Raytracing, Blender)
What we offer:
 Great work environment that balances freedom and responsibility
 Our team is made up of friendly and passionate enthusiasts who are eager to help and share their knowledge
 We believe in work-life balance, so you'll receive around 30+ days of paid holidays per year
 Company computer equipment by request
 Education courses for our team members, and we're willing to allocate funds toward your training expenses
 English classes on our corporate platform
 Offline company events in Lithuania and online team-building
 Unlimited free Planner5D subscriptions
Note
: We only consider applications from candidates currently based in locations: Lithuania or Netherlands. Visa sponsorship is available if you hold primary residence with work authorization.
