Job Description
WHAT YOU‚ÄôLL DO 
As a Senior Data Analyst within the Analytics & BI team at H&M Group, you will play a key role in shaping the future of our Commercial Development & Growth function. You will work closely with stakeholders across the organization to drive strategic initiatives and address the most important topics on our agenda.
To shine in this role you will‚Ä¶ 
Work with a wide range of stakeholders within Commercial Development & Growth to understand their analytical needs 
Lead and execute end-to-end analytical projects focused on areas such as retail strategy, store and online growth, customer behaviour and store planning 
Translate complex business questions into structured analysis plans, leveraging large internal and external datasets to deliver clear, data-driven recommendations to senior stakeholders. 
Perform ad-hoc analyses to quickly address urgent business questions and support fast decision making 
Contribute to the development of best practices, analytical frameworks, and ways of working within the Analytics & BI team 
Who You‚Äôll Work With
Commercial Development & Growth is a global function within the H&M brand and our mission is to set and deliver on the global customer experience strategy to strengthen our brand and enable profitable sales. Together we develop, expand and optimize all sales channels while securing conditions for efficient operations leveraged by tech and strong collaboration across the organization.
Our function plays a key role in delivering on our brand plan through an elevated, inspirational, and relevant shopping experience that is centered around our product and provides competitive convenience for our customers.
Who You Are
We are looking for people with‚Ä¶ 
A degree in a quantitative field such as engineering, business, economics, finance, or statistics. 
At least 5 years of experience in data, insight, or business analyst roles, either in-house or as a consultant. 
A proven ability to lead and deliver end-to-end analytical projects that drive business impact. 
Experience translating complex business questions into structured analysis plans and actionable insights. 
Experience from working with SQL to extract and transform data from large and complex datasets as well as using R or Python to analyse data further 
And people who are‚Ä¶ 
Strong communicators who can clearly present findings and influence stakeholders at all levels. 
Business-savvy and quick to interpret data in a broader commercial context. 
Proactive and self-driven, with the ability to manage multiple priorities and work independently. 
Collaborative team players who enjoy sharing knowledge and building capabilities across teams. 
Aligned with H&M‚Äôs values, with a passion for growth, innovation, and creating customer value. 
Who We Are
H&M Group is a global company of strong fashion brands and ventures. Our goal is to prove that there is no compromise between exceptional design, affordable prices, and sustainable solutions. We want to liberate fashion for the many, and our customers are at the heart of every decision we make.
We are made up of thousands of passionate and talented colleagues united by our shared culture and values. Together, we want to use our power, our scale, and our knowledge to push the fashion industry towards a more inclusive and sustainable future.
WHY YOU‚ÄôLL LOVE WORKING HERE‚ÄØ 
At H&M Group, we are proud to be a vibrant and welcoming company. We offer our employees attractive benefits with extensive development opportunities around the globe.
 All our employees are included in our‚ÄØH&M Incentive Program (HIP) 
All our employees receive a staff discount card, usable on all our H&M Group brands in stores and online. Brands covered by the discount are H&M (Beauty and Move included), COS, Weekday, Monki, H&M HOME, & Other Stories, ARKET, Afound. 
A dynamic, entrepreneurial environment where your insights directly influence strategic decisions. 
A collaborative culture that values innovation, continuous learning, and knowledge sharing. 
JOIN US 
Our uniqueness comes from a combination of many things ‚Äì our inclusive and collaborative culture, our strong values, and opportunities for growth. But most of all, it‚Äôs our people who make us who we are.
This is a full-time permanent position, starting as soon as possible according to the agreement. The role is based in our office in Stockholm, Sweden.
Apply by sending in your CV in English as soon as possible. Due to data policies, we only accept applications through our career page. 
The application deadline is September 11th
, but please note that we will begin reviewing applications on a rolling basis.
Take the next step in your career together with us. The journey starts here. We are eager to meet you!
We are committed to a recruitment process that is fair, equitable, and based on competency. We therefore kindly ask you to not attach a cover letter in your application.

SEND YOUR CV FOR EXPLORATORY INTERVIEWS - WE ARE LOOKING FOR OUR COLLEAGUES OF TOMORROW!
Data Analytics ‚Äì Corporate ‚Äì Milan
Hello, we‚Äôre L‚ÄôOr√©al.
We're not just building brands; we're shaping how the world experiences beauty (and it takes a lot of cool jobs to do it). Intrigued? Keep reading‚Äîthis might be the opportunity you‚Äôve been searching for.
A Day in the Life
As part of our Italian Data Analytics team, reporting to the Data Director, you‚Äôll play a key role in driving data-driven decision-making across the organization. Collaborating with the Europe Data Team and local divisions and stakeholders, you‚Äôll work on exciting projects that combine innovation, analytics, and business impact.
Here‚Äôs What Your Day-to-day Might Look Like
Analytics Solution Development: Analyze functional requirements, develop technical specifications, and create analytics solutions, including MVPs and POCs.
Ad Hoc Analytics: Conduct in-depth data analysis, identify patterns, and provide actionable insights to cross-functional teams.
Project Management: Define business cases, monitor KPIs, and manage project plans and budgets.
Continuous Improvement: Stay ahead of analytics trends and share knowledge within the team.
Quality Assurance: Ensure data accuracy and maintain high-quality documentation.
You‚Äôll Thrive In This Role If You
Have expertise in data manipulation and analysis tools (e.g., SQL, Python, R) and data visualization tools (e.g., Power BI).
Are skilled in statistical methods and have a strong attention to detail.
Excel in communication and presentation, making complex data accessible to all.
Are passionate about using data to drive business impact.
Speak fluent Italian and English and hold a Master‚Äôs degree in a relevant field.
What‚Äôs In It For You
A place for you to leave your comfort zone and grow beyond your potential (here, you‚Äôll be encouraged to try new things and take risks!).
Real responsibility from day 1‚Äîthere‚Äôs no sitting on the sidelines at L‚ÄôOr√©al.
An environment where people of every ethnicity, social background, age, religion, gender, and sexual orientation and disabilities are accepted, can speak up, will thrive, and are celebrated!
A place where you can contribute to something bigger! Many of our brands have societal/environmental causes to make a concrete difference.
Who We Are
L‚ÄôOr√©al is present in 150 markets on five continents. For more than a century, L‚ÄôOr√©al has devoted itself solely to ‚ÄòCreate beauty that moves the world‚Äô; it is now the industry world leader with ‚Ç¨42 billion consolidated sales. Together, we solve complex challenges at scale while making sure we stay committed to making the world a more inclusive and a better place for everyone & our planet.
We‚Äôre committed to guaranteeing inclusive recruitment processes and to advocating for hiring and promoting each candidate in an ethical and equitable way. The Group strictly prohibits discrimination against any applicant for employment because of the individual‚Äôs gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, visible and/or invisible disabilities, socio-economic and/or multicultural origins, health conditions, age, religion, or any other characteristics protected by law.

description:
Company Description
Experian is a global data and technology company, powering opportunities for people and businesses around the world. We help to redefine lending practices, uncover and prevent fraud, simplify healthcare, deliver digital marketing solutions, and gain deeper insights into the automotive market, all using our unique combination of data, analytics and software. We also assist millions of people to realise their financial goals and help them to save time and money.
We operate across a range of markets, from financial services to healthcare, automotive, agrifinance, insurance, and many more industry segments.
We invest in talented people and new advanced technologies to unlock the power of data and to innovate. A FTSE 100 Index company listed on the London Stock Exchange (EXPN), we have a team of 23,300 people across 32 countries. Our corporate headquarters are in Dublin, Ireland. Learn more at 
experianplc.com
.
Job Description
You'll work with the Senior Analyst and collaborate across teams to deliver impactful insights through advanced data visualization and analysis. You'll design Tableau dashboards, ensuring data accuracy, explaining performance trends and aligning reporting standards across the business. You will report into the Analytics Manager.
What You Will Do
Work with the Senior analyst and provide guidance to any junior analyst
Engage with stakeholders to gain deep understanding of business context
Develop and maintain complex Tableau dashboards, ensuring they meet business needs
Gather and prepare data for dashboard development
Ensure high level of accuracy and high-quality delivery of dashboards to agreed timelines
Co-ordinate with the wider analytics and data teams on best practices
Align with the wider analytics team on metric definitions and ensure consistency in reporting
Contribute to the creation and maintenance of data transformation layers
Qualifications
What you will bring:
2+ years experience in data analytics role
Experienced in SQL
Intermediate/advanced proficiency in Tableau and data visualization
Advanced data analysis skills
Advanced data preparation and interrogation techniques
Ability to communicate complex data to a variety of audiences
Experience with git version management
Additional Information
What you will get:
Personal Development - career pathway for professional growth supported by learning and development programs and unlimited access to online educational training courses, learning materials & book.
Work environment - excellent work conditions with friendly environment, recognized team spirit, and fun and quality recreation time.
Social benefit package including life insurance, food vouchers, additional health insurance, monthly flex allowance and internet coverage, corporate discounts, marriage and childbirth / adoption allowance, Multisport card, Sharesave plan, Employee assistance program, –∞ birthday gift and many other benefits!
Work-life balance - 25 days paid vacation, 1 additional day off for your birthday and extra 3 paid days for participation in Social responsibility event.
Opportunity for Flexible working hours and Home Office.
Experian is an Equal opportunity employer. Everyone can succeed at Experian and bring their whole self to work, irrespective of their gender, ethnicity, religion, colour, sexuality, physical ability or age. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know at the earliest opportunity.
This is a hybrid remote/in-office role.
Experian Careers - Creating a better tomorrow together
Find out what its like to work for Experian by clicking here

Job Description
Support the BI strategy for our European NIQ clients, enabling them to self-serve using our tools. Scope, build and deliver solutions that meet their basic recurrent data needs. Leverage NIQ and third parties solutions to meet your value delivered target
Qualifications: 
1-3 years of experience in client servicing in FMCG sector, especially in Business Intelligence 
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills 
Fluency in English 
Proven experience in BI tools and data analysis such as Discover (NIQ) or PowerBI, Microstrategy 
Previous experience working with: Microsoft Office (Word, Excel, PowerPoint) 
Passion for learning and applying new technologies to business solutions. 
Strong problem-solving skills and attention to detail 
Ability to work independently and as part of a team 
Demonstrated project management skills and ability to manage multiple priorities 
Building and maintaining effective work relationships 
Good collaboration skills to meet client needs and achieve organizational goals 
Ability to work in a remote-based environment 
Key responsibilities:
Assist NIQ clients in understanding and utilizing BI tools effectively 
Develop and propose BI solutions tailored to clients' recurrent data needs 
Deliver on performance tracking and success measurement 
Consult directly with clients and stakeholders on how to optimize uses of BI tools, applications for automation, analytics and reporting 
Identify leads from client interactions, be able to channel these needs into business opportunities 
Own end-to-end processes of in-scope reporting solutions across a variety of data sources (RMS, CPS, Omni) 
Collaborate with internal teams to ensure client requirements are met 
Work closely with manager and team leaders to assist in day-to-day BI customer support needs, deployment activities and transformation initiatives 
Aid in user education for platform-specific instruction to drive usage/adoption of Business Intelligence tools and supporting clients with our performance measurement services. 
Share best demonstrated practices in an open, creative and inclusive team culture. 
Collaborate with fellow BI and Insights teammates to identify business process improvements, project efficiencies and revenue opportunities. 
Be active and engaged in continuous learning opportunities to upskill yourself, our team and advance our core areas of expertise. 
Additional Information
Our Benefits
Flexible working environment
Volunteer time off
LinkedIn Learning
Employee-Assistance-Program (EAP)
About NIQ
NIQ is the world‚Äôs leading consumer intelligence company, delivering the most complete understanding of consumer buying behavior and revealing new pathways to growth. In 2023, NIQ combined with GfK, bringing together the two industry leaders with unparalleled global reach. With a holistic retail read and the most comprehensive consumer insights‚Äîdelivered with advanced analytics through state-of-the-art platforms‚ÄîNIQ delivers the Full View‚Ñ¢. NIQ is an Advent International portfolio company with operations in 100+ markets, covering more than 90% of the world‚Äôs population.
For more information, visit NIQ.com
Want to keep up with our latest updates?
Follow us on: LinkedIn | Instagram | Twitter | Facebook
Our commitment to Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion
At NIQ, we are steadfast in our commitment to fostering an inclusive workplace that mirrors the rich diversity of the communities and markets we serve. We believe that embracing a wide range of perspectives drives innovation and excellence. All employment decisions at NIQ are made without regard to race, color, religion, sex (including pregnancy, sexual orientation, or gender identity), national origin, age, disability, genetic information, marital status, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by applicable laws. We invite individuals who share our dedication to inclusivity and equity to join us in making a meaningful impact. To learn more about our ongoing efforts in diversity and inclusion, please visit the https://nielseniq.com/global/en/news-center/diversity-inclusion

We power people‚Äôs progress. 
At Preply, we‚Äôre all about creating life-changing learning experiences. We help people discover the magic of the perfect tutor, craft a personalized learning journey, and stay motivated to keep growing. Our approach is human-led, tech-enabled - and it‚Äôs creating real impact. So far, 90,000 tutors have delivered over 20 million lessons to learners in more than 175 countries. Every Preply lesson sparks change, fuels ambition, and drives progress that matters.
Meet The Team
At Preply, we‚Äôre reimagining the way we support language learning!
Our B2B team is at the forefront of enabling global companies to unlock language skills across their workforces. As our B2B offering continues to grow, we‚Äôre looking for a Junior Data Analyst - Insights to join our team and support our data driven decision-making.
You‚Äôll be part of the Data chapter and embedded in the B2B squad, working alongside a senior data scientist, analytical engineer, and analytics manager. The role is ideal for someone who already has an analytical foundation and is eager to learn, grow, and make an impact in a dynamic and varied business environment.
We have an outstanding data science organization: we work throughout the company - in the product, business, and platform teams - using analysis, experimentation, data visualisation, and machine learning techniques. We are uniquely placed to use data to help make better decisions and improve data literacy across Preply.
What You‚Äôll Be Doing
Discover insights and inform the B2B team by running queries and extracting data using SQL and spreadsheets
Help build, improve and maintain data visualisations and reports to track B2B performance
Collaborate with the team on analyses related to customer success, product usage, and sales goals
Gain a deep understanding of B2B business metrics and use data to identify patterns or areas for improvement
Partner with your manager and peers to build skills and grow your analytical toolkit
Measure the impact of initiatives in order to identify growth opportunities and iterate our strategy
Create reporting that the team can use to evaluate and track business performance and take action upon
What You Need To Succeed
Some experience in the data science & analytics field (around 1-2 years' experience or internships preferably)
Strong working knowledge of SQL for querying and data exploration
Comfortable with spreadsheets (Google Sheets or Excel), including functions, charts, and pivot tables
Some experience with data visualisation (can be in any tool)
Some knowledge of quantitative fields (statistics, mathematics, etc.)
Some coding skills in one or more analytics languages (Python, SQL, etc.)
Strong curiosity, problem solving and problem finding skills, and interest in learning about business context and impact
Good written and verbal communication skills - B1 English is a must
Nice To Have
University degree in statistics, economics, econometrics, or a relevant field (or equivalent business experience).
Experience working in startups, tech, or digital B2B environments
Previous experience in Marketplaces and/or digital businesses (B2B, B2C, B2B2C)
Basic knowledge of business metrics like retention, conversion, or usage patterns
Knowledge of Looker, Tableau, Amplitude or other BI tools;
Knowledge of version controlling tools (GitHub, GitLab, etc.).
Why You‚Äôll Love It At Preply
An open, collaborative, dynamic and diverse culture;
A generous monthly allowance for lessons on Preply.com, Learning & Development budget and time off for your self-development;
A competitive financial package with equity, leave allowance and health insurance;
Access to free mental health support platforms;
Access to Gympass-partnered wellness and gym centers throughout Spain to promote and support well-being and physical health; 
The opportunity to unlock the potential of learners and tutors through language learning and teaching in 175 countries (and counting!).
Our Principles
Care to change the world - We are passionate about our work and care deeply about its impact to be life changing.
We do it for learners - For both Preply and tutors, learners are why we do what we do. Every day we focus on empowering tutors to deliver an exceptional learning experience.
Keep perfecting - To create an outstanding customer experience, we focus on simplicity, smoothness, and enjoyment, continually perfecting it as every detail matters.
Now is the time - In a fast-paced world, it matters how quickly we act. Now is the time to make great things happen.
Disciplined execution - What makes us disciplined is the excellence in our execution. We set clear goals, focus on what matters, and utilize our resources efficiently.
Dive deep - We leverage business acumen and curiosity to investigate disparities between numbers and stories, unlocking meaningful insights to guide our decisions.
Growth mindset - We proactively seek growth opportunities and believe today's best performance becomes tomorrow's starting point. We humbly embrace feedback and learn from setbacks.
Raise the bar - We raise our performance standards continuously, alongside each new hire and promotion. We build diverse and high-performing teams that can make a real difference.
Challenge, disagree and commit - We value open and candid communication, even when we don‚Äôt fully agree. We speak our minds, challenge when necessary, and fully commit to decisions once made.
One Preply - We prioritize collaboration, inclusion, and the success of our team over personal ambitions. Together, we support and celebrate each other's progress.
Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion
Preply is committed to creating a diverse and inclusive environment where people from all backgrounds can thrive. Different opinions and viewpoints are key ingredients in our success as a multicultural Ed-Tech company.
Preply will consider all applications for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, disability, age or veteran status. Together, we are The World Class.

description:
Data Analyst (Cloud & BI Solutions) 
Do you enjoy turning business challenges into data-driven insights? Are you comfortable working with stakeholders, analyzing datasets, and guiding others in their growth? We‚Äôre looking for a Data Analyst to strengthen our team and help shape impactful, cloud-based data solutions.
What you‚Äôll be doing:
Work closely with business stakeholders to understand processes and translate their needs into clear data requirements.
Frame business questions into testable hypotheses that lead to real insights.
Prepare and analyze datasets, collaborating with data engineers and modelers to create scalable solutions.
Apply data modeling approaches (both dimensional and relational) to support reporting and analytics.
Design compelling data visualizations and dashboards using tools such as Power BI.
Contribute to the development of new data propositions and analytical frameworks.
What you bring:
A completed WO or HBO degree (technical background preferred) with academic-level thinking and problem-solving ability.
At least 3 years of experience as a Data Analyst or in a consultancy role involving data-driven projects.
Experience working with SQL (Python and/or R is a plus).
Familiarity with business intelligence and reporting tools.
Experience with project methodologies such as Agile, Scrum, or DevOps is an advantage.
Fluency in Dutch and English.

About Happy Mammoth:
Happy Mammoth is a high-growth e-commerce company dedicated to empowering women‚Äôs health through natural, science-backed supplements focused on gut, digestive, and hormonal wellness. As a performance-driven company, we are passionate about making a meaningful, lasting impact on our customers' lives. You can learn more about us at https://happymammoth.com/.
Before you dive deeper, please note the following key points:
This is a fully remote contractor role, available full-time
The role requires availability during EU hours (GMT)
At Happy Mammoth, you can expect:
A strong salary package
A welcoming and nurturing work environment, with colleagues from around the world
A fast-paced, dynamic, and non-corporate atmosphere where adaptability is key
The chance to be part of our exciting global expansion journey
Flexible working hours
Free access to courses, books and Masterminds
Opportunities for professional growth and development
Job Summary:
As a Data Analyst at Happy Mammoth, you‚Äôll be at the heart of our data-driven efforts. Your insights will directly influence our strategies to optimize customer acquisition, retention, and lifetime value. In this role, you‚Äôll dive into customer behavior, analyze marketing performance, and provide actionable insights that drive our direct-response and B2C marketing initiatives.
Responsibilities:
Collect, analyze, and interpret data to uncover trends, patterns, and insights that inform our business strategies
Build, maintain, and automate dashboards and reports to track KPIs, including ROAS, CPA, conversion rates, CLTV, and customer retention metrics
Work closely with cross-functional teams, such as marketing, product, and finance, to provide data-driven insights that support campaign performance and strategic marketing decisions
Provide ad hoc analysis to address specific business questions
Ensure data quality and accuracy by regularly validating and cleansing datasets
Communicate findings effectively to both technical and non-technical stakeholders through reports, presentations, and storytelling
Qualifications:
Proven experience in data analysis, preferably with a focus on e-commerce
Proficiency in SQL and Excel
Proven experience in data visualization tools (e.g. Looker Data Studio, Looker, Power BI or similar)
Hands-on experience with cloud-based data warehouses and architectures (familiarity with Google BigQuery is a strong asset)
Strong analytical skills and attention to detail
Effective communicator with the ability to convey complex data insights clearly
What will set you apart:
You have a genuine hunger for success in all parts of your life
You thrive taking action, taking responsibility and getting things done before deadlines
You‚Äôre able to self-manage based upon the overall scope and work required
You‚Äôre able to diagnose and solve technical problems quickly
You're able to work as part of a team and actively contribute to conversations
A willingness to learn and grow with the business
CVs should be in English

About us:
Fleming was founded with the goal of creating high-quality digital health, wellness, and AI programs globally. We seek to make people's lives happier, healthier, and more productive by creating empowering self-growth products for everyday life. Our team of experts ranges from innovative AI specialists, creative minds, and imaginative designers to professional medical doctors and data scientists, working together as one to help millions of people around the world.
With 1,2+ million customers worldwide, we're providing unique opportunities, attracting talents to join our fast-growing team, and creating innovative brands in a rapidly growing digital health industry. If you think you're bold, ambitious, and not afraid to challenge yourself, let's talk!
We are looking:
We are seeking a Data Analyst with Data Engineering experience to strengthen our data-driven decision-making. You will primarily focus on analyzing data, building reports, and supporting stakeholders with insights, while also contributing to data integration and improving workflows where needed. This is a great opportunity for a mid-level analyst who enjoys working with both data insights and the foundations that make those insights possible.
Get ready to:
Use BigQuery, SQL, and Looker Studio to deliver accurate and timely insights.
Analyze data and create reports that help stakeholders make informed decisions.
Identify and resolve data issues such as quality gaps, discrepancies, and missing values.
Contribute to the improvement of data pipelines and transformations (not necessarily owning them end-to-end).
Apply SQL and data modeling practices to support reporting and analytics.
Assist with data validation and monitoring to ensure reliability of dashboards and reports.
Use R or Python for data analysis, automation, and solving more advanced analytical problems.
Communicate results and recommendations effectively with technical and non-technical teams.
Support colleagues with reporting and analytics tasks, sharing best practices and solutions.
We expect you to:
Have solid SQL skills: ability to join and manipulate different data types, debug code, and optimize queries.
Have experience working with BI/reporting tools (e.g., Looker Studio, Power BI, or Tableau).
Have knowledge or experience working with R or Python for data analysis and automation.
Be familiar with basic data engineering concepts (e.g., ETL/ELT, data modeling, automation), with a willingness to grow these skills further.
Communicate clearly and consistently about progress, challenges, and findings.
Be curious, detail-oriented, and eager to learn.
Be fluent in English and Lithuanian.
Our Benefits & Perks:
Office Location
: A peaceful, green workspace in the heart of Antakalnis, Sapiegos Park. Perfect for focus and fresh air.
Parking Compensation:
 We cover your parking expenses, so you can commute stress-free.
Work-from-Home Flexibility
: Hybrid setup, 4 days in the office, 1 day from home. We stay flexible when life happens.
Pet-Friendly Office
: Bring your furry friend to work.
Work Tools
: We‚Äôll set you up with a MacBook and all the tools you need to do your work.
Grow Your Skills:
 We believe in learning and growth. If you need extra training or courses to level up, we‚Äôre here to support you.
Daily Meals
: Lunch is prepared in the office every day. On Fridays, we mix it up, sometimes we head out to San Diego Pub, other times we order in pizza, sushi, or other.
Snacks & Refreshments
: Unlimited drinks, snacks, fresh fruits, and veggies.
Team Events
: team buildings, summer/winter events, and activities to keep the vibes going.
Birthday Surprise
: We celebrate your birthday with a gift.
Referral Bonus Program
: Know someone awesome? Get rewarded for helping us grow.
Salary
Gross salary range is 3500-5000 EUR/month.
*Salary is negotiable depending on experience.

Dow Jones Barcelona Job ID About Our Organization
Dow Jones is a global provider of news and business information, delivering content to consumers and organizations around the world across multiple formats, including print, digital, mobile and live events. Dow Jones has produced unrivaled quality content for more than 130 years and today has one of the world's largest news-gathering operations globally. It is home to leading publications and products including the flagship Wall Street Journal, America's largest newspaper by paid circulation; Barron's, MarketWatch, Mansion Global, Financial News, Investor's Business Daily, Factiva, Dow Jones Risk & Compliance, Dow Jones Newswires, OPIS and Chemical Market Analytics. Dow Jones is a division of News Corp (Nasdaq: NWS, NWSA; ASX: NWS, NWSLV).
About The Team
Our Technology team drives the evolution of our Technology, Engineering, Data, Product and User Experience functions. With a keen focus on delivering cutting-edge solutions, we shape the digital landscape for our customers, readers, and users. From revolutionizing visuals to optimizing tools and harnessing the power of data, mobile, video, and social platforms, our team is committed to providing a seamless and immersive experience across all touchpoints. Collaborating closely with our newsrooms and strategic partners, we spearhead the development of groundbreaking products and technologies.
About The Role
The B2C Analytics team focuses on developing analytics solutions to help the organization make better data driven decisions. Our team is passionate about enabling others to use data and analysis to measure and monitor performance, identify risks and opportunities and find ways to continually add value.
This role will primarily support the Consumer side of the business, which includes WSJ, Barron's, MarketWatch and more; but may also include exposure to other areas of the business, such as advertising and the professional information business. The ideal candidate will have previous experience in developing datasets, dashboards and data solutions that drive core insights. This position will report to the Senior Manager, B2C Analytics.
You Will
Develop partnerships with Product, Marketing, Newsroom, Finance, Data Collection, Data Engineering and other B2C Stakeholder Business teams and work across all levels and areas of the organization.
Build data project roadmaps based on Business teams' priorities.
Build a thorough understanding of all the B2C data sources that we use in our Analysis projects
Partner with data engineers and data collection colleagues to collect, cleanse and consistently organize data.
Analyze large datasets to surface trends and deliver recommendations with tangible business outcomes.
Create intuitive reports, dashboards and data solutions using visualization tools (e.g. Tableau, Looker Studio)
Continuously identify ways to improve and refine processes around data and reporting
Ensure the quality of data and reporting, and partner with teams to improve accuracy and consistency
Communicate technical information clearly to both technical and non-technical audiences
You Have
Up to 2 years of experience in similar roles.
The ability to own your projects proactively and coordinate with multiple stakeholders.
Undergraduate degree or equivalent in combination of training and experience in a quantitative field such as Data Science, Statistics, Mathematics, or related disciplines.
Experience with SQL and knowledge of Excel/Sheets. Familiarity with Github, Python/R.
Experience with data visualizations tools and techniques, and using data to tell a story (e.g. Tableau, Looker, etc.)
Experience with web analytics tools (particularly Google Analytics 4 and Adobe Analytics).
Our Benefits
Comprehensive Healthcare Plans for you and your family (paid by Dow Jones)
Extra paid Time Off (30 days of holidays/year)
Possibility to work remotely for 3 months/year (desplazamiento program) or one week of remote work per quarter
Meal benefit with Pluxee (171‚Ç¨/month on top of your salary)
Retirement Plans (Dow Jones will pay 2% of a members Pensionable Salary and match employee contribution up to a maximum of 3 %).
Comprehensive Insurance Plans
Well-being Resources (200 USD allowance per quarter, Classpass, etc.)
Family Care Benefits & Caregiving Support
Subscription Discounts
Employee Referral Program
\
This is a hybrid remote/in-office role, based in Barcelona.

EEO/Disabled/Vets. We strongly encourage applications from all qualified individuals, including women, people with disabilities, and those from underrepresented groups. Dow Jones is committed to providing reasonable accommodation for qualified individuals with disabilities, in our job application and/or interview process. If you need assistance or accommodation in completing your application, due to a disability, email us at talentresourceteam@dowjones.com. Please put "Reasonable Accommodation" in the subject line and provide a brief description of the type of assistance you need. This inbox will not be monitored for application status updates.

Since 1882, Dow Jones has been finding new ways to bring information to the world‚Äôs top business entities. Beginning as a niche news agency in an obscure Wall Street basement, Dow Jones has grown to be a worldwide news and information powerhouse, with prestigious brands including The Wall Street Journal, Dow Jones Newswires, Factiva, Barron‚Äôs, MarketWatch and Financial News.
This longevity and success is due to a relentless pursuit of accuracy, depth and innovation, enhanced by the wisdom of past experience and a solid grasp on the future ahead. More than its individual brands, Dow Jones is a modern gateway to intelligence, with innovative technology, advanced data feeds, integrated solutions, expert research, award-winning journalism and customizable apps and delivery systems to bring the information that matters most to customers, when and where they need it, every day.

Deine Aufgaben bei uns
Your responsibilities
 
Manage and analyze large datasets from multiple sources (SQL databases, Google Ads, Meta Ads, TikTok Ads, etc.)
Automate recurring reporting processes (Google Sheets, Looker Studio, etc.) and reduce manual work
Build dashboards and reporting pipelines that provide clear insights into campaign and funnel performance
Conduct advanced statistical analysis (regressions, predictive models, machine learning approaches, attribution models) to uncover insights and optimize decision-making
Support the team in developing and refining a 
multi-touch attribution model
Collaborate with the marketing team to ensure data accuracy and transparency across all channels
Das bringst Du mit
Your profile
 
Strong background in data analysis with 
excellent SQL skills
Solid understanding of marketing metrics and KPIs (especially in paid performance marketing)
Experience in automating data workflows (Python, R, or similar is a plus)
Knowledge of statistical methods, regressions, or machine learning techniques (plus)
Hands-on experience with data visualization and reporting tools (Looker Studio, Tableau, Power BI, or similar)
A structured and detail-oriented working style with a passion for solving complex problems
Proficiency in English; German is a plus but not required
Das bieten wir Dir
What we offer
 
A chance to make a real impact in healthcare recruiting
A dynamic and fast-growing environment with room to take ownership
Collaboration with a passionate and international team
Hybrid work model from our Berlin office
Competitive salary and development opportunities
As Marketing Data Analyst at Pflegia, you will be the go-to person for everything related to marketing data. You will structure, analyze, and automate our reporting processes to enable data-driven decision-making at scale. You will work closely with our performance marketing and product teams, but your main focus will be 
data analysis and automation
 rather than campaign management.  
At Pflegia, our mission is to transform the healthcare recruiting industry by connecting qualified nursing professionals with the right employers faster and more efficiently. As we continue to grow, we are looking for a 
Marketing Data Analyst (m/f/d)
 to strengthen our marketing team with deep expertise in data, automation, and advanced analytics.

With a holistic retail read and the most comprehensive consumer insights‚Äîdelivered with advanced analytics through state-of-the-art platforms‚ÄîNIQ delivers the Full View‚Ñ¢. NIQ is an Advent International portfolio company with operations in 100+ markets, covering more than 90% of the world‚Äôs population.

The position is responsible for classification and identification of the provided information in order to systematize and recognize
Process the information with predefined requirements in order to be used from other teams/client in the next stages of data processing
This role has responsibility for meeting the deadlines of preparing the information with maximum performance, depending on the nature of the tasks

Maintain consistent high level of quality

You have:

Working level of English (B1 - B2)
Excellent communication skills

3 additional non-working days annually

Health insurance
Last but not least ‚Äì GfK Sofia office is located close to the city center and easily accessible from any point by public transportation ‚Äì 47A Tsarisgradsko Shose Blvd

Are you passionate about information hidden in data, programming, and finance?
In Swedbank you have the opportunity to:
Be a part of the Business Steering team in Corporates & Institutions, focusing on the corporate segment in Swedbank‚Äôs Business
Monitor portfolios, perform ‚Äòdeep dives‚Äô in large amounts of data using SQL. Assist management and other stakeholders with data driven insights
Use your skills within programming and statistics to process data 
Through data driven insights help the corporate business to take informed decisions
Understand how operational processes / policies impact KPIs across a diverse range of disciplines and work with colleagues to show how changing processes / steering can lead to better outcomes
What is needed in this role:
A creative and problem-solving mindset as well as an ambition to make a difference
An interest in the corporate banking business
An understanding of the product universe within a bank. Preferable also experience with the information in Swedbank‚Äôs data warehouses 
Excellent communication skill to be able to convey ideas and analytical results effectively verbally and in writing to a non-technical audience
University degree in a technical field such as statistics, mathematics, economics or engineering
Practical experience, minimum 2 years, within an analytical framework (e.g. R / Python / SAS) and experience using SQL.
With us, you can experience:
Personal and professional growth through self-leadership and continuous development.
Meaningful work that positively impacts our workplace, our customers, and society.
An open and collaborative culture that encourages cross-functional teamwork and provides networking opportunities.
A supportive and inclusive environment that promotes a balanced and sustainable work-life, with flexible working conditions when suitable for the role.
Benefits such as our share based reward program Eken, company pension plan, employee offer for banking products, health insurance.
"Join our team and...

We believe in diversity and think it is very important to have an Open and Caring work environment. You will be given responsibility and we will be there to support you!"
 Johan Carlberg , 
your future manager

Swedbank does not discriminate anybody based on gender, age, sexual orientation or sexual identity, ethnicity, religion or disability ‚Äì everybody is welcome.

description:
Descrierea pozitiei
Cautam un coleg / o colega care sa sprijine buna desfasurare a celor doua linii de business Nespresso, B2C si B2B, prin realizarea de rapoarte si analize de clienti si vanzari, de campanii pentru clienti si de campanii de E-mail Marketing.
O zi obisnuita ar decurge astfel:
Propui, identifici, creezi si obtii rapoarte pentru evaluarea comportamentului clientilor Nespresso, B2B si B2C, a vanzarilor si a campaniilor pentru clienti.
Realizezi prezentari interne privind rezultatele campaniilor.
Evaluezi Best Practices CRM disponibile la nivel international si coordonezi activitatea pentru obtinerea de rapoarte si insight-uri relevante pe plan local.
Oferi sprijin in propunerea, gestionarea »ôi evaluarea calendarului anual cu activitati CRM: promotii si campanii pentru reactivare, prevenire inactivare, crestere frecventa, crestere comanda de cafea, loializare etc.
Setezi mecanismele promotionale in Neosoft. 
Oferi sprijin catre B2C & CRM Manager la estimarea de volume si de KPIs de CRM la nivel de luna. 
Realizezi analiza competitiva si cercetarile de piata pentru a identifica oportunitati de crestere.
Monitorizezi tendintele din industrie si comportamentul consumatorilor pentru a sustine planificarea strategica.
Construiesti rapoarte in sistemul de gestionare a bazei de date (SAP HANA, Snowflake, Knime, Power BI) si sprijini departamentele Nespresso.
Cum poti avea succes?
Foarte bune cunostinte MS Office: Excel, Power Point
Cunostinte avansate de limba engleza
Cunostinte SQL, BI
Studii superioare finalizate
Cunoasterea / intelegerea principiilor de marketing
Excelente abilitati de comunicare si relationare
Ce oferim?
O cultura axata pe incluziune, diversitate si inovatie
Mediu de lucru international
Tichete de masa
Bonus de performanta
Bonusuri de Craciun si de Paste
Abonament medical pentru angajatii nostri, sot/sotie si copiii lor
Bookster
PetWork
Programe "Mental health"
Zile de concediu suplimentare care cresc odata cu vechimea la Nestle
Espressor Nespresso si ratie lunara de capsule Nespresso.

For 30 years, the incredible minds at Cognyte around the world have worked closely together and put their expertise to work to keep up with constantly evolving technological and criminal trends, and help make the world a safer place with leading investigative analytics software solutions.
We are defined by our dedication to doing good, and this translates to business success, meaningful work friendships, a can-do attitude, and deep curiosity.
As a Cognyter you will:
Analyze large and complex datasets across departments (Sales, Marketing, Customer Success, etc.) to identify trends, issues, and actionable insights
Translate business needs into structured data analysis, delivering impactful dashboards, reports, and recommendations
Support strategic decision-making through business intelligence tools and data storytelling
Partner with cross-functional teams to drive data-driven initiatives across the organization
Collaborate with IT and GTM teams to evaluate current Salesforce (SFDC) usage, identify workflow gaps, and enhance CRM-related processes
Help design, document, and implement improvements in Salesforce to increase efficiency, automation, and data integrity
Act as a bridge between business and technical teams to ensure CRM updates meet operational needs
Maintain high data quality and governance standards within Salesforce
Provide user training and support change management for Salesforce process updates
For that mission, you‚Äôll need:
3+ years of experience in a data analyst role with a strong focus on data-driven insights and CRM optimization
Hands-on experience with 
Salesforce (SFDC)
, including workflows, reports, dashboards, and data governance

A strong salary package

Job Summary:
As a Data Analyst at Happy Mammoth, you‚Äôll be at the heart of our data-driven efforts. Your insights will directly influence our strategies to optimize customer acquisition, retention, and lifetime value. In this role, you‚Äôll dive into customer behavior, analyze marketing performance, and provide actionable insights that drive our direct-response and B2C marketing initiatives.
Responsibilities:
Collect, analyze, and interpret data to uncover trends, patterns, and insights that inform our business strategies
Build, maintain, and automate dashboards and reports to track KPIs, including ROAS, CPA, conversion rates, CLTV, and customer retention metrics
Work closely with cross-functional teams, such as marketing, product, and finance, to provide data-driven insights that support campaign performance and strategic marketing decisions
Provide ad hoc analysis to address specific business questions
Ensure data quality and accuracy by regularly validating and cleansing datasets
Communicate findings effectively to both technical and non-technical stakeholders through reports, presentations, and storytelling
Qualifications:
Proven experience in data analysis, preferably with a focus on e-commerce

location: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
description:
Job Description:
Are you passionate about solving business challenges through data? Do you have robust experience with data analytics, data engineering and data visualization methodologies and tools? Are you good at collaborating and communicating with various stakeholders, collecting and understanding their needs? Are you a structured person with the right mix of analytical skills and business acumen? If so, join us! 
What the job is ...
We are a team of Data Analysts and Process Managers who form the Business Performance and Improvement unit within Product Management. The role of our unit is to drive all projects, initiatives, analytics and automation required to lead the transformation of Product Management towards a data and process centric organization. Our end goal? Drive growth, boost business performance and competitiveness.
The position is located in Copenhagen, Denmark.
In your position as Data Analyst you will be required to:
 Support the development of an online platform by leading the work package responsible for data collection, data analysis and data quality 
 Work and collaborate with cross-functional teams to identify business challenges and opportunities that can be addressed through data analytics and automation. 
 Lead the development of digital tools, automation and dashboards to support decision making, corporate presentations, etc. 
 Process and transform complex, high-volume data from multiple sources. 
 Acquire datasets and ensure data quality and availability. 
 Communicate complex analytical concepts to non-technical stakeholders. 
 Support the data-driven transformation of Product Management. 
What do you offer?
You are an enthusiastic team player, self-driven, proactive, structured and autonomous with a business-oriented mindset. You are curious and enjoy providing solutions to business needs. You demonstrate excellent stakeholder management and communication skills, with the ability to translate complex analytical and technical concepts to non-technical audiences.
Ideally, you have:
 3-5 years of professional experience in Data Analytics 
 MSc in Mathematics, Computer science, or a related field. 
 Good experience of programming languages such as Python and R. 
 Proven experience in developing and implementing analytics solutions in a business context. 
 Fluency in English. 
What does your next challenge look like?
At SATAIR, we believe in sustainable aviation that allows people to travel and connect across the globe.
We are on a mission to provide world class material solutions that keep aircraft flying and extend their lifespan.
In Satair, you can challenge the status quo, pioneer new ways of working, and generate real value for airlines and suppliers worldwide.
Being part of the Airbus family gives us the opportunity to live a global mindset, working in international and diverse teams and collaborating across functions, sites and cultures.
If you want to work as one team embracing a can-do attitude in a demanding environment, then we offer a great place to explore, learn, and grow, making an impact on aviation‚Äôs digital and sustainable transformation.
 Come on board and join us at Satair, an Airbus Services Company! 
About SATAIR
Satair offers first class material management solutions in the aftermarket business of the aviation industry. We are working to be the most customer-centric organization in providing commercial aviation spares parts to make the world continue flying. We are constantly taking customer experience to new levels by improving how we fulfill and deliver customers‚Äô orders quickly and accurately, anywhere in the world. To meet this goal, Satair is continually striving to innovate and provide best-in-class service levels by pioneering new products and services in a fast growing business environment.
With our global functional organization spanning across 11 different sites and locations worldwide with more than 1.800 people and a turnover of over $3.0 billion, you will be part of a truly global family.
Our customers have the ultimate goal to operate their fleet and our Airbus aircraft safely, efficiently in a cost-time-quality effective manner and of course with the expected comfort level for their customers. We at Satair do everything to support our customers in this.
If you want to know more about our business, have a closer look at our website www.SATAIR.com or check out our SATAIR Youtube Channel at www.youtube.com/sataircompany !
What do we offer at SATAIR?
At SATAIR, you will find much more than a job - we offer you the possibility of growing both your personal and professional capacities in a fun, supportive and informal working environment, where you will be encouraged to engage, share knowledge and ideas.
SATAIR is committed to achieving workforce diversity and creating an inclusive working environment. We love to bring in people with different backgrounds and experiences as we believe it enhances our performance immensely!
Here is a selection of some of the benefits we offer our employees in Copenhagen:
 Competitive remuneration, including short term incentive bonus on all levels 
 Work/life balance: hybrid working, flex time, maternity/paternity/parental leave, 29 days of holiday + senior and flex days 
 Personal development: personalized development plans, large portfolio of learning solutions and many internal mobility opportunities, both locally and globally 
 Health and well-being: Health insurance, in-house canteen with many healthy options 
Come on board and join us at Satair, an Airbus Services Company
 Please send us your application as soon as possible 
 to get the opportunity to become part of an exceptional global team!
We welcome all applications irrespective of social and cultural background, age, gender, disability, sexual orientation or religious belief.
When applying for the position, you accept our data privacy statement: http://www.SATAIR.com/privacy
Satair (a 100% subsidiary of Airbus) is offering first class material management solutions in the aftermarket business of the aviation industry. With our global functional organisation spanning across eleven different sites and locations worldwide, you will be part of a truly global family. Change is the only constant at Satair. The aviation industry is an ever changing - and fast moving environment.
That calls for someone special - someone like you!
Welcome to the Satair family!
This job requires an awareness of any potential compliance risks and a commitment to act with integrity, as the foundation for the Company‚Äôs success, reputation and sustainable growth.
Company:
Satair A/S
Contract Type:
Permanent
Experience Level:
Professional
Job Family:
Digital
By submitting your CV or application you are consenting to Airbus using and storing information about you for monitoring purposes relating to your application or future employment. This information will only be used by Airbus.
Airbus is committed to achieving workforce diversity and creating an inclusive working environment. We welcome all applications irrespective of social and cultural background, age, gender, disability, sexual orientation or religious belief.
Airbus is, and always has been, committed to equal opportunities for all. As such, we will never ask for any type of monetary exchange in the frame of a recruitment process. Any impersonation of Airbus to do so should be reported to emsom@airbus.com .
At Airbus, we support you to work, connect and collaborate more easily and flexibly. Wherever possible, we foster flexible working arrangements to stimulate innovative thinking.

Private equity has always been a sought-after asset class due to its performance potential.
However, steep entry barriers, including high minimum investments (~‚Ç¨10m), hefty paperwork and the challenge of selecting the right fund have traditionally kept individual investors at bay, with access largely limited to big institutions or a select few.
Enter Moonfare.
We've made investing in private equity more accessible and straightforward with our fully digital investment platform. Now, qualified investors can access some of the most sought-after private market funds at lower minimum investment amounts*.
The diverse Moonfare team ‚Äì which includes alumni from top private banks, groundbreaking startups and beyond ‚Äì is united in pushing boundaries and redefining the private equity landscape.
Join us!
Data Analyst (m/f/d)
At Moonfare, we are on a mission to democratise access to top-tier private market investments. As a Data Analyst, you will play a key role in driving data informed decision making across the organisation. You‚Äôll be part of a small, high impact team that sits at the intersection of data engineering, product, marketing, and commercial, enabling the business through actionable insights, scalable reporting, and high quality data models.
You will shape how we understand performance, measure success, and identify new opportunities across the company. Your work will help ensure that decisions at Moonfare are always backed by clear, well structured, and meaningful data.
You will:
Develop and maintain advanced SQL-based data models to power business reporting and analysis
Build scalable dashboards and self service tools using Tableau, enabling teams across Moonfare to access key metrics and insights
Perform exploratory and strategic analysis to support product launches, marketing campaigns, and commercial initiatives
Partner closely with product managers, marketing, and business stakeholders to understand goals and define relevant KPIs
Lead experimentation efforts including A/B test design, implementation, and interpretation
Advocate for data quality and consistency, ensuring models and reporting are accurate, well documented, and easily understood
Collaborate with the wider data and analytics team to improve data infrastructure and analytics tooling
Drive initiatives that increase data literacy and empower teams to use data more effectively
The next Moonfarian:
Has 5‚Äì7 years of experience as a Data, Product, or Marketing Analyst
Has a proven track record of transforming data infrastructure and metrics to support business growth
Possesses advanced SQL skills (BigQuery, PostgreSQL), along with strong Spreadsheet and Tableau proficiency; experience with dbt and Snowflake is a plus
Has hands-on experience working with commercial, product, or marketing datasets
Is comfortable designing and interpreting A/B tests and leading experimentation efforts
Collaborates effectively across both technical and non-technical teams
Communicates clearly, takes ownership, and is passionate about driving business impact through data
If you feel you do not meet all of the requirements, we still encourage you to apply!
Our Values:
Our clients come first, Moonfare comes second, and we prioritise ourselves third - Client-Centric Focus. 
Putting clients first means creating value for them is essential. Placing Moonfare second signifies that our individual professional future at Moonfare depends on the company's commercial success. Prioritising ourselves third reflects our humility in putting clients and Moonfare before personal interests.
We pursue excellence and honor our promises - Commitment to Excellence. 
We hold ourselves to the highest standards, taking responsibility for our failures, and celebrating our successes. We commit to deadlines and stick to them and we learn from our mistakes.
We are here to win and to celebrate our collective achievements - Win together.
 We are mission-focused and think and act like owners. We exemplify the attitude we expect and each of us commits to do what it takes to succeed.
We foster personal growth but each of us earns our place as a Moonfarian through merit - Growth and Merit. 
We hire, retain, and develop exceptional people and invest in empowering them to excel. We must all earn our place at the table every day.
We understand the important role that diversity plays in our success. Different backgrounds, experiences and ideas push us further and raise the bar. We‚Äôre committed to developing an inclusive and safe culture where everyone ‚Äî regardless of colour, race, religion, sex, origin, sexuality, disability, marital status, citizenship or gender identity ‚Äî knows that they are an integral part of the team and can bring their full potential to their work.
*Minimum investments vary according to jurisdiction.
Apply now!
industries: Venture Capital and Private Equity Principals and Investment Management

We‚Äôre looking for the right candidate to join our Business Data Analyst team and become part of a fast-growing company that is on always on the look for people that will demonstrate they‚Äôre able to grow with the company. As the role is our entry level, this is a great entry point for a career path at Lokad, either as a future technical expert or as manager.
We help companies in different verticals (aerospace, automotive, ecommerce‚Ä¶) to forecast and make decisions about their inventory. The vast majority of our clients are based outside of France, mainly in North America and Europe.
As a Business Data Analyst (or Supply Chain Scientist in Lokad's terminology), your role is to make sure our clients get the most from Lokad's technology. The role is a mix between technology, data crunching and supply chain expertise. You will address complex supply chain issues and craft quantitative strategies. Your goal is not only to advise your clients on strategies to adopt, but to craft and execute these strategies on a daily basis while leveraging the data available as much as possible. Your goal is also to keep refining these strategies over time to keep them aligned with the needs of our clients.
At Lokad, you will benefit from the extensive training and coaching of our expert team. You will gain skills in supply chain, predictive analysis and overall quantitative optimization for business. You will learn how to achieve measurable business results grounded on scientific analysis of data.
About one quarter of your time is spent interacting with clients in order to better understand their business (mainly over the phone or by mail, with occasional travels). Note that, in order to benefit from your colleagues expertise, you won't be required to work on the customers' premises.
The rest of your time is spent on data analysis, including manipulating and cleaning data, setting up forecasts, economic optimization, reporting and data vizualisation. In order to do this, you'll learn to use our Differentiable Programming tools and a DSL (Envision) developped by Lokad.
We are looking for candidates with the following skills and qualities:
A strong engineering background.
A keen interest in data and quantitative analysis in general.
Good Excel skills or programming skills (e.g. Python, VBA, SQL, etc.).
Impeccable command of English 
( French is optional).
Excellent communication skills and telephone manners.
A well-made head, rather than a well-filled head.
 We are not looking for someone who is already an expert in supply chain or programming. We‚Äôre looking for a fast learner, with an ability to quickly grasp technology and concepts, since our technology is by no means a simple and plug-and-play product. Knowledge or understanding of supply chain would be a bonus, but the ability to quickly assess and grasp a new situation or get a clear picture of how an organization works and what are the pain points is what we are really after.
Candidates must be self-motivated, confident and highly driven to achieve results with a ‚Äúhands on‚Äù attitude.
The role is predominantly office based, although some travel will be occasionally required to customers, partners or events. We are located in the very center of Paris, France (station Chevaleret).
industries: Software Development and Transportation, Logistics, Supply Chain and Storage

description:
1GLOBAL is a technology-driven global mobile communications provider dedicated to empowering enterprises worldwide to unlock the full growth potential of mobile connectivity. With a best-in-class telecom technology platform, a comprehensive suite of globally viable regulatory licenses, and privileged access to the telecom wholesale market, 1GLOBAL is uniquely positioned to deliver seamless compliance and connectivity solutions. Serving the world's leading banks, corporations, and digital-first businesses‚Äîincluding neo-banks, travel companies, and payment service providers‚Äî1GLOBAL connects over 43 million devices globally.
¬†
With 2024 full-year revenue exceeding US$100 million, 1GLOBAL is a profitable business generating significant cash flows to fund its ongoing investments in infrastructure, transformation, and growth. 2024 saw major client wins and marked 1GLOBAL's evolution from a multi-market telecommunication provider to a global technology-driven mobile connectivity powerhouse. 
¬†
Established in 2022 by experienced tech founders and entrepreneurs Hakan Ko√ß and Pyrros Koussios, 1GLOBAL is a European technology leader driving digital transformation in the global telecommunications market. It operates as a fully regulated Mobile Virtual Network Operator ("MVNO") in nine countries and as a regulated telecommunications operator in an additional 31 countries. Headquartered in the Netherlands, with world-class R&D hubs in Lisbon, Berlin, and S√£o Paulo, 1GLOBAL employs over 450 experts across 13 countries.
Position Overview
We are seeking a skilled and detail-oriented Insights & AI Analyst to join our data team. The Insights & AI Analyst will be responsible for leveraging data to drive business decision-making, producing insightful reports, and creating engaging visualisations. As 1GLOBAL is embarking in the journey of deploying AI tools to support its day-to-day operations the Insights & AI Analyst will work closely with our Data Architects and AI specialists from our technology teams to ensure that our AI models are feed with high quality data and that meaningful conclusions can be derived from them. This role requires a combination of analytical thinking and a strong ability to communicate complex data in a simple, actionable format. The Insights & AI Analyst, reporting to the Finance Director, will work with multiple teams within the company, turning raw data into meaningful insights to support key business objectives and monitor the effectiveness of our go-to-market strategies as well as driving our AI models. 
Key Responsibilities
Data Querying, Predictive and Statistical Analysis
 
Query large datasets to extract meaningful insights, using tools such as SQL, Python, R, BigQuery, dbt, and business intelligence platforms
 
Analyse and derive insight from large datasets from telecom systems, including customer usage, network performance, billing, and service data
 
Apply predictive modelling and machine learning techniques to analyse customer behaviour, such as, identifying potential churn risks, and suggesting retention strategies.
 
 
Reporting & Visualisation 
 
Create compelling, visual dashboards and reports using BI tools (e.g., Power BI, Tableau, Domo, Looker) to communicate insights clearly and effectively to stakeholders
 
Present complex findings in a user-friendly and visually engaging manner. 
 
 
Business Insights & Strategy Support:
 
Engage with internal stakeholders across departments to understand business needs and translate those into analytical projects
 
Support the development of business strategies by analysing data on customer behaviour, network and wholesale trends, and operational performance
 
Support our commercial and sales teams to optimise pricing and commercial strategy to maximise revenue, gross profit and win rates. 
 
 
Data Handling and AI:
 
Work closely with the data team to ensure that data is properly cleaned and structured, while also having the autonomy to adjust data for analysis purposes when needed
 
Be a champion for AI within the business by bringing knowledge of recent and relevant AI tools that can be used to generate insight and create operational efficiencies
 
Work closely with our data architects and AI experts from our engineering team to introduce AI in the day-to-day operations of the business.
 
 
Requirements
Must Have
 
Bachelor's degree in Data Science, Business Analytics, Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science, or a related field
 
Familiarity with machine learning frameworks and statistical models
 
Experience with LLMs
 
High SQL & Excel proficiency, understanding of data lineage and quality
 
Substantial experience with Looker/Tableau or similar, Data Tooling (BigQuery, dbt), Excel/GoogleSheets and Salesforce.‚Äã
 
Effective stakeholder management & communication skills to engage cross-functional team and senior leadership
 
Strong problem-solving skills and ability to think analytically
 
A passion for optimising and automating. ‚Äã
 
Nice to Have
Certifications in Data Science, AI, BI Tools, or Machine Learning 
Benefits
Why 1GLOBAL?
 
 
Growth Opportunities:
¬†Advance your career in one of the fastest growing telecommunications companies, expanding over 40% year-on-year under the leadership of successful tech entrepreneurs
 
 
Major Transaction Exposure:
¬†Be in the driver's seat for transactions that will have an impact on the future telco industry
 
 
Work with a Talented Team:
¬†From the Board and the Founders to the Senior Management Team, you will collaborate daily with the most capable and renowned external advisors, and constantly being exposed to talented and driven individuals
 
 
Dynamic Work Environment:
¬†Thrive in a collaborative, fast-paced workplace where innovation is encouraged, and every contribution counts
 
 
Professional Development:
¬†Work alongside industry experts to enhance your skills and knowledge in a cutting-edge field
 
 
International Experience:
¬†Gain opportunities to work in different 1GLOBAL offices around the world as you grow within the company
 
 
Open Communication Culture:
¬†Join a team where your ideas are heard, and open dialogue is encouraged, fostering a supportive and transparent work environment
 
 
Get Things Done Attitude:
¬†Be part of a results-driven team that values efficiency, creativity, and the drive to make a tangible impact in the industry
 
1GLOBAL is an equal opportunity employer, we value your character as much as your talent. Diversity drives our innovation, and we offer a collaborative, dynamic, and international work environment. We are excited for you to join our mission to revolutionise connectivity globally.

description:
Make an impact
 by working for sectors where technology is the enabler, everything is ground-breaking and there‚Äôs a constant need to be innovative.
Be part of the team
 that combines business knowledge, technological edge and a design experience. Our different backgrounds and know-how are key in developing solutions and experiences for digital clients.
Face challenges
 and learn other ways of thinking and seeing the world - there‚Äôs always room for your energy and creativity.
About The Role
Data Analyst is responsible for examining and interpreting complex data sets to derive meaningful insights and support business decision-making. Focused on descriptive and diagnostic analytics to answer questions of where your company has been, where it is now, why things are the way they are now, and support the decision about what are the next steps.
Their mission involves organizing data, conducting statistical analysis, creating data models, and collecting data requirements from Businesses.
Data analysts collaborate with different teams to understand their analytical requirements, identify key metrics, and communicate data-driven findings to stakeholders effectively.
As a part of your job, you will: 
Gathering and analyzing business requirements to determine the best solution for data reporting and analysis;
Designing data solutions such as data warehousing, data marts, dashboards, and reporting systems;
Developing and maintaining data models, reports, and visualizations;
Collaborating with IT teams to ensure proper data integration and management;
Assisting stakeholders in interpreting data insights and making informed business decisions.
What are we looking for?
Proficiency in SQL for data querying and analysis;
Experience with data visualization tools (e.g., Tableau, Power BI, or matplotlib);
Knowledge of statistical analysis techniques and tools (e.g., R, Python libraries like pandas);
Ability to interpret and analyze complex data sets;
Familiarity with data cleansing and preparation techniques.
Personal traits:
Ability to adapt to different contexts, teams and Clients
Teamwork skills but also sense of autonomy
Motivation for international projects and ok if travel is included
Willingness to collaborate with other players
Strong communication skills

Come join the Team!
Celfocus is a European high-tech system integrator, providing leading edge professional services focused on creating business value through Analytics and Cognitive solutions ‚Äì addressing Telecommunications, Financial Services, Retail, Energy & Utilities, Pharmaceutical, and other markets' strategic opportunities.
As a highly specialised engineering company, Celfocus helps clients undergo their innovation path, providing technological solutions to extract value from data and make it actionable.
Serving clients in +25 countries, Celfocus delivers solutions that boost customer experience and enhance operational efficiency, via our Cognitive Automation, Data & Analytics and Digital offers.

We are a leading technology company focused on enabling retailers and FMCG brands to run digital promotion campaigns through our innovative receipt scanning technology. Our platform empowers brands to launch direct-to-consumer campaigns efficiently, leveraging advanced analytics to better understand consumer behavior.
Operating in 23 countries, our primary regions include Turkey, Spain, Germany, Greece, Central Europe, and the DACH region. We also have team members located in 5 different countries, creating a diverse and dynamic global environment.
About the Role
We are looking for a
 Data Analyst
 to join our growing team and help us transform raw data into actionable insights for the Greek retail market. If you're passionate about analytics, have a sharp eye for detail, and are eager to work with cutting-edge tools and real-world consumer data, we want to hear from you.
Responsibilities:
Analyze and work with retail data from the Greek market (e.g., receipt-level data, product categorization, customer behavior).
Build reports and assist in developing models to uncover trends and generate business insights.
Contribute to the design and improvement of data structures and processes for retail analytics.
Develop dashboards and visualizations using BI tools (Power BI, Tableau, Google Data Studio, etc.) to support decision-making.
Collaborate with senior analysts and business stakeholders to translate business questions into data-driven insights.
Keep up to date with new tools, methods, and trends in data analytics and retail.
Requirements:
Greek speaker (candidates based in Athens will be considered a plus).
Degree in Computer Science, Mathematics, Statistics, Data Science, Economics, or another quantitative field.
2 - 3 years of relevant work experience in data analysis (experience in retail or FMCG analytics will be a strong advantage).
Solid analytical and problem-solving skills with attention to detail.
Hands-on experience with Python (pandas, numpy, etc.) and SQL.
Familiarity with BI/dashboarding tools (Power BI preferred).
Exposure to retail-specific data (receipt scanning, SKU-level granularity, product categorization) is highly valued.
Eagerness to grow into more advanced modelling, statistical analysis, and machine learning over time.
Organized, proactive, and collaborative mindset.
Excellent communication skills in both Greek and English.

That‚Äôs why we‚Äôre committed to creating a workplace where everyone ‚Äì regardless of background, identity, or experience ‚Äì feels respected, valued, and empowered to grow.

Company Description
CCP Global, is the global association for Central Counterparties (CCPs), representing 43 members operating more than 60 CCPs globally across the Americas, EMEA, and the Asia-Pacific region. The organization promotes effective, practical, and appropriate risk management and operational standards to ensure the safety and efficiency of the financial markets it represents.
Role Description
This is a full-time role for a Data Analyst located on-site in the Amsterdam Area. The Data Analyst will be responsible for collecting, analyzing, and interpreting data to provide insights and support decision-making processes. Daily tasks include performing data modeling, conducting statistical analyses, and preparing detailed reports. Additional responsibilities include communicating findings to stakeholders and collaborating with other departments to support organizational goals.
Qualifications
Strong Analytical Skills and Data Analytics experience
Proficiency in Statistics and Data Modeling techniques
Excellent Communication skills for presenting analytical insights
Attention to detail and problem-solving skills
Ability to work independently and in a team environment
Experience in the financial industry is a plus
Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Mathematics, Data Science, Statistics, Economics, or related field

Overview
: The position of Junior BI Analyst is an entry-level role. The role will include managing ad-hoc reporting/visualization tasks for production, sales, client reporting and more functions in the company.
Description:
Design & implement reports, dashboards, and visualizations using data visualization business intelligence tools
Optimize reporting dashboards with a focus on user experience, performance, flexibility, testability, and standardization
Working closely with stakeholders to understand requirements and provide the best possible solution
Make complex concepts simple and easy to understand by those around you through effective communication, planning and strategic execution
Maintain documentation for design, development and reporting work
Work within our systems and with BI team members to achieve high standards of data integrity, ensuring supporting metrics are accurate and complete
Working within team processes, data governance and security frameworks
Required Skills
:
At least 1 year of experience working in a BI environment
Experience using Business Intelligence tools, such as Tableau or PowerBI
Experience in creating interactive dashboards
Minimum Bachelor‚Äôs degree or equivalent / in the process of completing those studies.
Ability to learn new skills quickly
Ability to maintain professionalism, focus and result-orientation under pressure and tight deadlines
Attention to detail
Excellent communication skills (both written and verbal) in English
Exceptional problem-solving/critical thinking skills

:
