description:
Financieel Data Analist
Wij zijn op zoek naar een financieel data analist. En niet zomaar eentje. We zoeken geen rekenmeester die blijft hangen in Excel-tabellen. We zoeken een financieel data analist die cijfers tot leven brengt met Power BI en complexe vraagstukken vertaalt naar inzichten waar klanten √©cht wat mee kunnen. Jij zoekt een plek waar je jouw kennis kunt verdiepen, data √©cht kunt inzetten √©n direct waarde toevoegt voor klanten.
Bij Th√©sor werk je samen met een hecht team. Gezamenlijk zetten wij ons in voor maatschappelijke organisaties zoals woningcorporaties, zorginstellingen en onderwijsinstellingen. Daarmee draag jij als collega bij Th√©sor bij aan een financieel gezonde publieke sector ‚Äì en dus aan een betere samenleving.
Het geeft jou voldoening om complexe financi√´le en datavraagstukken te vertalen naar oplossingen die werken in de praktijk. Je doet dit samen met collega‚Äôs en klanten, waarbij je ziet dat jouw bijdrage direct verschil maakt voor onze klanten ‚Äì √©n voor de samenleving als geheel.
Wat ga je doen?
Als Financieel Data Analist ben je het aanspreekpunt voor je eigen klanten en hun financi√´le vraagstukken. Je bezoekt samen met een treasury adviseur de klanten, doorgrondt hun situatie en geef je passend advies. Je combineert je financi√´le kennis met data-analyse en visualisaties en vertaalt complexe informatie naar heldere adviezen.
Je maakt financi√´le analyses, rapportages en dashboards in 
Power BI 
en bespreekt deze met klanten.
Je bezoekt klanten regelmatig en draagt verantwoordelijkheid voor de relatie en de kwaliteit van onze dienstverlening.
Je verdiept je in rente(curves), waarderings- en financieringsvraagstukken, of ontwikkelt je daar stapsgewijs in.
Je helpt processen slimmer en effici√´nter te maken door data en tools optimaal te benutten en te ontwikkelen.
Je werkt nauw samen met collega‚Äôs en klanten en draagt bij aan verbeteringen in zowel onze interne processen als onze dienstverlening.
Je bent de spil tussen ons IT team en de gebruikers: je digitaliseert, verbetert en ondersteunt gebruikers waar nodig.
Je krijgt de ruimte om je te ontwikkelen richting treasury-expert en specialistische onderwerpen.
Je onderzoekt innovaties en ontwikkelingen in de markt en implementeert relevante verbeteringen voor onze klanten en organisatie.
Waarom kiezen voor Th√©sor?
Bij ons draait alles om 
kwaliteit, inhoud en maatschappelijke impact
. Wij geloven dat jij het verschil kunt maken voor publieke en semipublieke organisaties.
Wat je bij ons vindt:
Focus op inhoud en kwaliteit ‚Äì geen commerci√´le targets of afrekencultuur.
Ruimte om je te verdiepen en verder te ontwikkelen in finance, treaury en data, met begeleiding en trainingen en opleidingen.
Een hecht team ‚Äì samenwerken, leren en elkaar uitdagen in een collegiale sfeer.
Een gezonde werk-priv√©balans ‚Äì flexibele werktijden en een realistische werkdruk.
Wij geloven dat een divers en inclusief team elkaar stimuleert en aanvult. Dit leidt tot een succesvolle organisatie. Iedereen is welkom en mag zich thuis voelen in onze organisatie. 
Wat vragen we van jou?
Een afgeronde hbo- of wo-opleiding in 
Finance, Economie
 of 
Econometrie
.
Minimaal 
3 jaar relevante ervaring
 in een financi√´le of analytische rol.
Sterke analytische vaardigheden en de capaciteit om complexe materie om te zetten in duidelijke adviezen.
Power BI ervaring (must-have)
; kennis van 
Python
 en/of een 
CFA-certificering
 is een pre.
Affiniteit met data-analyse, dashboards en procesverbetering.
Leergierig en nieuwsgierig naar innovaties en nieuwe vaardigheden.
Sterke communicatieve vaardigheden en het vermogen om vertrouwen op te bouwen bij klanten, waarbij je fungeert als hun vaste aanspreekpunt.
Nauwkeurigheid en de drive om kwalitatief hoogwaardig werk te leveren.
Uitstekende beheersing van de Nederlandse taal, in woord en geschrift.
Wat krijg je?
‚Ç¨2.800 - ‚Ç¨5.800 bruto p/m op fulltime basis (afhankelijk van kennis en ervaring)
13e maand en 8,7% vakantiegeld
32 tot 40-urige werkweek (flexibel in te delen)
30 vakantiedagen bij een fulltime dienstverband
Ruimte voor persoonlijke ontwikkeling (opleidingen en trainingen)
Onboardingsprogramma van ongeveer 6 maanden waarin je alle ins en outs leert
Jaarlijks budget om te besteden aan een maatschappelijk doel dat dicht bij jou staat
Goede pensioenregeling
Kortom
Ben jij een financieel professional met passie voor data of een data fanaat met passie voor finance? Wil je werken in een omgeving waar inhoud, ontwikkeling en maatschappelijke impact centraal staan? Dan is dit jouw kans.

Wil je meer weten? We kijken ernaar uit om je te ontmoeten!
 Kom langs voor een kop koffie of draai een halve dag mee en proef de sfeer. Wij zijn benieuwd naar jouw verhaal.

description:
Company Description
Experian is a global data and technology company, powering opportunities for people and businesses around the world. We help to redefine lending practices, uncover and prevent fraud, simplify healthcare, deliver digital marketing solutions, and gain deeper insights into the automotive market, all using our unique combination of data, analytics and software. We also assist millions of people to realise their financial goals and help them to save time and money.
We operate across a range of markets, from financial services to healthcare, automotive, agrifinance, insurance, and many more industry segments.
We invest in people and new advanced technologies to unlock the power of data and to innovate. A FTSE 100 Index company listed on the London Stock Exchange (EXPN), we have a team of 23,300 people across 32 countries. Our corporate headquarters are in Dublin, Ireland. Learn more at 
experianplc.com
.
Job Description
Reporting into GTM Manager you will focus on continuaslly evolving Management Information (MI) that helps improve Sales team performance (for example, deeper understanding of sales pipeline, productivity, win/loss, performance, market dynamics).
Working across products, you will foster an insight-driven culture to build trust in the source of the data and present the insight in a clear and unbiased way, supporting pipeline growth and accuracy.
What You'll Do
Maintain a standardised Management Information (MI) to support user self-service.
Build MI and Aanlytics that can scale across products and clients.
Create new sustainable sales performance MI in Tableau/Power BI.
Design new reports, and build/write them in Tableau/Power BI to give new sales.
Ensure data is of high enough quality to support decision-making.
Review performance by analysing performance against target, and discerning trends, allowing performance to be understood.
Identify areas of opportunity for Sales teams to improve performance, for example through individual/team sales pipeline building, education opportunities to deliver improved sales win rates, and other areas.
Highlight areas of risk and propose mitigation to ensure sales execution.
Lead by example and guide adherence to and understanding of regulatory requirements and
Qualifications
What you'll bring:
Around 3 years of experience in an insight role with exposure to Tableau.
Higher Education Degree in Data Analysis, Statistics, Mathematics or similar.
Fluency in written and verbal English.
Tableau dashboarding and reporting skills.
Knowledge of Power BI.
Salesforce reporting and dashboarding knowledge or certification.
Experience working with large bluechip sales environment.
Additional Information
You will get:
Personal Development - career pathway for professional growth supported by learning and development programs and unlimited access to online educational training courses, learning materials and books.
Work environment - excellent work conditions with friendly environment, recognized team spirit, and fun and quality recreation time.
Social benefit package including life insurance, food vouchers, additional health insurance, monthly flex allowance and internet coverage, corporate discounts, marriage and childbirth / adoption allowance, Multisport card, Sharesave plan, Employee assistance program, –∞ birthday gift and many other benefits!
Work-life balance - 25 days paid vacation, 1 additional day off for your birthday and extra 3 paid days for participation in Social responsibility event.
Opportunity for Flexible working hours and Home Office.
Experian is an Equal opportunity employer. Everyone can succeed at Experian and bring their whole self to work, irrespective of their gender, ethnicity, religion, colour, sexuality, physical ability or age. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know at the earliest opportunity.
This is a hybrid remote/in-office role.
Experian Careers - Creating a better tomorrow together
Find out what its like to work for Experian by clicking here

, nuestras oficinas centrales:

La mejor manera de cuidar de las personas es haci√©ndolas protagonistas. Por eso, queremos que participes en la atracci√≥n de talento, formaci√≥n, desarrollo, comunicaci√≥n o gesti√≥n de personas. ¬øQuieres formar parte?

Su misi√≥n principal consistir√° en impulsar el uso estrat√©gico de los datos en la compa√±√≠a mediante el desarrollo e implementaci√≥n de soluciones de anal√≠tica que garanticen trazabilidad y calidad. Facilitar el acceso a informaci√≥n confiable para generar insights accionables, industrializar an√°lisis recurrentes y colaborar con las √°reas de negocio en el dise√±o del backlog de integraci√≥n de datos en las plataformas anal√≠ticas.
¬øTe unes a nosotros?
Te lo ense√±amos aqu√≠ en este v√≠deo.
Principales Funciones y Responsabilidades
Estrategia corporativa de Datos:
 Implementar la estrategia de construcci√≥n del marco de datos de LME para garantizar su explotaci√≥n por parte de los equipos de negocio y la empresa.
Garantizar la calidad de los datos dentro del ecosistema LME, definiendo las reglas de data quality necesarias, y asegurando cada dato como un ‚Äúgolden record‚Äù, que evite duplicidades y diferencias de criterio.

Novocure is a global publicly-traded commercial-stage oncology company developing a profoundly different cancer treatment therapy called tumor treating fields (TTFields) for patients with solid tumors. TTFields therapy is a non-invasive, novel, antimitotic treatment modality which utilizes proprietary technology attempting to slow or reverse tumor progression by inducing tumor cell death. Novocure's commercialized product, Optune, is approved for the treatment of adult patients with glioblastoma (GBM) in the USA, Europe and Israel. Novocure has ongoing or completed clinical trials and is further expanding its efforts into several other solid tumor indications - non-small cell lung cancer, pancreatic cancer, ovarian cancer and other types of solid cancers.
Novocure Poland is our newest office opening in Europe and you will be part of a global business services team supporting various business functions, including finance and payroll, located in Krakow. The global business services organization within Novocure Poland is critical to Novocure‚Äôs efforts to drive process efficiency, standardizations and drive greater business value as the company prepares for future growth.
To support our team in Krakow, Poland we are looking for a: 
Junior Master Data Analyst.
A Junior Master Data Analyst is a pivotal figure in the management, organization, and governance of business-critical information within an organization. Master data refers to the core data that is essential to operations, including information about customers, suppliers, products, materials, employees, and more. The Junior Master Data Analyst ensures the accuracy, consistency, and reliability of this data across various systems and departments, allowing businesses to make informed decisions, maintain regulatory compliance, and optimize operational efficiency.
RESPONSIBILITIES:
Creates, updates, and deletes master data records in accordance with business requirements and organizational standards.
Manages data input, workflow, and approvals for new entries, changes, and deletions.
Performs regular data quality checks to ensure the accuracy and completeness of master data.
Ensures timely and accurate updates to data sets that support critical business processes such as finance, supply chain, HR, sales, and operations.
Supports the integration of master data across various platforms (ERP, CRM, MDM systems, etc.).
Assists with data migration during system upgrades, implementations, or consolidations.
Ensures data mapping between systems is accurate and that data flows smoothly without loss or corruption.
Liaises with cross-functional teams including IT, Finance, Supply Chain, Procurement, HR, and Sales to understand data requirements and address issues.
Provides training and support to business users regarding data governance, system functionalities, and data entry best practices.
Acts as a point of contact for data-related queries and troubleshooting.
Generates reports and analytics on master data quality, changes, and usage trends.
Documents and maintains data processes, standards, workflows, and change records (including approvals and audit trails) to ensure transparency, continuity, and compliance.
Identifies and implements process improvements and best practices, contributing to projects that optimize data structures, workflows, and automation.
REQUIREMENTS:
Experience in 
data management systems such as SAP,
 Oracle, Microsoft Dynamics, or other ERP/MDM platforms.
Business or engineering degree
About 
1-2 years‚Äô experience in master data management, database administration, or similar data-focused roles.
Familiarity with reporting and analytics platforms (e.g., 
Excel, Power BI, Tableau).
Exceptional attention to detail and accuracy in data management.
Basic understanding of large data sets analysis supported by recognizing patterns, and providing actionable insights.
Written and verbal communication skills suitable for technical and non-technical audiences.
Ability to collaborate effectively with cross-functional teams and stakeholders.
Flexibility to manage changing priorities, new technologies, and evolving business needs.
Commitment to handling sensitive and confidential information with discretion and professionalism.
Fluent in English 
both written and spoken; any further languages are of benefit
Benefits:
‚Ä¢ Performance related bonus
‚Ä¢ Life Insurance
‚Ä¢ Free fruit & cookies delivered for office staff
‚Ä¢ Multisport card
‚Ä¢ Private Medical care
...and more!

Born in Lisbon, Portugal in 2018‚Äîand now with offices in both Lisbon and San Francisco‚Äîwe‚Äôve remained self-funded while reaching over 100 million downloads worldwide.

Join us on this journey to redefine resource management‚Äîand change lives along the way.
The Role
As a 
Data Analyst
 at Air Apps, you will be responsible for 
analyzing and interpreting data
 to drive business insights and optimize product performance. You will create 
reports, dashboards, and performance metrics
 to help teams make informed decisions and improve user experience.
This role requires a 
data-driven mindset, strong analytical skills, and experience with visualization tools
 to turn complex data into actionable insights.

Craft:
Data, Analytics & Strategy
Job Description:
We're looking for a talented and proactive Data Analyst to help shape the future of Player Support at King. In this role, you'll play a critical part in understanding how millions of players engage with our games and services, while providing insights that drive meaningful improvements across our support and game operations.
You‚Äôll work closely with the Player Support Operations, Community, Automation, and Studio Support teams to drive analytical excellence. If you‚Äôre passionate about transforming data into clear actions, collaborating with diverse stakeholders, and having a real impact on the player experience, this is your opportunity.
Your Role Within Our Kingdom
As our Data Analyst in Player Support, you‚Äôll be embedded in a fun, dynamic and fast-paced environment. You‚Äôll serve as a trusted analytical partner to Player Support leadership and studio teams, helping us better understand, model, and optimize how we support our players.
Your key responsibilities:
Monitor, analyze, and report on daily player message inflow across channels (including Zendesk and Sprinklr), identifying volume spikes, sentiment changes, trending issues, and emerging opportunities. 
Design and manage recurring and ad-hoc reporting for Player Support and Game teams, supporting visibility into KPIs such as ticket deflection, automation success rate, contact reasons, or satisfaction scores. 
Define and evaluate AB tests across player-facing features or support optimizations, ensuring rigorous experiment design and insightful results interpretation. 
Translate business questions into data-driven analyses and dashboards that guide decision-making. 
Partner with teams across Community, Automation, Studio Support, and external partners to drive improvement initiatives with measurable outcomes. 
Contribute to OKRs, business reviews, and strategic planning through a data lens. 
Be a go-to person for data interpretation and help foster a culture of curiosity and continuous learning. 
Skills To Create Thrills
You don't need to know everything on day one, but here's what will help you thrive in this role:
Technical Skills
Proficiency in SQL (you write complex queries comfortably and efficiently). 
Experience with Python or R for statistical analysis and data modeling. 
Ability to design clean and intuitive dashboards using tools like Looker or equivalent BI platforms. 
Familiarity with Sprinklr for social data analysis is a plus. 
Experience with BigQuery, Google Cloud Platform, and working with large datasets is preferred. 
Bonus if you‚Äôve worked with Zendesk or customer service tools. 
Business Insight
You‚Äôre curious, structured, and understand how data connects to player behavior and business impact. 
You can identify key metrics, segment player behaviors, and assess operational performance. 
Communication & Collaboration
You translate data into compelling stories and clear recommendations for both technical and non-technical audiences. 
You are proactive, organized, and comfortable presenting your findings to leadership and partner teams. 
Why Join Us?
You‚Äôll be part of a global community of 100+ analytics experts at King, and you‚Äôll work on challenges that directly affect millions of players worldwide. In Player Support, we‚Äôre not just solving operational puzzles ‚Äî we‚Äôre improving how people experience and enjoy our games.
About King
With a mission of 
Making the World Playful
, King is a leading interactive entertainment company with more than 20 years of history of delivering some of the world‚Äôs most iconic games in the mobile gaming industry, including the world-famous Candy Crush franchise, as well as other mobile game hits such as 
Farm Heroes Sag
a. King games are played by more than 200 million monthly active users. King, part of Microsoft (NASDAQ: MSFT), has Kingsters in Stockholm, Malm√∂, London, Barcelona, Berlin, Dublin, San Francisco, New York, Los Angeles and Malta. More information can be found at King.com or by following us on LinkedIn, @lifeatking on Instagram, or @king_games on X.

Cosmico
 connette i Talenti dell‚Äôecosistema Tech e Digital con le opportunit√† professionali e le esperienze che gli permettono di crescere e valorizzare il proprio talento, attraverso la condivisione, sfide professionali, co-living e co-learning o pi√π semplicemente, ispirazione.
Siamo una start up e una community di talenti nel campo del 
Coding
 (sviluppo web e mobile), del 
Design
 (User Experience ed Interface, Graphic e Motion Design), del 
Marketing
 (Copywriting, Social Media Marketing, Art Direction) e del 
Strategy& Data
 (PM/PMO, Data Expert).
Lavoriamo al fianco delle principali societ√† di consulenza, grandi agenzie digitali, aziende multinazionali, start up e scale up.
Per uno dei 
principali gestori di fondi di venture capital in Italia
, ricerchiamo un 
Data Analyst
 con competenze tecniche e finanziarie per supportare l'analisi degli investimenti in una societ√† innovativa e technology driven.
Responsabilit√† principali:
Integrazione e ottimizzazione di 8 servizi esterni specializzati, utilizzando strumenti di automazione come Zapier;
Analisi di mercato, studio dei competitor e identificazione di trend di settore per velocizzare i processi decisionali;

Company Description
Sopra Steria offers tailored, end-to-end corporate technology and software solutions to help clients make bold choices and deliver results. Successfully so! With more than 51.000 colleagues in nearly 30 countries, we rank as Europe‚Äôs leading digital solutions provider. Some of the most successful companies in Europe rely on our technology due to our commitment to innovation, collaboration, and value in business development.
The world is how we shape it. Let‚Äôs shape it together.
Job Description
As a Data Analyst at Sopra Steria, you will play a pivotal role in guiding clients from various industries through their dynamic data journey. You will assist clients in transforming their data processes. By thoroughly analysing and understanding customer needs, you‚Äôll match their requirements with meaningful data solutions. Your innovative approach will enable you to generate impactful analyses that deliver efficient, user-focused solutions. Through your expertise and advice across the data value chain, you‚Äôll ensure the successful implementation and support of Sopra Steria‚Äôs diverse portfolio of data services.
Qualifications
We‚Äôre seeking passionate colleagues who are eager to push the boundaries in digital transformation and technology consulting. At Sopra Steria, you‚Äôll have the opportunity to grow your skills in a constructive, collaborative team environment, working on impactful projects that drive change for our clients. If you thrive on challenge and meet (most of) the qualifications below, we look forward to your application!
You‚Äôll have knowledge and experience of the following:
You have at least 3 years of experience as a Data Engineer or Data Analyst
You help customers in their data transformation, focusing on data architecture, data strategy and governance, data foundation, and more
Based on your advice across the entire data value chain, you ensure that Sopra Steria‚Äôs portfolio of relevant data services is implemented and supported
You collect, analyze and match customer demand with meaningful data
You have knowledge and experience with databases and data modeling
You have good knowledge and experience with SQL
You have practical experience with Microsoft cloud or comparable alternatives
Knowledge of a programming language like Python is a plus
Experience with using and implementing AI in your and the client‚Äôs workflow is a plus
You have analytical thinking, communication skills and a practical attitude
You are proficient in English; knowledge of Dutch and/or French is a must
What We Can Offer You
Become part of a major Tech player in Europe that is recognised for consulting, digital services and software development. Work among high-level professionals who dare to make bold choices to deliver results.
Additionally, you‚Äôll join our Data & AI team, where we‚ÄØsupport enterprises‚ÄØand institutions to become more data driven, and assist our‚ÄØclients to increase business efficiency‚ÄØand create‚ÄØimpact with‚ÄØdata. We offer‚ÄØa complete‚ÄØportfolio of Services and Solutions to unburden‚ÄØorganisations in every step‚ÄØof their‚ÄØtransition: from defining‚ÄØand executing‚ÄØthe data strategy‚ÄØand governance, over setting up data platforms, to visualizing dashboards‚ÄØand applying‚ÄØthe latest‚ÄØdata science and artificial‚ÄØintelligence methodologies. ‚ÄØ
Additional Information
Are you ready to further develop your career? Then we‚Äôd love to point you in the right direction. With offices in more than 30 countries, that direction might lead you to places you‚Äôve never been to before. Would you prefer to grow internally? That‚Äôs possible, too. We challenge you to keep pushing yourself to become the best you can be.
We offer a generous employee benefits package that includes: 
A variety of perks, such as mobility options (including a company car), insurance coverage, meal vouchers, eco-cheques, and more. 
Continuous learning opportunities through the Sopra Steria Academy to support your career development. 
The opportunity to connect with fellow Sopra Steria colleagues at various team events. 
Ready to take the next step?
We‚Äôre here to support you all the way and we are looking forward to your application!
______
Sopra Steria is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will be considered for employment without regard to age, ancestry, nationality, color, family or medical leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, immigration status, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran or military status, race, ethnicity, religion, gender (including pregnancy), sexual orientation or any other characteristic protected by applicable local laws, regulations and ordinances. We foster a work environment that is inclusive and respectful of all differences.

description:
Location: Barcelona, Spain
At Sanofi, we chase the miracles of science to improve people‚Äôs lives. We believe our cutting-edge science and manufacturing, fueled by data and digital technologies, have the potential to transform the practice of medicine, turning the impossible into possible for millions of people.
As one of Canada‚Äôs leading investors in life sciences, manufacturing and research and development, we focus on delivering new and better ways to address unmet medical needs. Our life-changing and lifesaving products are grounded in science that Canadians can trust. They empower self-care, prevent and treat diseases, and help people live better.
Our vision for digital, data analytics and AI
Sanofi has embarked into a vast and ambitious digital transformation program. A cornerstone of this roadmap is the acceleration of its data transformation and of the adoption of artificial intelligence (AI) and machine learning (ML) solutions. This has enabled us, to accelerate R&D, improve manufacturing and commercial performance, and bring novel drugs and vaccines to patients faster, all in order to improve health and save lives.
The Digital Team at Sanofi is a unique data-driven team. We pride ourselves on being data obsessed and highly focused on using state of the art processes along with global technologies to drive impact to our solutions. We measure our insights and products based on how they perform across the globe and hold ourselves to the highest regard as our solutions can impact millions of lives. When tackling a problem, we do not just ask how we will create a solution, but how we will create a solution that reaches across the world with the best possible societal outcome.
If you are passionate about improving the health and wellness of people across the globe using Data as your means, then you should look no farther than the Digital Team here at Sanofi. Join us on our journey in enabling Sanofi‚Äôs Digital Transformation through becoming an AI first organization.
AI Factory - Versatile Teams Operating in Cross Functional Pods: Utilizing digital and data resources to develop AI products, bringing data management, AI and product development skills to products, programs and projects to create an agile, fulfilling and meaningful work environment.
Leading Edge Tech Stack: Experience build products that will be deployed globally on a leading-edge tech stack.
World Class Mentorship and Training: Working with renowned, published leaders and academics in machine learning to further develop your skillsets.
About You
Reporting directly to the Diamond Product, the Data Analyst for Diamond will manage both data and business needs. Having an advanced analytics mindset, able to coach others of technical functions in this area.
Managing data analysis and usage requirements, focusing on data and integration-intensive initiatives. Primary responsibilities include working with and understanding data analysis, as well as integration requirements, guiding solution design and architecture to meet these needs. Additionally, tasked with business analyst responsibilities.
Using a deep understanding of business processes and technology to help business stakeholders achieve their desired outcomes.
Key Responsibilities
Data Analyst, will be directly accountable and responsible to: Data Modeling, Process Modeling, data management through the warehouse - processes, data quality auditing and logging to benchmark. This also requires the ability to report out the state of data quality, help with preparation of data verification and testing methods, and process automation. 
Identify and analyze business needs and coordinate between stakeholder groups to address them and deliver prompt, efficient, quality service.
Work with business stakeholders to understand requirements for data use, analysis, and quality, Leverage data and facts to identify patterns, using judgment to form conclusions that may challenge conventional wisdom, and focusing on the issues to identify high leverage intervention points and strategies.
Manage requirements elicitation, analysis and documentation processes to capture business and end user needs.
Support business case creation, Communicate solution tradeoffs to business stakeholders to frame and influence project decisions.
Promote usability standards and design solutions with a high-quality, effortless UX.
Identify and aggregate data from internal and external sources, Proactively monitor industry, functional, and technology trends, Identify new opportunities to leverage data and to integrate data or applications to enhance business value.
Deliver in compliance with quality, regulatory (Data Privacy, GxP, SOX, etc.) and cybersecurity requirements.
Key Requirements
3 years of experience as Analyst (performed data manipulation, data analysis, data management), Experience in a healthcare company is a strong plus.
Bachelor‚Äôs degree in computer sciences or Equivalent professional experience.
Preferred Certifications: Six Sigma, Professional Scrum Certification.
Expert in Data manipulation techniques, Data quality and audit techniques , Good understanding of cloud computing and data solution design
Preferred Knowledge of ETL/ELT, Snowflake, SQL, Informatica, AWS
Accountable, Proactive, Collaborative and Agile, Pragmatic and capable of solving complex issues.
Continuous improvement mindset, Must be a team player and possess excellent communication, collaboration and interpersonal skills.
Action orientated with ability to work quickly and efficiently in a fast-moving environment, Ability to multi-task and prioritize effectively.
Pursue
 
Progress
. 
Discover 
Extraordinary
.
Progress doesn‚Äôt happen without people ‚Äì people from different backgrounds, in different locations, doing different roles, all united by one thing: a desire to make miracles happen. You can be one of those people. Chasing change, embracing new ideas and exploring all the opportunities we have to offer. Let‚Äôs pursue progress. And let‚Äôs discover extraordinary together.
At Sanofi, we provide equal opportunities to all regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, or gender identity.
Watch our ALL IN video and check out our Diversity Equity and Inclusion actions at sanofi.com!

Code of Conduct
, that serves as the moral compass that guides us when chasing the miracles of science to improve people‚Äôs lives. Please ensure to have read this document, before applying.
Join Sanofi and step into a new era of science - where your growth can be just as transformative as the work we do. We invest in you to reach further, think faster, and do what‚Äôs never-been-done-before. You‚Äôll help push boundaries, challenge convention, and build smarter solutions that reach the communities we serve. Ready to chase the miracles of science and improve people‚Äôs lives? Let‚Äôs Pursue Progress and Discover Extraordinary ‚Äì together.

Homa
 is a global mobile game developer and publisher creating games people love. We partner with studios and internally develop games, having launched over 80 titles, reached over 2 billion downloads, and seen our game All in Hole break into the global top-50 grossing charts. These are milestones, not the finish line.
With deep expertise in product and technology, we built Homa Lab, our proprietary platform that gives developers the market intelligence, data tools, and game tech, with AI built-in, to find product-market fit fast and scale mass-market games into lasting experiences players enjoy for years.
This is our flywheel: Homa Lab helps studios spot the right ideas early, turn them into games quickly, and reach millions of players. Every launch brings back data and insights that fuel the next hit, making each turn of the loop faster, smarter, and more likely to win. AI supercharges this process, running through everything we do, from everyday tasks to our guiding principles.
What powers the loop is talent density. 220+ people from 30+ nationalities, bringing expertise from the world's best studios and companies. We uphold ambition, curiosity, humility, and focus, and deliver with speed, excellence, and candor.
Since the start, we've raised $165M from Headline, Northzone, Eurazeo, Bpifrance, and the founders of King, Sorare, and Spotify, people who've built and backed the games and platforms we admire, now supporting our drive to create the next ones.
At Homa, we are building the next billion-player experiences from the ground up and shaping the future of entertainment.
Role And Missions ‚Äî What You Will Do üöÄ
As a 
Data Analyst - User Acquisition
, you will be part of the Data Team and act as the main partner of the UA team in their mission to grow our games profitably. Your role will be to leverage both historical performance data and predictive models to provide actionable insights, guide investment decisions, and maximize portfolio profitability.
Your missions will include:
 Support UA campaign optimization (Mature - ongoing maintenance & improvements)
Maintain and improve Tableau dashboards that share campaign performance and recommendations with UA managers
Leverage granular cost and revenue data from the Data Platform and LTV predictions from the Data Science team to recommend campaign targets
Monitor and contribute to the improvement of our Autobidder (internal data product that automatically updates campaign targets based on profitability goals)
 Drive improvements of existing games' profitability (High strategic impact - core growth area)
Work closely with UA managers and Finance to help define profitability targets (bottom-up)
Analyze the elasticity of both games and campaigns to explain trade-offs between revenue growth and profitability, and ensure UA can achieve targets
Run tests, provide insights, and help identify the optimal Return on Ad Spend (ROAS) targets that maximize portfolio profit
 Support creative performance analysis (Developing - revamp & build-up)
Collaborate with the creative team to design and maintain reporting that measures the impact of creatives
Align with stakeholders on a synthetic KPI that reflects creative performance (combining share of voice, ROAS, and retention)
Continuously refine reporting to ensure it drives actionable insights for the creative production process
Requirements
You have a strong educational background with a MSc. in Statistics / Maths / Computer Science / Economy or other quantitative field from a top university, outstanding analytical skills, and creative thinking
3-7 years of experience as a Data Analyst focusing on User Acquisition or in an Ad Tech company
Technical Skills 
SQL
Tableau
Python (data wrangling and data visualization), dbt, and code versioning
 Sense of Ownership: "As a key member of our lean team, you'll be expected to have a strong sense of ownership. We're looking for someone who is excited to contribute beyond their core responsibilities to directly impact our growth."
Experience with descriptive and predictive modeling is a plus
Our Culture
At Homa, we prioritize talent, energy, and determination over traditional credentials. We're building a global community of brilliant, driven people who think boldly, move fast, and push boundaries. We believe true innovation comes from diverse perspectives, deep collaboration, and curiosity without limits. Our culture is grounded in four core values:
 Ambition: We strive for the best - we don't settle for "good enough."
 Humility: We recognize that we are always learning, we can always improve and grow
 Curiosity: We continuously seek the "why" behind the "what"
 Focus: Our curiosity takes us deeper, not wider - we dive deep into the details
Benefits
Building great games starts with building a great place to work. Here's what you can expect:
üè• Comprehensive Benefits: Depending on your location, you'll enjoy a range of perks such as insurance, meal vouchers, public transport, gym memberships, and more
üè¢ Paris HQ Access: Enjoy a desk at our private office in a well-located WeWork building that will give you access to WeWork perks like rooftop view and designed coworking spaces
üåç Coworking Access: You will have access to WeWork spaces throughout Europe, along with all their perks and professional office environments
üåê Global Team: Collaborate in English with top-tier talent from 35+ countries, spanning Europe, the UK, the US, and more. Diversity fuels our creativity and innovation
‚úàÔ∏è Team Gatherings: We value time together beyond the screen. Join us for occasional team gatherings, off-site retreats (Workations as we name them) to connect, recharge, and celebrate
üìà Performance Reviews: We're committed to your growth. Every six months, we reflect on your progress, recognize your achievements, and align on clear development goals
üíª Equipment Support: From day one, we'll provide everything you need to do your best work, including a home office setup allowance if you're working remotely
Where We Hire
Our HQ in Paris is a vibrant hub of creativity, collaboration, and connection. From rooftop lunches and coffee chats to after-work ap√©ros and community events, we've designed a space people genuinely enjoy - all within a cozy WeWork filled with good energy (and snacks).
We also have incredible team members across Europe - from Spain and Turkey to Germany, North Macedonia, Poland, the UK, and more. Whether you're working from a sunny WeWork in Barcelona or your home setup in Warsaw, you're fully part of our culture. To keep collaboration smooth, we primarily hire within European time zones (UTC to UTC+3). If you're based there - or planning to be - we'd love to hear from you!
Please note: this is one remote position open to multiple countries, not multiple openings.

About us
As a dynamic and growing Fintech, operating in the European asset management ecosystem, we live and breathe financial data. Founded 12 years ago, our purpose is clear ‚Äì to design and build solutions that streamline, simplify and accelerate data flows so our clients can trust and use their data effectively.
Our experience is proven and our expertise wide-ranging. We deliver accurate and robust solutions geared for performance, maintaining outstanding quality of service for our clients, doing it right first time, every time.
The challenge
Our clients face five pivotal challenges in harnessing the full potential of their data: collecting data from diverse sources, clarifying of the meaning of data to ensure it is actionable, ensuring its completeness for comprehensive analysis, run precise computations that leverage this data effectively and, last but not least, assemble and distribute this data in regulatory reports for European investors.
The end goal is to enable informed decision-making by European investors.
What we're looking for
We are seeking motivated talents with a strong focus on data management and technology. Ideal candidates should:
Actively 
seek learning
 opportunities.
Have a deep understanding of data management principles and the ability to 
turn business and regulatory requirements into scalable solutions backed by complex relational databases
.
Question and challenge 
data to clearly articulate its meaning
 (what?), its context (why?) and its usage (how?).
Be proficient in SQL
 for database management and data querying.
Have a 
good command of Power BI
.
Be fluent in written and spoken 
English
.
In this context, we are looking for a 
Junior Business & Data Analyst
 to play a key role in our product team.
As a 
Junior Business & Data Analyst
, you are an integral to our product development teams and will directly support the company growth. You will take day-to-day responsibility for one of our key solutions, contributing to the product development process, growing both our business and the scope of our technology. You will ensure that our solution meets the requirements of clients and regulators.
This is an opportunity for those 
at the beginning of their careers
 to learn, to challenge themselves and to grow to their full potential in a demanding environment.
Your role and responsibilities
You will collect requirements from clients and regulators to determine solution needs.
You will balance structured, long-term product development work contributing directly to the evolution of our data solutions with the agility to tackle day-to-day challenges as they arise, acting as a versatile problem-solver who keeps the engine running while building what‚Äôs next.
You will interact with clients and various internal functions (developers, product owners, sales team, client support) and at all levels (from junior to CEO).
You will apply critical thinking to your analyses to identify inconsistencies and decide actions to help drive propositions.
You take pride in the quality of your work and produce professional deliverables. You will document user guides, share them, and take an active role in delivering training to ensure stakeholders can effectively utilise the solutions.
You are a team player, offering help and advice as well as receiving it when needed.
Location and travel
The role is located in Luxembourg and you should be willing to travel within Europe on ad hoc basis.
Your qualifications
Educational background: 
you have a Master‚Äôs degree in a numerate and logical discipline (e.g. Data Science, Computer Science or a related field).
Technical skills:
 you are a technophile with a strong interest in data. Knowledge of SQL and relational databases is an asset, so is a good command of Power BI.
Analytical mindset:
 you have an analytical mind, the ability to focus and you can interpret and distil information from long texts in order to document data requirements.
Problem-solving:
 you have a sense of responsibility, take ownership of your work and can work autonomously. You have a hands-on approach to problem solving.
Learning:
 you are adaptable and keen to learn new complex topics.
Communication:
 you have excellent communication skills and are fluent in spoken and written English.
Industry knowledge
 of the investment fund industry would be an advantage.
You are a proficient user of 
Microsoft Office tools
 (Excel, Outlook and PowerPoint).
What we offer
This is an opportunity to build a long-term career in a dynamic and growing company. The 
Junior Business & Data Analyst
 role is an entry level position in a high-performance team and gives exposure to a wide range of situations, skills, profiles and working models. This role has a clear career progression in the product development team.
You will have the opportunity to work alongside recognised experts, interact with the CEO and high level clients and develop your own expertise in the competitive field of investment fund data management. Join us and participate in the FinTech revolution!
We offer an attractive package with flexible, hybrid work arrangements and health benefits. 
Enjoy three additional days off beyond legal holidays, plus lunch vouchers
.
Our culture
At the heart of our culture lies a commitment to 
hard work, professionalism, autonomy, and freedom
. We place our trust in each individual, recognising their potential to drive our collective success. Our investment in our team goes beyond the day-to-day; we dedicate time to nurturing a growth mindset and fostering an environment where learning is continuous. In return, we expect everyone to deliver their best, contributing to our mission with integrity and excellence.
The international focus of our business and industry means that our strength lies in working across different cultures, fostering an environment where everyone belongs and thrives.
How to apply
Send your CV to careers@avanterra.com
IMPORTANT:
Please note that only candidates who either possess a valid work permit for Luxembourg or are citizens of an EU country not requiring a work permit are eligible to apply.
Before any employment contract is entered into, a background check will be made. For Luxembourg based employees, an extract from your criminal record (bulletin n¬∞3), less than 2 months old is required.

Kapsch is one of Austria's most successful global technology companies. With its comprehensive ITS (Intelligent Transportation Systems) portfolio, Kapsch is actively addressing the challenges of the present and the future with intelligent mobility solutions in a wide range of application areas. As a family-owned company founded in 1892 and headquartered in Vienna, Kapsch can look back on 130 years of experience with the future.
We are looking for a highly skilled and motivated Data Analyst and Data Visualization Engineer to support the development of our Intelligent Transportation Systems (ITS) portfolio. Our products include data and video analytics platforms for traffic management and tolling, an OCR (Optical Character Recognition) engine, and stereo vision cameras for vehicle classification. In this role, you will work with large and complex datasets to extract insights that drive innovation, optimize system performance, and inform product decisions. You will collaborate closely with cross-functional teams - including software engineering, AI/ML, and product management - and build dashboards to visualize key performance indicators for real-time monitoring and decision support.
Your responsibilities:
Generate actionable insights
 from large datasets to improve traffic and tolling solutions.
Design and build dashboards
 (e.g., in Qlik, Power BI) to visualize complex data and support real-time operational decisions.
Work with engineering and product teams to develop 
user-centric analytics features
 (e.g., alert systems, operator dashboards).
Analyze traffic sensor data to 
optimize tolling accuracy
 and reduce misclassification and revenue loss.
Identify patterns and trends from traffic data to 
support new use cases
, such as congestion prediction or adaptive signaling.
Monitor AI model performance and support ongoing 
model retraining and customization
 across varying environments.
Use predictive analytics to anticipate traffic bottlenecks, optimize toll operations, and improve safety.
Support 
regulatory compliance
 by automating reporting processes and ensuring data integrity.
Required Skills & Qualifications:
Strong SQL skills and experience with 
relational and columnar databases
.
Solid understanding of 
dimensional data models
 (star/snowflake schemas).
Experience with 
Python and SQL
 for data manipulation and extraction
Hands-on experience with Linux, Bash, Gitlab/Github, Cloud Computing
Proficiency in 
QLIK Sense
Experience working with 
large datasets (‚Äúbig data‚Äù)
 in operational environments.
Analytical mindset and solution driven personality.
Ability to work independently and as part of a team
You practice and live the agile mindset
Good oral and written English
Experience in treating with customers
Presentations skills
Nice to have
:
Experience in tolling or traffic management is a plus.
Experience with traffic related models like DATEX2, SIRI, GTFS, MDS, etc.
Experience with traffic simulators like SUMO, Aimsun, PTV Vissim/Vissum
Our offer:
Pernanent role
Flexible working hours
Hybrid working model (2 days at the office/week)
30 business days of annual leave
Flexible remuneration plan
Challenging the limits of mobility for a healthy world without congestion
Adiverse and dynamic international working environment of Kapsch TrafficCom and opportunities for personal growth
Possibility to work in an international company that operates in a dynamic industry where the working environment favors the professional growth

description:
Craft:
Data, Analytics & Strategy
Job Description:
We're looking for a talented and proactive Data Analyst to help shape the future of Player Support at King. In this role, you'll play a critical part in understanding how millions of players engage with our games and services, while providing insights that drive meaningful improvements across our support and game operations.
You‚Äôll work closely with the Player Support Operations, Community, Automation, and Studio Support teams to drive analytical excellence. If you‚Äôre passionate about transforming data into clear actions, collaborating with diverse stakeholders, and having a real impact on the player experience, this is your opportunity.
Your Role Within Our Kingdom
As our Data Analyst in Player Support, you‚Äôll be embedded in a fun, dynamic and fast-paced environment. You‚Äôll serve as a trusted analytical partner to Player Support leadership and studio teams, helping us better understand, model, and optimize how we support our players.
Your key responsibilities:
Monitor, analyze, and report on daily player message inflow across channels (including Zendesk and Sprinklr), identifying volume spikes, sentiment changes, trending issues, and emerging opportunities. 
Design and manage recurring and ad-hoc reporting for Player Support and Game teams, supporting visibility into KPIs such as ticket deflection, automation success rate, contact reasons, or satisfaction scores. 
Define and evaluate AB tests across player-facing features or support optimizations, ensuring rigorous experiment design and insightful results interpretation. 
Translate business questions into data-driven analyses and dashboards that guide decision-making. 
Partner with teams across Community, Automation, Studio Support, and external partners to drive improvement initiatives with measurable outcomes. 
Contribute to OKRs, business reviews, and strategic planning through a data lens. 
Be a go-to person for data interpretation and help foster a culture of curiosity and continuous learning. 
Skills To Create Thrills
You don't need to know everything on day one, but here's what will help you thrive in this role:
Technical Skills
Proficiency in SQL (you write complex queries comfortably and efficiently). 
Experience with Python or R for statistical analysis and data modeling. 
Ability to design clean and intuitive dashboards using tools like Looker or equivalent BI platforms. 
Familiarity with Sprinklr for social data analysis is a plus. 
Experience with BigQuery, Google Cloud Platform, and working with large datasets is preferred. 
Bonus if you‚Äôve worked with Zendesk or customer service tools. 
Business Insight
You‚Äôre curious, structured, and understand how data connects to player behavior and business impact. 
You can identify key metrics, segment player behaviors, and assess operational performance. 
Communication & Collaboration
You translate data into compelling stories and clear recommendations for both technical and non-technical audiences. 
You are proactive, organized, and comfortable presenting your findings to leadership and partner teams. 
Why Join Us?
You‚Äôll be part of a global community of 100+ analytics experts at King, and you‚Äôll work on challenges that directly affect millions of players worldwide. In Player Support, we‚Äôre not just solving operational puzzles ‚Äî we‚Äôre improving how people experience and enjoy our games.
About King
With a mission of 
Making the World Playful
, King is a leading interactive entertainment company with more than 20 years of history of delivering some of the world‚Äôs most iconic games in the mobile gaming industry, including the world-famous Candy Crush franchise, as well as other mobile game hits such as 
Farm Heroes Sag
a. King games are played by more than 200 million monthly active users. King, part of Microsoft (NASDAQ: MSFT), has Kingsters in Stockholm, Malm√∂, London, Barcelona, Berlin, Dublin, San Francisco, New York, Los Angeles and Malta. More information can be found at King.com or by following us on LinkedIn, @lifeatking on Instagram, or @king_games on X.

ABOUT US
We are a fast-growing, close-knit, dynamic, and successful Digital Services Company that specializes in providing support to large multinational companies for SEO, Product & Web Content Management, Social Media Management, Performance Marketing, E-Commerce Management, CRM & E-Mail Marketing Automation, DX & Development, Data Management & Analytics, Project Management, Digital Consultancy, and Recruitment.
As a multinational Dutch company, we have offices in Amsterdam, Istanbul, Lisbon, Kuala Lumpur, Bogota & Portland. With our exceptionally talented & diverse team, and our A+ client portfolio, the world is our oyster!
We are looking for a 
Data Analyst (CRM
) with 
3-5 years of experience in marketing analytics, particularly with a focus on CRM, and advanced SQL expertise.
QUALIFICATIONS
Bachelor's degree in Marketing, Business Analytics, or a related field.
3-5 years of experience in marketing analytics, with a focus on CRM
Advanced SQL required
Experience with Salesforce Marketing Cloud and Email marketing analytics
Excellent communication and presentation skills, with the ability to translate complex data into strategic insights.
Proficient in using data visualization tools (such as DOMO, Tableau)) to present data in a visually engaging manner
Familiarity with marketing automation tools and strategies.
Ability to work independently and in a team environment, managing multiple priorities.
RESPONSIBILITIES
Develop and enhance measurement Key Performance Indicator (KPI) frameworks for different Owned channels.
Analyze and develop CRM (Salesforce) strategies to improve customer engagement, retention, and lifetime value.
Demonstrates the ability to make informed decisions on the best methods and techniques to evaluate the impact and success of marketing initiatives.
Collaborate with marketing partners to develop effective strategies for campaign reporting and analysis.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to integrate analytics insights into customer experience improvements and support overall business goals.
Use SQL to analyze data and determine trends, predict outcomes, and offer actionable insights.
Lead the development and implementation of A/B tests to enhance customer journey touchpoints and improve conversion rates.
Create comprehensive reports and dashboards to track marketing performance metrics.
Stay abreast of industry trends and advancements in CRM and analytics technologies.
WHAT WE OFFER
Remote Work Model
üíª: We enhance flexibility, foster productivity, and facilitate a healthier work-life balance for our employees!
Meal Allowanceüçî:
 We provide a meal card of ‚Ç¨10.20 per workday.
Private Health Insurance
ü©∫: We provide a private health insurance from MultiCare.
Birthday Time OffüéÇ:
 A half-day off is granted on birthdays.
Mental Health & SupportüíÜüèª ‚ôÄÔ∏è:
 Free company subscription to our mental health & support partner 
‚Äò‚ÄôOpenup‚Äô‚Äô.
Referral Programüë´üèª:
 Our referral program 
‚Äò‚ÄôFriends2Work‚Äô‚Äô
 encourages our employees to refer their friends followed by a cash award once they are hired.
Self-Improvement
üí™üèª: Access to numerous online courses and training in our own in-house training platform 
NMQ Academy
 & access to our exclusive 
Mentorship Program
 provided by our brilliant senior peers.
Team Environmentüëë:
 We give you to opportunity to work with global brands together with a fun, diverse, and dynamic team and become a part of a global success story!
If you are interested in joining our team, please apply with your CV in English.
By applying to this job advertisement, you accept that you have shared your personal data within the scope of the clarification text we have provided at www.nmqdigital.com
NMQ Digital is proud to be an equal-opportunity workplace. We are committed to equal employment opportunities regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, or gender identity.
Don't be discouraged if you feel that you don‚Äôt fully meet every single one of the requirements for a particular role, there is always room for growth in NMQ!

About the Role
We are looking for a skilled Data Analyst with strong SQL expertise to join our team. This role is central to transforming business needs into robust data solutions, ensuring data quality, and supporting strategic decision-making through well-structured data analysis.
Key Responsibilities
Collaborate with business analysts to understand requirements and translate them into technical specifications.
Develop and optimize SQL queries for data extraction, transformation, and validation.
Conduct rigorous testing to ensure data accuracy and completeness.
Contribute to the improvement of data infrastructure.
Partner with visualization and analytics teams to automate data transformation and delivery.
Required Qualifications
Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, or a related field.
Proven robust experience in a similar role with hands-on SQL and database work is key.
Attention to details is a must.
Strong analytical and conceptual thinking skills.
Excellent communication skills for cross-functional collaboration.
Experience with BI tools is a plus (PowerBI, Tableau, R, Qlik).
Experience in the banking/financial field is a plus.
Familiarity with Agile methodologies is a plus.
Experience with data modeling, data warehouse technologies, and data governance practices is a plus.

: https://cariere.bancatransilvania.ro/ .

Make an impact
 by working for sectors where technology is the enabler, everything is ground-breaking and there‚Äôs a constant need to be innovative.
Be part of the team
 that combines business knowledge, technological edge and a design experience. Our different backgrounds and know-how are key in developing solutions and experiences for digital clients.
Face challenges
 and learn other ways of thinking and seeing the world - there‚Äôs always room for your energy and creativity.
About The Role
Data Analyst is responsible for examining and interpreting complex data sets to derive meaningful insights and support business decision-making. Focused on descriptive and diagnostic analytics to answer questions of where your company has been, where it is now, why things are the way they are now, and support the decision about what are the next steps.
Their mission involves organizing data, conducting statistical analysis, creating data models, and collecting data requirements from Businesses.
Data analysts collaborate with different teams to understand their analytical requirements, identify key metrics, and communicate data-driven findings to stakeholders effectively.
As a part of your job, you will: 
Gathering and analyzing business requirements to determine the best solution for data reporting and analysis;
Designing data solutions such as data warehousing, data marts, dashboards, and reporting systems;
Developing and maintaining data models, reports, and visualizations;
Collaborating with IT teams to ensure proper data integration and management;
Assisting stakeholders in interpreting data insights and making informed business decisions.
What are we looking for?
Proficiency in SQL for data querying and analysis;
Experience with data visualization tools (e.g., Tableau, Power BI, or matplotlib);
Knowledge of statistical analysis techniques and tools (e.g., R, Python libraries like pandas);
Ability to interpret and analyze complex data sets;
Familiarity with data cleansing and preparation techniques.
Personal traits:
Ability to adapt to different contexts, teams and Clients
Teamwork skills but also sense of autonomy
Motivation for international projects and ok if travel is included
Willingness to collaborate with other players
Strong communication skills
At Celfocus, we are committed to cultivate a diverse and inclusive workplace. As an equal-opportunity employer, we welcome applicants of all backgrounds, gender identities, and abilities. We are dedicated to providing reasonable accommodations for candidates with specific needs. If you require any adjustments during the selection process, please inform our Talent Acquisition Team.
Come join the Team!
Celfocus is a European high-tech system integrator, providing leading edge professional services focused on creating business value through Analytics and Cognitive solutions ‚Äì addressing Telecommunications, Financial Services, Retail, Energy & Utilities, Pharmaceutical, and other markets' strategic opportunities.
As a highly specialised engineering company, Celfocus helps clients undergo their innovation path, providing technological solutions to extract value from data and make it actionable.
Serving clients in +25 countries, Celfocus delivers solutions that boost customer experience and enhance operational efficiency, via our Cognitive Automation, Data & Analytics and Digital offers.

We Are Waiting for You
Hi there!
I am Laura the recruiter for this position (and hopefully, your future colleague!).
First, a little bit about what I like the most about working at ServiZurich: The environment here is incredibly collaborative and innovative. Our tech-driven mindset fosters continuous learning and growth, creating an atmosphere where everyone can thrive. Now, I can't wait to share this exciting journey with you at the 
Zurich
!
Let me take a wild guess: you‚Äôve probably sifted through countless job offers today, and they all seem to blur together. Sound familiar? Well, here‚Äôs the scoop: At Zurich, we might not have all the answers (and we‚Äôre not striving for perfection!), but we‚Äôve got something special. Curious? Keep reading!
First off, THANK YOU for considering our company. We understand that finding the right opportunity can be tough, but I‚Äôll try to make it easier.
Who Are We?
Let me introduce us. You‚Äôre reading about 
Zurich Insurance Group
, a global leader in insurance, but this role specifically pertains to 
ServiZurich.
 Established in Barcelona in 2006, ServiZurich operates as an integral part of Zurich Insurance Group, providing cutting-edge technological solutions and support to Zurich's local and global business units.
In addition to our technological solutions, we excel in investment, administration, and accounting, ensuring comprehensive support for Zurich's diverse operations.
What Can You Expect?
Zurich Global Employee Benefits Solutions (ZGEBS) is a business unit within Zurich Insurance Group whose objective is to support multinational customers in structuring global employee benefits solutions that cover local and/or international employees in multiple countries. ZGEBS manages and operates captive, pooling and International Program (ZIPE) solutions that combine local insurance policies ‚Äì provided by local Zurich units or selected external partners ‚Äì into a reinsurance arrangement for multinational customers. These offerings cover employee benefits insurance risks such as death, disability, accident and medical coverages.
We are excited to invite applications to implement our ambitious objective to grow and expand our business around the world.
The Data Analyst works cross functionally with Sales, Underwriting and Finance to deliver key services to out global customers, including portfolio analysis and performance reporting.
You have experience in working in a fast paced international business environment, analytic thinker who likes to solve problems and deliver service excellence in collaboration with different stakeholders. You like to work in a dynamic team where activities are based on capabilities, skills and willingness to help each other.
And you might be thinking: This is great, what will my day-to-day be like, at Zurich? I‚Äôm glad you asked ‚Äì I asked myself the same question at the time.
As a 
Data Analyst 
you will have the opportunity to:
Manage relationship and activities related to our Network Partners and Customers
Producing professional Customer and Network Partners data analytics / reports
Streamlinining processes and data analysis to ensure excellent delivery standard
Monitoring portfolio data and performance
Proactively ensuring customer satisfaction through the monitoring and implementation of related metrics.
Establishing best practice to optimize end service delivery
Ensuring financial and accounting closing are performed according to deadlines
Actively collaborating with other teams and Subject Matter Experts to identify relevant data sources, help develop and improve operational and customer reports
Work alongside experts in various technological domains.
Enhance your skills with real-world experience
Contribute to a team that values your input and creativity.
What Makes You a Great Fit?
While we‚Äôre not seeking perfection or expecting you to save the world, we believe that if you meet some of these requirements, you‚Äôll be a fantastic fit for our team. 
We are waiting for you!
A university degree, preferably in an analytical numerical field (Finance / Accounting, Data Science, Math, or Statistics)
Relevant work experience of 3-5 years related to the above mentioned responsibilities
Basic knowledge in the insurance business is preferred.
Excellent understanding of data administration and management functions (collection, analysis, distribution etc.)
Ability to work with large data sets across different business segments and extrapolate findings to support decision-making
A good understanding of Excel / Power BI, Python /R and experience in visualizing data using tools is an asset
Communication, presentation, project management and relationship skills
And‚Ä¶ What Makes Us Special?
As well as a 
competitive salary 
and a 
yearly bonus
, we offer:
To support your work-life balance, we have adopted a flexible working model.
Over 300 euros to set up your home office and additional monthly home office allowance. 
Wide range of internal and external trainings, including English and Spanish classes depending on the needs.
Ticket restaurant and Health Insurance with the flexibility to exchange it for other benefits. 
Life and accident insurance. 
Collective Life retirement Plan
2000 referral bonus if you bring other talented people like you to the company. 
Special banking and insurance conditions plus Exclusive Employees discounts 
Functional diversity benefits 
Different social clubs such as hiking, investment, beach volley and many more 
Where Are We Located?
Bac de Roda, Barcelona.
We Are Waiting for You.
It‚Äôs a match? Don‚Äôt wait any longer! 
Apply 
by sending your
 CV in English
.
If not, no worries! We‚Äôll meet again in the future. Feel free to share my contact details with anyone you think would be a great fit.
At Zurich, we are an equal opportunity employer. We attract and retain the best-qualified individuals available, regardless of race/ethnicity, religion, gender, sexual orientation, age, or disability.
ServiZurich‚Äì Your Talent, Our Strength
Why Zurich
At Zurich, we like to think outside the box and challenge the status quo. We take an optimistic approach by focusing on the positives and constantly asking What can go right?
We are an equal opportunity employer who knows that each employee is unique - that‚Äôs what makes our team so great!
Join us as we constantly explore new ways to protect our customers and the planet.

ML Platform Engineer (all)

running both ML/LLM workloads and general applications

description:
About us
Themisphere is a fast-growing early-stage startup on a mission to transform how real estate data is processed and understood. We are pioneering the field of AI-powered solutions enabling real estate professionals to automate complex workflows, streamline data inflows, and enhance decision-making. Our software suite leverages cutting-edge LLMs and NLP pipelines to classify complex real estate data and seamlessly extract critical data points while delivering advanced analysis and performing complex calculations with unparalleled accuracy and scale.
About this role
As LLM / NLP Engineer at Themisphere, you will contribute to the technical charge in building and refining the core models that power our products. You'll work closely with the founders, the Head of AI and the product team to architect end-to-end machine learning solutions, from preprocessing raw documents to training domain-specific LLMs. This is a unique opportunity to shape a greenfield product and influence the technology roadmap of our evolving software portfolio.
Tasks
Develop and fine-tune LLM-based NLP models for document classification and information extraction.
Implement OCR, embeddings, NER, Encoder Only Classification and semantic search techniques to handle a wide range of document formats.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to incorporate user feedback and iteratively improve accuracy and performance.
Maintain up-to-date knowledge of the latest NLP and LLM research and apply best practices to our pipelines.
Requirements
Technical background:
 2+ years hands-on experience in NLP, including working with transformer-based models (e.g., BERT, GPT-4, LLaMa, ...).
Tooling & tech stack:
 proficiency in Python, PyTorch and efficiency tools.
Passionate about tech and AI, actively engaged in the community.
Problem-solving:
 strong analytical skills and the ability to break down complex problems into data-driven solutions.
Adaptability:
 enthusiasm for working in a dynamic startup environment where priorities can shift.
Collaboration:
 excellent communication and teamwork skills, comfortable working closely with product managers, annotators, and other engineers.
Why join us?
Have a direct impact on shaping the company's core product and technology direction.
Work with a team of passionate engineers and seasoned entrepreneurs on an industry-changing mission.
Possibility to grow into a leadership role, since you will be the backbone of the system built.
A lively, open and entrepreneurial culture with flat hierarchies, fast decision-making and efficient communication channels.
If you're excited about pushing the boundaries of NLP and applying LLM technology to transform the largest asset class in the world, we'd love to hear from you.
How to apply:
 
Please send your resume, LinkedIn and/or X profile, any relevant project links and GitHub repos via Join.com.
Let's shape the future of real estate with transformative technology together!
The minimum salary for this position is according to the IT collective agreement (EUR 3.724 gross monthly salary for full-time employment). Your entry level and starting salary will be based on your qualification and experience.

Join Us for a Unique AI Writing Assistant Project!
Are you passionate about cutting-edge AI, large language models, and shaping the future of creative technology? Join 10Clouds as we develop a 
custom AI writing assistant
 for a renowned philosophical author. This is not your average AI project‚Äîyour work will empower an award-winning writer to maintain their signature style, structure, and tone across entire manuscripts, with privacy and context memory at its core.
What makes this project special?
You‚Äôll help build a fully private, fine-tuned AI that mimics a specific author‚Äôs voice‚Äîno stylistic drift allowed!
Work closely with a highly technical, multidisciplinary team at 10Clouds, a leader in AI product development.
Deliver a 
real
, production-ready solution with a deep focus on privacy, autonomy, and quality.
The stack includes cutting-edge LLMs (LLaMA 3, Mixtral), Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG), FastAPI, Qdrant/Weaviate vector search, and a custom web editor for writers.
Your Responsibilities:
Analyze client requirements and help design the optimal system architecture.
Prepare and process text data for model fine-tuning.
Fine-tune large language models (e.g., LLaMA 3, Mixtral 8x7B) using LoRA or similar methods.
Develop a robust RESTful API for text generation and session management.
Implement intelligent knowledge retrieval/search using RAG techniques.
Build a responsive, user-friendly web interface for long-form creative writing.
Integrate document context/version management features.
Deploy and monitor infrastructure on cloud (AWS/GCP) with Docker and FastAPI.
Test, quality assure, and optimize the system for tone consistency and usability.
Maintain documentation and support seamless project handover to the client.
Requirements:
Hands-on experience with large language models (preferably LLaMA or Mixtral).
Practical knowledge of fine-tuning techniques (LoRA, transfer learning).
Advanced Python skills; experience with FastAPI, Docker, and CI/CD.
Familiarity with vector databases (Qdrant, Weaviate) and RAG algorithms.
Proven background in API development and microservice architecture.
Proficiency in deploying cloud solutions (AWS or GCP).
Experience with web development tools (React/Vue, responsive design).
Independence, Strong Communication Skills, And Client-facing Experience.
Bonus: QA/testing in AI, UX/UI design experience.
If you‚Äôre ready to work in a highly collaborative team, build deeply personalized AI, and shape the way authors harness next-generation assistant technology, we want to hear from you!
Apply now and help us push the boundaries of what's possible in AI-powered writing!

As part of your application, you may be presented to clients/partners as part of the recruitment process. If selected for the assignment, you will be employed by us and work either with clients or on internal projects and assignments as part of our consulting business.

Design, develop, and deploy scalable AI-driven solutions and agent-based systems.Collaborate with cross-functional teams including data engineers, architects, and platform engineers.Contribute to the evolution of our AI automation platform, ensuring robustness, performance, and maintainability.Explore and implement state-of-the-art techniques in machine learning, reinforcement learning, and multi-agent systems.Participate in architectural decisions and help define best practices for AI engineering across the organization.Implement and manage Model Context Protocol (MCP) servers to enable persistent, context-aware agent behavior across workflows.
Your Profile (Must-have Requirements)
Proven experience in software development,Machine learning ideally with a focus on AI, automation, or intelligent agents.Strong programming skills in Python or similar languages.Experience with automation tools such as n8n, Workato, or similar platforms.Familiarity with LLMs (e.g., GPT, Claude, Gemini) and frameworks for agent orchestration such as LangChain, Vextex AI Agent Builder, or OpenAgents.Hands-on experience with vibe-coding, prompt engineering, and designing agent workflows.Understanding of scalable system design and distributed computing.Excellent problem-solving skills and a collaborative mindset.

Experience with agent-based modeling, reinforcement learning, or orchestration platforms.

 21-09-2025

We currently employ experienced consultants in areas such as System Development, AI, Machine Learning, Testing, Cloud, Infra DevOps, and IT Project Management.
Working at Deploja is something entirely different from working at an ordinary consulting company‚Äîand we are really proud of that. So, what makes us unique?
We simply offer more than just a high salary and greater freedom; that‚Äôs just the beginning. With us, you‚Äôll find the work environment and opportunities you deserve. Welcome to Deploja, where the grass is indeed greener!
Vi erbjuder dig f√∂ljande, Valet √§r ditt!
üöÄ Exciting assignments with our many clients. We focus on long-term projects, which gives you the opportunity to create value for the client while also developing yourself.

Join us at Provectus to be a part of a team that is dedicated to building cutting-edge technology solutions that have a positive impact on society. Our company specializes in AI and ML technologies, cloud services, and data engineering, and we take pride in our ability to innovate and push the boundaries of what's possible.
As an ML Engineer, you‚Äôll be provided with all opportunities for development and growth.
Let's work together to build a better future for everyone!
 Requirements:

description:
A data-driven company in the building energy efficiency sector, founded in 2023, is looking for an 
Energy Data Scientist
.
The company helps hotels and other energy-intensive businesses reduce energy consumption by 10-20% using data collection, smart analytics, and digital twins.
Their platform integrates with building systems to detect inefficiencies ‚Äî such as pool pumps running unnecessarily or mismatches between HVAC operation and occupancy ‚Äî helping clients reduce costs by up to 30% and lower emissions.
They also support carbon footprint tracking (Scope 1, 2, 3), ensure compliance with sustainability standards (CSRD, ESG, B Corp, Green Key), and enable automated reporting.
You are offered a remote position based in Cyprus.
Your tasks:
Develop ML models to detect energy inefficiencies from smart meter data
Forecast energy consumption and optimize HVAC system performance
Build internal analytics workflows and scalable data pipelines
Collaborate with domain experts to turn insights into real-world actions
Explore and implement advanced ML/DL methods to drive innovation
Requirements
4+ years of experience in Data Science, ideally in energy, IoT, or smart buildings
Strong skills in Python, SQL, and time-series modeling (e.g., ARIMA, LSTM, Prophet)
Experience with machine learning and deep learning frameworks (e.g., TensorFlow, PyTorch)
Familiarity with large datasets, cloud environments (e.g., GCP), and model deployment
Excellent communication and data visualization skills
Master's or Ph.D. in a quantitative field (e.g., Math, Statistics, Computer Science)
English C1+
Benefits
Competitive salary from your competencies
Full-time remote position with occasional travel
Official employment in Cyprus, fully compliant with local labor laws
The role includes paid vacation and sick leave, aligned with standard practices for full-time positions
Stable, fast-growing company with a flat organizational structure
