AI / Machine Learning Engineer
Location: Eindhoven
Salary: ‚Ç¨ 5.500 - ‚Ç¨ 6.500
Living in NL already
No ZZP allowed
Introduction
Are you passionate about applying machine learning to drive innovation and create tangible value? Do you see how advanced ML can transform the semiconductor industry? Would you like to join a team building cutting-edge ML solutions for a global data analytics platform? If so, we want to hear from you.
Job Mission
As a Machine Learning Engineer in the Data Analytics organization, you will design, develop, and deploy ML models and algorithms that support teams across the company. You will collaborate with data scientists, engineers, developers, and business stakeholders to deliver ML-driven products and services. You will also help shape and maintain the AI services within the enterprise data analytics platform in the IT Chief Data Office.
Roles and Responsibilities
Design, build, and deploy scalable, maintainable, and traceable machine learning models.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to translate business needs into ML-driven solutions.
Handle data preprocessing, feature engineering, model development, evaluation, and monitoring.
Integrate ML models into production environments (cloud and/or on-premise).
Stay current with the latest ML technologies and apply them as appropriate.
Participate in code reviews, testing, and documentation to ensure quality.
Monitor and maintain deployed ML models to meet performance, reliability, and accuracy targets.
Contribute to best practices and standards for machine learning across the organization, including CI/CD templates, MLOps frameworks, and process guidelines.
Develop and apply containerization strategies for ML applications (e.g., Docker, Kubernetes).
Education and Experience
Bachelor‚Äôs or Master‚Äôs degree in Computer Science, Data Science, Machine Learning, or related field.
5+ years of relevant experience in machine learning, data science, or similar roles.
Strong experience with ML frameworks (TensorFlow, PyTorch, scikit-learn, etc.).
Proficiency in Python.
Hands-on experience with Microsoft Azure; knowledge of GCP is a plus.
Solid understanding of MLOps practices, data preparation, feature engineering, model evaluation, and CI/CD.
Proven track record deploying and maintaining ML models in production.
Awareness of standards and regulations such as GDPR, ISO 27000 is a plus.
Experience mentoring junior team members and improving AI service capabilities.
Skills
Strong passion for machine learning and solving real-world challenges.
Customer- and value-driven mindset in developing ML solutions.
In-depth knowledge of ML algorithms, techniques, and best practices.
Understanding of data architecture and data modeling.
Familiarity with agile and scrum practices.
Strong background in software engineering and automation, with Python as the preferred language.
industries: Machinery Manufacturing, Semiconductor Manufacturing, and Software Development

description:
More independence, freedom, and better pay
Coody believes in combining the freedom and flexibility of freelancing with the security of traditional employment.
It's not rocket science.
Overpaid managers, fancy offices, and heavily burdened organizations are history.
The tech talent of tomorrow deserves a new, independent, and well-paid standard.
Welcome to what we call Gravity Free Consulting.
Why Coody
At Coody, we cut out everything unnecessary to give more back to you as a consultant. And we have done it in the package of a slimmed and efficient organization, meaning no overpaid managers, no fancy offices and no luxurious conferences. But, what does this mean in practice?
Maximized Compensation 
- Typically a +40% salary increase.
Freedom & Flexibility
 - No bosses. All digital. Fully remote for those who prefer.
Employment Security 
- Fixed salary, pension, insurance, paid vacation and a big educational fund.
Shaping the Future 
- Projects and assignments for digital game changes like Mojang, Spotify, Volumental, Volvo Cars, Varjo, Toca Boca, Hemnet, and exciting startups and scaleups.
This is Coody
We‚Äôre a diverse community of ambitious tech people from more than 14 nationalities working on exciting challenges with customers across Sweden, Finland, USA, and the UK in industries ranging from gaming, AR, EV, AI, Medtech and Fintech.
Coody is more of a platform than a traditional consultancy. Everything we do, we do to make sure individuals working here can live according to their own priorities and unique ambitions. A consultant-first environment where you have better control over your career.
Explore our 
Employee Handbook
 and discover a company that actually puts consultants first.
What you‚Äôll be doing
As a Data Scientist Consultant at Coody, your role will involve helping interesting companies create value from their data. Everything from creating analyses, models, and insights from raw data, to improving and developing machine learning models in production. The work also involves driving product and design decisions based on data together with our clients.
Since this is a senior position, you are expected to support the organization and the team by working in a data-driven way. As well as sharing your knowledge both within and outside the company.
You‚Äôll need to be adaptable and ready to hit the ground running in new environments. Typically, you‚Äôll work on 1-2 assignments per year to tackle impactful projects with real-world results.
Who you are
We‚Äôre looking for a Data Scientist with
 4+ years of experience
 and a proven ability to get things done. Here‚Äôs what we‚Äôre after:
A solid track record working as a Data Scientist
Hands-on experience with at least a couple of production-level data science projects - from prototyping to deployment and ongoing improvements
Deep understanding of LLMs, Neural Networksone and tools such as Python, SQL, Numpy, Pandas, R, TensorFlow
A degree in Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science, or a related field
Based in Sweden - You must have Swedish citizenship, a valid work visa, or permanent residency
Fluent in English (spoken and written)
How to apply
Are you excited to take your career to the next level and meet the criterias? Apply now, and we'll be in touch shortly.

What We're All About.
It isn't often you get to be part of a tech company that, since 2016, has been innovating the data analytics market in ways no-one else can. Our technology started out in FinTech, helping tackle serious criminal activity. Now, its potential is virtually limitless. Working at Quantexa isn't just intellectually stimulating. We're a real team. Collaborating and constantly engineering better and better solutions. We're ambitious, we think things through and we're on a mission to discover just how far we can go. Nearly half of our colleagues come from an ethnic or religious minority background. We're made up of people from 47 nationalities who speak over 20 languages. As a diverse mix of individuals, we make one big unstoppable team.
If our incredible culture sounds like you, we'd love you to join us.
Quantexa was built with a vision of enabling better decision making through better data-driven intelligence. years, 20 locations and 800+ employees later we recently gained "Unicorn" status and we still believe in our original Decision Intelligence platform. We've completed our first acquisition, combining Aylien's advanced AI and Natural Language Processing (NLP) into our Decision Intelligence Platform and reached Centaur status ($100M in ARR)
As an Associate Data Scientist, you'll be joining a team of experts in Data Science and Software engineering within Quantexa's Graph Data Science team. The team is continuously working on new and innovative products, helping our Tier 1 clients solve engineering and business problems in the area of fraud, compliance and financial crime. In particular, the team focusses on using graphs (connected views of our data) to add context to our decision making. This includes the use of Knowledge Graphs; Graph Machine Learning and Graph analysis.
You'll be involved in:
Building analytics tools to detect risk and opportunities in Quantexa data
Building analytical pipelines for solving graph problems
Improving our analytical tooling to help with tasks such as statistical analysis, reporting
Developing and improving on existing/new methodologies with a focus on ease of use and re-usability
Understanding common pain points on client deliveries and working to resolve these
Working with an expert team to deliver the products end to end up to general availability
Requirements
What you'll bring.
Demonstrated aptitude, potential, and ambition to grow in the field of data science. 
Experience in building a machine learning model from scratch, with the ability to present and explain the process and decision-making steps. 
Academic background in Mathematics, Physics, Engineering, or Computer Science (or related field), ideally with a 2:1 or First-class degree. 
Proficiency in Python (or similarly complex programming language), which is the primary programming language used. 
Nice to have. 
Strong preference for candidates who have pursued data science personal projects or learning in their own time, demonstrating initiative and passion for the field of Data Science. 
A basic understanding of graph theory and its main use cases. 
Scala / Java 
Experience using AI as a coding assistant (note this isn't an AI engineering role, but AI is used frequently within our work) 
Experience in using graph libraries in python (or similar languages) e.g. NetworkX / igraph 
An interest in software / data engineering 
Experience with spark (either pyspark or the scala API) 
Benefits
Why join Quantexa?
What makes you Q will help you to realize your full potential, flourish and enjoy what you do, while being recognized and rewarded with our broad range of benefits.
Competitive salary 
Company bonus 
23 days annual leave, plus national holidays + your birthday off!
Pension scheme with a company contribution of 5% (when you contribute 2%)
Private Healthcare with DKV
Life Insurance
Work from Home Allowance
Meal Vouchers
Regularly bench-marked salary rates 
Well-being days 
Volunteer Day off
Work from Home Equipment
Free Calm App Subscription #1 app for meditation, relaxation and sleep üßò‚Äç‚ôÄÔ∏è 
Continuous Training and Development, including access to Udemy Business 
Spend up to 2 months working outside of your country of employment over a rolling 12-month period with our ‚ÄòWork from Anywhere' policy
Employee Referral Program 
Team Social Budget & Company-wide Socials 
Our mission.
We have one mission. To help businesses grow. To make data easier. And to make the world a better place. We're not a start-up. Not anymore. But we've not been around that long either. What we are is a collection of bright, passionate minds harnessing complexities and helping our clients and their communities. One culture, made of many. Heading in one direction - the future.
It's All About You.
It's important to us that you feel welcome, valued and respected. After all, it's your individuality and passion for what you do that will make you Q. We see that - which is why we're proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. We've created and will continue to improve our inclusive and diverse work environment. Regardless of your race, beliefs, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, neurodiversity or ableness - whoever you are - if you are a passionate, curious and caring human being who wants to push the boundaries of what's possible, then we want to hear from you.

description:
Ready to find your perfect job fit?
Welcome to 
HomeBuddy
, where making a home awesome is like seeing a vision come to life! We are on a mission to create a friendly and trusted platform to connect homeowners with the right contractors across the US.
What started as a small idea has become a fast-growing home improvement platform focusing on lead quality and long-term partnerships based on trust and mutual success. We are a product-first company with a long-term outlook - our platform consistently and positively evolves based on data insights and the most up-to-date tools.
This job is for you if
You would like to work in a positive atmosphere where teamwork and trust in your colleagues are primary values. 
You succeed in an environment that values initiative and sharing feedback and where your suggestions and efforts are recognized and appreciated
You are used to taking responsibility for solving difficult tasks and are directly involved in how your efforts impact the final result
This role is full-time and offers home working flexibility.
Your future tasks will include
Developing and implementing machine learning models to refine lead scoring, identify customer segments, maximize conversions, optimize advertising bids, and prevent churn
Utilize geospatial and socioeconomic data to build predictive models that identify high-value audiences, leaving the competition in our dust
Design and implement pricing & distribution optimization algorithms that maximize lead conversion rates and minimize customer acquisition costs, ensuring we're always in the black
Collaborate seamlessly with marketing, sales, and product teams, translating data-driven insights into actionable campaigns
Present data findings with clarity, conciseness, and a dash of statistical humor, leaving stakeholders nodding in agreement
You're going to need this to be successful in this role
Master's Degree or PhD in Data Science, Computer Science, Mathematics, Physics, Statistics, Econometrics, Quantitative Methods or a Related Field
5+ years of experience in the data domain with +2 years in data science/machine learning engineer roles
Expertise in SQL, Python, and Machine Learning frameworks (especially supervised and unsupervised learning algorithms)
Proven experience deploying machine learning models to production environments using tools and frameworks like ML Flow & AWS Sagemaker, ensuring our models are always ready for prime time
Exceptional analytical and problem-solving skills with a keen eye for detail
Impeccable communication and presentation skills, capable of translating data insights into actionable business strategies that drive revenue growth without losing the audience in a sea of jargon
A demonstrated ability to work independently and as part of a cross-functional team, ensuring we're always scoring the highest in teamwork
Strong business acumen and the ability to translate data insights into actionable business strategies that drive revenue growth, making us a data-driven powerhouse
Fluent English
It's nice if you also have
Up-to-date with the latest data science techniques, whitepapers, and best practices
We value working on Kaggle projects, so if you have a passion for machine learning and are an active Kaggle contributor, please highlight this in your application
Why choose HomeBuddy
Enjoy the freedom to work from anywhere without being tied to one place - while ensuring you are available to our team during the agreed working hours
Achieve a harmonious work-life balance with a flexible schedule tailored to your local needs, along with paid vacation, sick leave, and local holidays
Empower yourself with work equipment of your choice partially paid for by HomeBuddy and up-to-date apps and tools to maximize your productivity
Feel valued and appreciated with an industry-leading compensation package
Get recognized and rewarded for both outstanding individual efforts leading to extraordinary results and our team success. 
Enhance your well-being with our allowance program covering fitness activities and mental health programs
Learn and expand your knowledge by both working on complex tasks and using paid training opportunities, including courses, events, and conferences
If this sounds like you, we should talk!
Privacy Policy
By sending us your application you agree that Siren Group AG (known as HomeBuddy) will process your personal data to participate in this recruitment process. If you want to know more about how Siren Group AG processes your personal data please click 
here
.

AI Machine Learning Engineer ASML
ENGLISH CV AND COVERLETTER ARE MANDATORY!
Interested?
Apply with your most recent resume, a cover letter and desired gross salary + availability (hours/start date) to c.geelen@hipbv.com
Responsibilities and duties: Develop and implement machine learning models and algorithms that drive innovation and create value for ASML's customers and business.
Objective of the assignment: Design, develop and implement scalable, traceable and maintainable machine learning solutions in collaboration with multidisciplinary teams.
 Introduction to the job
Are you passionate about leveraging machine learning to drive innovation and create value? Do you have a vision for how machine learning can transform the semiconductor industry? Do you want to be part of a team that develops cutting-edge ML solutions for the ASML Data Analytics Platform? If so, we are looking for you!
ASML leads the worldwide development, production, and sales of high-end lithography systems for the semiconductor industry. In short, we make the machines that make computer chips, or integrated circuits. We design and build some of the most complex machines that you will ever see ‚Äì and the software to run them ‚Äì to develop smaller, faster, and still more affordable chips. We aim to unlock the potential of people and society by pushing technology to new limits. It is because of our machines that the world‚Äôs technology has steadily evolved. ASML employs more than 40,000 employees, has offices in the US, Asia, and Europe, and is headquartered in Veldhoven, the Netherlands.
This position requires access to controlled technology, as defined in the Export Administration Regulations (15 C.F.R. ¬ß 730, et seq.). Qualified candidates must be legally authorized to access such controlled technology prior to beginning work. Business demands may require ASML to proceed with candidates who are immediately eligible to access controlled technology.
Job mission
The Machine Learning Engineer in the ASML Data Analytics is responsible for designing, developing, and deploying machine learning models and algorithms that support the entire ASML organization. You will work closely with data scientists, data engineers, software developers, and business stakeholders to deliver ML-driven products and services that create value for our customers and our business. You will contribute to the development and management of the AI services within the data analytics platform in the IT Chief Data Office.
Roles and responsibilities
Design, develop, and deploy machine learning models and algorithms to solve complex business problems.
Deploy machine learning models into production environments, ensuring they are scalable, traceable and maintainable. This may involve using cloud services or on-premise solutions.
Collaborate with data scientists, data engineers, software developers, and business stakeholders to understand requirements and deliver ML-driven solutions.
Conduct data preprocessing, feature engineering, model development, model evaluation, and monitoring to ensure high-quality ML solutions.
Stay up-to-date with the latest trends and technologies in machine learning and implement them as needed.
Participate in code reviews, testing, and documentation to ensure high-quality deliverables.
Improve, monitor and maintain deployed ML models to ensure they continue to meet performance, reliability and accuracy requirements.
Contribute to the development of best practices and standards for machine learning within the organization, by developing CI/CD templates and standardized frameworks and the creation of guidelines and processes for Data Science teams to use MLOps capabilities.
Develop and implement containerization strategies for machine learning applications using tools such as Docker and Kubernetes.
Education and experience
Bachelor‚Äôs or Master‚Äôs degree in Computer Science, Data Science, Machine Learning, or a related field.
5+ years of experience in machine learning, data science, or a related field.
Experience with machine learning frameworks and libraries such as TensorFlow, PyTorch, scikit-learn, etc.
Proficiency in programming languages such as Python.
Experience with Azure cloud platform is a must; knowledge of GCP is preferred.
Knowledge of MLOps, data preprocessing, feature engineering, model evaluation, testing, and CICD techniques.
Experience with deploying and maintaining ML models in production environments.
Familiarity with industry-related standards and regulations e.g., GDPR, ISO 27000, etc. is a plus.
Mentor junior team members and continuously improve the AI services and the overall competence.
Skills
A strong passion for machine learning and its applications in solving real-world problems.
A customer-centric and value-driven mindset and approach to developing ML solutions.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills and the ability to make data-driven decisions.
Excellent collaboration and communication skills and the ability to work effectively with different stakeholders and teams.
Strong knowledge of machine learning algorithms, techniques, and best practices.
Understanding of data architecture and data modeling concepts.
Familiarity with agile and scrum methodologies and best practices.
Strong familiarity with software engineering practices and Python as preferred programming language.
Ability to drive automation for improved efficiency and scalability.
Diversity and Inclusion
ASML is an Equal Opportunity Employer that values and respects the importance of a diverse and inclusive workforce. It is the policy of the company to recruit, hire, train, and promote persons in all job titles without regard to race, color, religion, sex, age, national origin, veteran status, disability, sexual orientation, or gender identity. We recognize that diversity and inclusion is a driving force in the success of our company.
Other information
The position is based in the CDO Data Analytics. The Machine Learning works in close cooperation with the data scientists, data engineers, and software developers in the team and with the domain architect.

POSITION SNAPSHOT:
Our client is a pioneering AI company dedicated to transforming manufacturing processes through a ‚Äúsmall data‚Äù approach to AI. In this role, you will be the first dedicated Data Scientist, responsible for building core AI capabilities that will directly impact manufacturing efficiency and sustainability at scale. You‚Äôll work in a remote-first, collaborative environment, pioneering practical AI solutions that put an expert operator next to each industrial machine.

Point Wild helps customers monitor, manage, and protect against the risks associated with their identities and personal information in a digital world. Backed by WndrCo, Warburg Pincus and General Catalyst, Point Wild is dedicated to creating the world's most comprehensive portfolio of industry-leading cybersecurity solutions. Our vision is to become THE go-to resource for every cyber protection need individuals may face - today and in the future.
Join us for the ride!
Lat61 Mission
The Lat61 platform will power the next generation of cybersecurity and AI-enabled decision-making. As an AI Engineer on this team, you will help deliver:
Advanced AI Model Development:
 Designing and optimizing machine learning models (supervised, unsupervised, and NLP-based) to drive security-focused intelligence across the platform.
RAG & Embedding Workflows:
 Building and deploying RAG pipelines, embeddings, and feature stores that enable context-aware, real-time decision-making.
Production-Ready AI Systems:
 Collaborating with Data and MLOps engineers to package, deploy, and monitor models in scalable, cloud-native environments.
AI-Driven Analytics:
 Leveraging deep learning and NLP to provide actionable insights into risk posture, compliance, and security events.
Future-Proofing for Quantum:
 Researching and prototyping AI approaches that can adapt to post-quantum cryptographic standards and automated remediation.
About the Role: 
As an 
AI Engineer
, you will work closely with an AI & Data Engineering team to develop, deploy, and optimize AI models that power our next-generation security products.
This is a hands-on engineering role, requiring expertise in machine learning model development, deployment, and optimization. You will contribute to multiple AI initiatives, ensuring that models are efficient, scalable, and production-ready.
Your Day to Day: 
Model Development & Optimization: 
Implement, refine, and maintain ML models (supervised, unsupervised, NLP-based models). 
Production Integration:
 Work with Data/MLOps engineers to package, deploy, and monitor models within a robust CI/CD pipeline. 
Performance Tuning: 
Optimize model efficacy, efficiency, and reliability‚ÄØ‚ÄØ 
Parallel Project Support: 
Split or manage multiple AI initiatives to enable faster execution across various R&D efforts.
What you bring to the table: 
At least 4 years of experience
 in AI/ML Engineering with strong hands-on expertise in developing and deploying production-grade ML models.
Strong ML & AI Fundamentals:
 Hands-on experience with supervised/unsupervised learning, NLP, and deep learning techniques.
Production Experience:
 Proven track record of building, optimizing, and deploying models into production environments.
Model Deployment & MLOps Experience:
 Comfortable working with containerized models, cloud-based AI pipelines (AWS preferred), and CI/CD for ML. 
Proficiency in Python & ML Frameworks:
 Experience with PyTorch, TensorFlow, Scikit-learn, or similar tools. 
Performance-Driven Mindset:
 Skilled in optimizing models for accuracy, efficiency, and scalability. 
Collaboration & Growth:
 Thrives in a cross-functional team and is eager to learn from and contribute to AI best practices. 
Why Join Us?
Work on Cutting-Edge AI:
 Build and optimize real-world AI solutions across multiple security-focused product lines.
Be a Key Player in AI Deployment:
 Own critical aspects of model development, productionization, and optimization.
Learn & Grow in a High-Impact Team:
 Collaborate with top AI engineers and scale AI innovation within a growing company.
As part of Point Wild, you will:
Solve real customer problems
. Point Wild's point solutions allow consumers to address their immediate cyber protection needs. Our mandate is to continuously anticipate our customers' evolving digital security needs to create best-in-class solutions aimed at keeping them safe.
See your impact.
 We are a scrappy, nimble organization where individual contributions are needed and valued. You will see your impact every day.
Accelerate your career. 
 As we expand, you will have the opportunity to learn new technologies, products, and markets in a fast-paced, growth-oriented environment.
Most importantly, you'll get to work with other talented people at a company where people matter. If you want to put your fingerprint on an organization and leapfrog your growth, this is the place for you.
In keeping with our beliefs and goals, no employee or applicant will face discrimination or harassment based on race, color, ancestry, national origin, religion, age, gender, marital domestic partner status, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability status, or veteran status. Above and beyond discrimination or harassment based on "protected categories," Point Wild is committed to being an inclusive community where all feel welcome. Whether blatant or hidden, barriers to success have no place at Point Wild.

description:
Company Description
TOMRA Food is a multinational organisation and a leading provider of sensor-based sorting, peeling and integrated post-harvest solution for the food industries. Transforming global food production to maximise food safety and minimise food loss by making sure 
Every Resource Counts‚Ñ¢
, has been our strength for over 50 years.
At TOMRA, we want people to 
innovate
, show 
passion
 in their work and be 
responsible
. We encourage the freedom to innovate and take risks that result in breakthroughs that challenge the status quo. We value passion that focuses and commits to meeting success. We believe in a responsible and safe mindset that takes care of our customers, products, and fellow employees.
Join the resource revolution!
Job Description
We are looking for a 
Senior Data Scientist
 with a passion for leveraging deep learning and computer vision techniques to drive advancements in the Food industry. As a key member of the AI team, reporting to the AI Team Lead, you will contribute to the development of cutting-edge algorithms for real-time food sorting, predictive maintenance and anomaly detection.
Roles And Responsibilities
Develop, test and implement deep learning and computer vision algorithms for real-time food sorting performance. 
Create predictive models and algorithms for machine reliability, predictive maintenance and anomaly detection. 
Analyse and explore large and complex datasets using data analytics techniques and statistical modelling. 
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand business objectives and devise data-driven solutions. 
Utilise and optimise real-time data processing and data visualisation tools. 
Communicate findings and insights to both technical and non-technical stakeholders effectively. 
Implement MLOps practices to build, test and deploy machine learning models. 
Take ownership of full DL model development lifecycle: from data capture at customer site, to deployment and maintenance over time. 
Instruct labelers and oversee data capture activities so that data quality is ensured. 
Experiment with cutting edge AI developments in order to create customer value on our sorters and maintain a competitive advantage over competition. 
Occasional travel to other R&D locations and customer sites for model validation. 
Qualifications
About You:
Master's Degree or PhD in Computer Science, Engineering or Mathematics. 
In-depth knowledge and experience with Computer Vision & Image Processing. 
Vision Models (yolo, resnet, sam).
Proficiency‚ÄØwith several machine-learning tools, application programming languages and frameworks (Python, Pytorch, TensorRT, Tensorflow‚Ä¶). 
Experience with AzureML, Databricks, AWS or similar and tools like MLFlow. 
Experience with data visualization & labeling tools such as voxel51 & labelstudio or similar. 
Experience with databases (SQL, LakeFS, Azure blob‚Ä¶). 
Bonus is experience with DL inference on edge devices and GPU benchmarking. 
Strong expertise in‚ÄØdeep learning, computer vision and data analytics techniques. 
Ability to extract meaningful business insights from data and identify patterns. 
Experience with code revision control (GIT). 
Passion for prototyping new products and solutions with transformative potential. 
Stay updated on‚ÄØemerging AI developments and their potential impact on the food sorting industry. 
Strong communication skills, self-motivated, creative and collaborative. 
Additional Information
You will have long-term career opportunities, with a globally renowned company and the following:
Health insurance. 
Pension scheme:
2% employee contribution with 4% employer contribution,
4% employee contribution with 6% employer contribution,
6% employee contribution 8% employer contribution. 
25 days annual leave.
Additional long service days.
International and collaborative working environment. 
Space and support to experiment with new technologies. 
Social events. 
Be part of a mission to transform how we all obtain, use, and reuse the planet‚Äôs resources to enable a world without waste. 
Inclusive company culture that values diversity, well-being, and strong camaraderie among our teammates. 
Professional training and development: We are passionate about people and seeing them succeed. 
We love innovation, a collaborative environment where idea sharing and thinking outside the box is encouraged. 
How To Apply
If this sounds like you, we would love to hear from you! All applications will be managed in the strictest confidence.
TOMRA is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer and provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants regardless of race, colour, religion, gender, gender identity, age, national origin, disability, parental or pregnancy status, marriage and civil partnership, sexual orientation, veteran status, or any other characteristics. Reasonable accommodations will be made and will be provided as requested by candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process.

We now have a new requirement and are looking for a consultant colleague with the qualifications listed below. The position is part of our consulting business, which means you will be employed by us and work either with clients or on internal projects and assignments.
As part of your application, you may be presented to clients/partners as part of the recruitment process. If selected for the assignment, you will be employed by us and work either with clients or on internal projects and assignments as part of our consulting business.
Role:
Build an automation platform which is scalable for all the AI use cases
Design, develop, and deploy scalable AI-driven solutions and agent-based systems.Collaborate with cross-functional teams including data engineers, architects, and platform engineers.Contribute to the evolution of our AI automation platform, ensuring robustness, performance, and maintainability.Explore and implement state-of-the-art techniques in machine learning, reinforcement learning, and multi-agent systems.Participate in architectural decisions and help define best practices for AI engineering across the organization.Implement and manage Model Context Protocol (MCP) servers to enable persistent, context-aware agent behavior across workflows.
Essential requirements:
Proven experience in software development,Machine learning ideally with a focus on AI, automation, or intelligent agents.Strong programming skills in Python or similar languages.Experience with automation tools such as n8n, Workato, or similar platforms.Familiarity with LLMs (e.g., GPT, Claude, Gemini) and frameworks for agent orchestration such as LangChain, Vextex AI Agent Builder, or OpenAgents.Hands-on experience with vibe-coding, prompt engineering, and designing agent workflows.Understanding of scalable system design and distributed computing.Excellent problem-solving skills and a collaborative mindset.Bonus: Experience with agent-based modeling, reinforcement learning, or orchestration platforms.
Last day to apply
: 11-09-2025
About Us
We currently employ experienced consultants in areas such as System Development, AI, Machine Learning, Testing, Cloud, Infra DevOps, and IT Project Management.
Working at Deploja is something entirely different from working at an ordinary consulting company‚Äîand we are really proud of that. So, what makes us unique?
We simply offer more than just a high salary and greater freedom; that‚Äôs just the beginning. With us, you‚Äôll find the work environment and opportunities you deserve. Welcome to Deploja, where the grass is indeed greener!
Vi erbjuder dig f√∂ljande, Valet √§r ditt!
üöÄ Exciting assignments with our many clients. We focus on long-term projects, which gives you the opportunity to create value for the client while also developing yourself.
üåü A secure monthly salary ‚Äì together we‚Äôll agree on a base salary depending on your assignments.
üöó Company car ‚Äì we encourage you to choose an electric car for a more sustainable future.
üíº Occupational pension and great opportunities for salary conversion.
üå¥ Vacation ‚Äì Would you like more than 30 days of vacation, perhaps 60 days?
üè• Private health insurance, accident insurance, and life insurance for increased security.
üìö Skills development ‚Äì you set your own budget and choose the training you wish to attend.
üïë Quality of life ‚Äì Are you struggling to balance everyday life and wish to work a little less while still earning as much, if not more?
We handle applications continuously, and due to the high workload, it's especially important to include a short motivation for the position, explaining how you meet the requirements.

At RebelsAI, we turn the potential of Generative AI into real-world impact. We help companies become truly AI-driven by building smart, scalable solutions that actually work. From the first idea to implementation, we make AI practical and valuable.
As a Machine Learning Engineer, you will work closely with our founding team. You will design and build the systems that power our AI products and prototypes. You will have real influence and the freedom to explore and grow as part of a young and ambitious startup.
What you will do
You will work hands-on with data, models and cloud tools to build the technical core of our AI solutions. Your work helps clients automate, improve and innovate.
You will:
Build and deploy machine learning models using platforms like Google Cloud, Azure and AWS
Design ML pipelines with tools such as Vertex AI, BigQuery, Dataflow and Dataproc
Choose the right infrastructure for each job, whether that is VMs, containers, GPUs or TPUs
Apply strong data security and privacy practices in every project
Work closely with consultants and clients to solve real problems with real value
Experiment with GenAI tools and turn ideas into working prototypes
Help shape solutions from first version to production-ready
What you bring
You have a strong technical foundation and a curious mindset. You are eager to build real things and see them used in the world.
A degree in AI, Data Science, Computer Science or a related field
Solid Python skills and experience with libraries like NumPy, Pandas and scikit-learn
A good understanding of machine learning principles and data analysis
Familiarity with cloud environments such as Azure, GCP or AWS
Fluent in Dutch and English
Experience with tools like LangChain, vector databases or GenAI architectures is a plus but not required. You will have the space to learn and grow.
The kind of Rebel we are looking for
We are looking for someone who is hands-on, self-starting and not afraid to ask questions. You enjoy variety, take initiative and want to be part of a team that builds and learns together.
You are:
Eager to learn and try new things
Confident working independently and with others
Practical and focused on delivering results
Passionate about the possibilities of AI and how it can help people and organizations
What we offer
A growing startup where your voice matters
A small and driven team that supports and challenges each other
Competitive salary
Laptop and travel expense reimbursement
Flexibility to work 4 or 5 days a week
Hybrid working setup with a base in Rotterdam
About RebelsAI
We help organizations get the most out of Generative AI. From workshops and readiness scans to tailored applications and long-term strategy, we guide our clients every step of the way. We focus on what is useful, realistic and impactful. AI should help people thrive.
Ready to build what is next
If this sounds like the right challenge for you, we would love to meet. Send us your resume and a short note about why you are excited to join RebelsAI. Visit us at 
rebelsai.nl
 or find us on LinkedIn. We welcome all backgrounds and perspectives. We believe diverse teams build better solutions.
industries: Technology, Information and Internet, Software Development, and IT Services and IT Consulting

description:
More independence, freedom, and better pay
Coody believes in combining the freedom and flexibility of freelancing with the security of traditional employment.
It's not rocket science.
Overpaid managers, fancy offices, and heavily burdened organizations are history.
The tech talent of tomorrow deserves a new, independent, and well-paid standard.
Welcome to what we call Gravity Free Consulting.
Why Coody
At Coody, we cut out everything unnecessary to give more back to you as a consultant. And we have done it in the package of a slimmed and efficient organization, meaning no overpaid managers, no fancy offices and no luxurious conferences. But, what does this mean in practice?
Maximized Compensation 
- Typically a +40% salary increase.
Freedom & Flexibility
 - No bosses. All digital. Fully remote for those who prefer.
Employment Security 
- Fixed salary, pension, insurance, paid vacation and a big educational fund.
Shaping the Future 
- Projects and assignments for digital game changes like Mojang, Spotify, Volumental, Volvo Cars, Varjo, Toca Boca, Hemnet, and exciting startups and scaleups.
This is Coody
We‚Äôre a diverse community of ambitious tech people from more than 14 nationalities working on exciting challenges with customers across Sweden, Finland, USA, and the UK in industries ranging from gaming, AR, EV, AI, Medtech and Fintech.
Coody is more of a platform than a traditional consultancy. Everything we do, we do to make sure individuals working here can live according to their own priorities and unique ambitions. A consultant-first environment where you have better control over your career.
Explore our 
Employee Handbook
 and discover a company that actually puts consultants first.
What you‚Äôll be doing
As a 
Machine Learning Engineer 
at Coody, you‚Äôll dive into exciting and challenging AI projects to build and optimize machine learning models for production use cases, ensuring they are highly efficient and scalable. You‚Äôll also design and build machine learning infrastructure, often in cloud environments, to support large-scale deployments for our customers. Here‚Äôs what your day-to-day will look like:
Design, develop, and deploy scalable machine learning products
Build and maintain infrastructure and tooling as a platform for data scientists
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to integrate ML solutions into production systems
Monitor and maintain the performance and reliability of ML models post-deployment
Stay current with the latest advancements in machine learning and related technologies
Collaborate with clients, support colleagues, contribute to knowledge sharing
Who you are
We‚Äôre looking for Machine Learning Engineers with at least 
3-4 years of experience
 and a proven track record of delivering real results. If you‚Äôve got the following, you‚Äôre probably a great fit:
A track-record of delivering machine learning models in production
Cloud experience (e.g. AWS, Google Cloud, Kubernetes)
Experience with distributed data tools (e.g., Spark, Dask, PySpark, Apache Beam)
Expertise in Python and modern ML/AI libraries (PyTorch/TensorFlow, Transformers, LangChain, LangGraph, Vertex AI)
Strong understanding of ML infrastructure: deployment, monitoring, debugging, optimization
A degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics, Statistics, or something related
Based in Sweden - You must have Swedish citizenship, a valid work visa, or permanent residency
Fluent in English (spoken and written)
How to apply
Are you excited to take your career to the next level and meet the criterias? Apply now, and we'll be in touch shortly.

Buscamos un/a Ingeniero/a en Inteligencia Artificial con experiencia en el desarrollo e integraci√≥n de soluciones basadas en machine learning, procesamiento del lenguaje natural (NLP) y agentes inteligentes. El perfil ideal combina habilidades t√©cnicas con visi√≥n aplicada, capaz de dise√±ar asistentes virtuales, sistemas aut√≥nomos y modelos adaptativos que mejoren la experiencia del usuario en entornos digitales.
Tareas
Funciones principales:
Dise√±ar e implementar modelos de aprendizaje autom√°tico para tareas de clasificaci√≥n, recomendaci√≥n o personalizaci√≥n.
Desarrollar agentes de IA capaces de interactuar de forma aut√≥noma con usuarios, procesar lenguaje natural y tomar decisiones en funci√≥n del contexto.
Aplicar t√©cnicas de NLP para construir asistentes conversacionales o educativos.
Evaluar, ajustar y mantener modelos de IA.
Integrar soluciones inteligentes en plataformas web o m√≥viles.
Requisitos
Requisitos valorados:
Dominio de Python y librer√≠as como scikit-learn, spaCy, TensorFlow, PyTorch o LangChain.
Experiencia pr√°ctica en el dise√±o de agentes inteligentes: rule-based, reflexivos, deliberativos o basados en aprendizaje.
Experiencia en el desarrollo e integraci√≥n de asistentes virtuales.
Familiaridad con arquitecturas de agentes y sistemas multiagente (MAS).

Ready to find your perfect job fit?
Welcome to 
HomeBuddy
, where making a home awesome is like seeing a vision come to life! We are on a mission to create a friendly and trusted platform to connect homeowners with the right contractors across the US.
What started as a small idea has become a fast-growing home improvement platform focusing on lead quality and long-term partnerships based on trust and mutual success. We are a product-first company with a long-term outlook - our platform consistently and positively evolves based on data insights and the most up-to-date tools.
This job is for you if
You would like to work in a positive atmosphere where teamwork and trust in your colleagues are primary values. 
You succeed in an environment that values initiative and sharing feedback and where your suggestions and efforts are recognized and appreciated
You are used to taking responsibility for solving difficult tasks and are directly involved in how your efforts impact the final result
This role is full-time and offers home working flexibility.
Your future tasks will include
Developing and implementing machine learning models to refine lead scoring, identify customer segments, maximize conversions, optimize advertising bids, and prevent churn
Utilize geospatial and socioeconomic data to build predictive models that identify high-value audiences, leaving the competition in our dust
Design and implement pricing & distribution optimization algorithms that maximize lead conversion rates and minimize customer acquisition costs, ensuring we're always in the black
Collaborate seamlessly with marketing, sales, and product teams, translating data-driven insights into actionable campaigns
Present data findings with clarity, conciseness, and a dash of statistical humor, leaving stakeholders nodding in agreement
You're going to need this to be successful in this role
Master's Degree or PhD in Data Science, Computer Science, Mathematics, Physics, Statistics, Econometrics, Quantitative Methods or a Related Field
5+ years of experience in the data domain with +2 years in data science/machine learning engineer roles
Expertise in SQL, Python, and Machine Learning frameworks (especially supervised and unsupervised learning algorithms)
Proven experience deploying machine learning models to production environments using tools and frameworks like ML Flow & AWS Sagemaker, ensuring our models are always ready for prime time
Exceptional analytical and problem-solving skills with a keen eye for detail
Impeccable communication and presentation skills, capable of translating data insights into actionable business strategies that drive revenue growth without losing the audience in a sea of jargon
A demonstrated ability to work independently and as part of a cross-functional team, ensuring we're always scoring the highest in teamwork
Strong business acumen and the ability to translate data insights into actionable business strategies that drive revenue growth, making us a data-driven powerhouse
Fluent English
It's nice if you also have
Up-to-date with the latest data science techniques, whitepapers, and best practices
We value working on Kaggle projects, so if you have a passion for machine learning and are an active Kaggle contributor, please highlight this in your application
Why choose HomeBuddy
Enjoy the freedom to work from anywhere without being tied to one place - while ensuring you are available to our team during the agreed working hours
Achieve a harmonious work-life balance with a flexible schedule tailored to your local needs, along with paid vacation, sick leave, and local holidays
Empower yourself with work equipment of your choice partially paid for by HomeBuddy and up-to-date apps and tools to maximize your productivity
Feel valued and appreciated with an industry-leading compensation package
Get recognized and rewarded for both outstanding individual efforts leading to extraordinary results and our team success. 
Enhance your well-being with our allowance program covering fitness activities and mental health programs
Learn and expand your knowledge by both working on complex tasks and using paid training opportunities, including courses, events, and conferences
If this sounds like you, we should talk!
Privacy Policy
By sending us your application you agree that Siren Group AG (known as HomeBuddy) will process your personal data to participate in this recruitment process. If you want to know more about how Siren Group AG processes your personal data please click 
here
.

Role: Data Scientist
Location: Remote
Type: Contract (B2B)
Job Description:
Strong foundation in classical machine learning, including supervised and unsupervised learning techniques, model evaluation, and feature engineering.
Expert-level proficiency in Python, with hands-on experience using core data science and machine learning libraries such as scikit-learn, pandas, TensorFlow, and PyTorch.
Proven ability to communicate data-driven insights effectively through compelling visualizations and persuasive storytelling.
Solid understanding of object-oriented programming (OOP) principles in Python.
If lacking experience in Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG), candidate must demonstrate exceptional depth in core machine learning concepts and applications.
Nice-to-Haves:
Practical experience implementing or working with Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG) models or architectures.

description:
Company Description
At Bosch, we shape the future by inventing high-quality technologies and services that spark enthusiasm and enrich people‚Äôs lives. Our promise to our associates is rock-solid: We grow together, we enjoy our work, and we inspire each other. Welcome to Bosch.
The plant in Hatvan founded in 1998 and the largest production centre in the world for the Bosch Group's automotive electronics division. The company's main profile is the series production of control electronics, sensors, radars and camera systems for the future products of the Group's Mobility Solutions business. The strategic objective of Hatvan is to play an active role in the future of automated, accident-free and environmentally friendly motoring by continuously developing its employees' expertise, high-tech manufacturing solutions.
Job Description
Your tasks:
Model Development: Design, train, and fine-tune machine learning models using large-scale datasets to solve complex problems.
Data Management: Collect, clean, and preprocess data to ensure high-quality inputs for AI systems and model training.
Algorithm Implementation: Develop and optimize algorithms for performance, scalability, and integration into production environments.
Cross-functional Collaboration: Work closely with data scientists, software engineers, and product managers to embed AI solutions into real-world applications.
Research & Innovation: Stay current with the latest advancements in AI and machine learning, and apply cutting-edge techniques to ongoing projects.
Testing & Validation: Evaluate model performance through rigorous testing and continuously improve accuracy, robustness, and efficiency.
Qualifications
Bachelor‚Äôs or Master‚Äôs degree in Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, Mathematics, Data Science, Artificial Intelligence, or a related field.
Strong foundation in machine learning, data processing, and algorithm development.
Proficiency in programming languages such as Python, Java, or C++.
Relevant experience in this field (min. 2 years)
Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills.
Ability to work collaboratively in cross-functional teams.
Additional Information
Get to know our  benefits
We would like to help you 
GROW
, so we offer you:
Financial security & recognition: We review and increase your competitive base salary annually, offer performance-, loyalty-, and referral bonus.
Trainings and professional development: We believe in a Life-Long Learning approach, so you can take advantage of several technical and soft skill trainings and language courses. 
Career development: We have a wide range of programs to choose from, even if its leadership, expert or project development you are aiming for. We also offer mentoring and coaching opportunities.
We would like you to ENJOY
 the benefits of balancing your life and your work, so we pay attention to:
Your work life-balance: You can work from our activity based offices designed for creativity and efficiency or from home while enjoying flexible working hours.
Your health and well-being: We provide free professional consultants for any personal, legal, financial or health related issues. 
We also offer you several perks and benefits: You can use your annual cafeteria allowance flexibly for family support (e.g. tax-free kindergarten and nursery allowances), health care. You can enjoy our onsite canteen, we support when you work from home and if you live far, we cover your commute costs. We also appreciate your loyalty.
You could join 
an 
INSPIRING
 community worth to belong:
We are true to our values: We are committed to sustainability, we value that everyone is different and that diversity makes us truly successful. We also take social responsibility seriously and regularly organize charity actions, blood donations and support worthy causes.
Team building activites and community events are also part of our everydays. We like to come together for a good summer party or family day.
Are you ready to work ?
Please apply with your English CV!
If you require any further information, please feel free to contact us on the following number: +36 80 18 08 01. Our colleagues can help you with answers during the weekdays between 08:00 a.m. till 11:00 a.m.
industries: Motor Vehicle Manufacturing, IT Services and IT Consulting, and Appliances, Electrical, and Electronics Manufacturing

Are you passionate about turning complex data into real-world impact? I'm looking for an experienced

.

telecommunications sector
.

 with a strong focus on innovation and growth.

Our client is seeking a highly organized and proactive Administrative Assistant to provide essential support to daily office operations. 
Roles and Responsibilities:
Manage and organize office tasks such as scheduling meetings, managing calendars, and coordinating appointments.
Handle phone calls, emails, and other communications on behalf of management or departments.
Prepare and format documents, reports, presentations, and correspondence.
Maintain filing systems (digital and physical), databases, and records with accuracy and confidentiality.
Assist in coordinating internal and external events, meetings, and travel arrangements.
Order and maintain office supplies and equipment inventory.
Support HR and finance teams with basic administrative tasks such as document verification, data entry, and invoice processing.
Liaise with vendors, clients, and service providers as needed.
Ensure the smooth running of the office by performing general administrative duties.
Follow company policies and procedures, and ensure adherence to administrative protocols.
Key Qualifications:
Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Business Administration, Commerce, or a related field.
1+ years of experience in an administrative or office support role.
Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook) and Google Workspace.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
Strong organizational, multitasking, and time-management abilities.
Attention to detail and a high level of accuracy.
Ability to work independently and handle confidential information with discretion.
Experience with office management systems or tools is a plus.
We are fully GDPR compliant and take your privacy seriously. Your data is never sold to third parties. You may receive marketing emails from our company group only.
industries: Administrative and Support Services and Utilities

description:
Shift requirements of 8-5p or 9-6p EST
About The Position
This Data Entry Specialist will support our REMS call center operations. In this role, you will be responsible for timely and accurate entry of sensitive program and patient data related to Risk Evaluation and Mitigation Strategy (REMS) requirements. Your work will directly support compliance with FDA regulations and ensure patient safety in accessing specialty pharmaceutical products.
Essential Functions
Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.
Accurately enter data from healthcare provider (HCP), patient, and/or pharmacy interactions into the REMS database systems
Review and verify documentation to ensure it aligns with REMS program requirements
Escalate discrepancies or incomplete information in accordance with standard operating procedures (SOPs)
Ability to manage multiple channels, requests, or tasks, able to prioritize, organize, and execute them efficiently and effectively. Maintain solid knowledge base on all initiatives, processes, resources, and materials 
Demonstrate proficient use of technology to enable accurate, timely, and compliant documentation as it relates to activities
Ensure all activities are conducted and properly executed in a manner that is strictly compliant with all MLS, client, and industry mandated rules and regulations
Handle and manage sensitive information and patients‚Äô Personal Health Information (PHI) responsibly and within MLS and client compliance parameters
Work and communicate cohesively within a team to identify collaborative opportunities and enable process improvement.
Other duties - This job description is not designed to cover or contain a comprehensive listing of activities, duties or responsibilities that are required of the employee for this job. Duties, responsibilities, and activities may change at any time with or without notice.
Other Duties
This job description is not designed to cover or contain a comprehensive listing of activities, duties or responsibilities that are required of the employee for this job. Duties, responsibilities, and activities may change at any time with or without notice.
Required Education And/or Experience
High school diploma or equivalent required; Associate or Bachelor‚Äôs degree preferred
1‚Äì3 years of data entry or administrative experience; prior experience in a healthcare, pharmaceutical, or REMS environment strongly preferred
Required License And/or Credential(s)
NA
Required Skills
Familiarity with medical terminology, patient support programs, or REMS a plus
Demonstrate experienced competency and ability to independently navigate technology using multiple platforms, computer screens, and other technical components. 
Ability to quickly learn and accurately retain knowledge in numerous data entry systems
Optimistic, upbeat, and enthusiastic in times of challenge and constant change
Highly adaptable, flexible, and ability to prioritize multiple tasks
Ability to proactively identify potential issues, risks and implementation concerns
Ability to multitask, organize, and prioritize in a fast-paced environment, including follow-up tasks
Proficiency with the Internet, including the ability to perform searches with the use of multiple screens and browser tabs
Proficient with keyboarding skills with a minimum typing speed of 40 WPM
Travel
Special Position Requirements:
Minimal travel required >1%
Working Conditions
Work is generally sedentary in nature but may require standing and walking for up to 10% of the time. The working environment is generally favorable. Lighting and temperature are adequate, and there are no hazardous or unpleasant conditions caused by noise, dust, etc. Work is generally performed within an office environment, with standard office equipment available.
Technical Requirements for Work from Home
Designated workspace free from noise and other distractions
Dedicated Internet access with at least 100 mbps download speed and 20 mbps upload speed
Ability to set up MLS-provided computer equipment and connect it to the Internet via ethernet cable preferred
Physical Requirements
Must be able to read, write, and communicate fluently in English. Ability to communicate effectively (hear, listen, speak) with or without reasonable accommodations.
Anticipated 
Salary Range: 
$21-23hr
Momentum Life Sciences anticipates that the base salary for this position could range up to $23hr, and will depend, in part, on the successful candidate‚Äôs qualifications, including education, experience, and competency for the role. Some roles may include car allowance and eligibility to earn targeted bonus based on company or individual performance.

This is a remote position.
  FNEX is a global leader in private securities transactions and investment banking, specializing in private stock liquidity solutions for institutional investors. The firm provides institutional access and tailored liquidity solutions across a global network of leading private companies. With deep market expertise and a focus on innovation, FNEX facilitates efficient, secure, and strategic transactions in the private capital markets.
 
  We are looking for a detail-oriented and self-motivated Remote Data Entry Typist to join our team. In this role, you will be responsible for typing and inputting information into various systems and databases from your own home. This is a great opportunity for someone looking for a flexible, low-stress remote position that requires minimal prior experience.
 
 
Key Responsibilities:
 
Enter data accurately into spreadsheets, databases, or online systems
 
Review and correct data for errors or inconsistencies
 
Maintain confidentiality of sensitive information
 
Organize and label files as needed
 
Ensure timely completion of daily and weekly tasks
 
Follow guidelines and instructions provided by team leads or supervisors
 
 
Requirements
 
High school diploma or equivalent
 
Good typing speed (30-50 WPM is ideal)
 
Basic computer skills (familiarity with Excel, Google Docs, or other word processing software)
 
Excellent attention to detail
 
Reliable internet connection
 
Ability to work independently and meet deadlines
 
Strong communication skills (written)
 
 
Benefits
 
100% remote 
 
Flexible hours

Lensa is a career site that helps job seekers find great jobs in the US. We are not a staffing firm or agency. Lensa does not hire directly for these jobs, but promotes jobs on LinkedIn on behalf of its direct clients, recruitment ad agencies, and marketing partners. Lensa partners with DirectEmployers to promote this job for Insight Global. Clicking "Apply Now" or "Read more" on Lensa redirects you to the job board/employer site. Any information collected there is subject to their terms and privacy notice.
Job Description
Insight Global is seeking a Data Entry Assistant. The candidate will be responsible for inputting advanced advertising campaigns into internal systems, ensuring order accuracy, creative implementation, and billing precision. This role focuses on helping clients and the internal team make sure advertising campaigns are set up for success before they‚Äôre sold. It includes entering campaign details and ad tags into systems, fixing any issues with campaign delivery, and making sure everything runs smoothly. You‚Äôll also keep track of campaign progress, share updates with the sales team, send reports to clients when needed, and support the Political Sales Team with presentations and special projects. This is a 14-month contract and pays 20-22hr.

1-2 years of hands on experience with data entry/order entry
‚ÄÉ- Proficient with Excel (pivot tables)
‚ÄÉ- Ability to multi-task and prioritize workload surrounding strict deadlines
‚ÄÉ- Experience understanding RFP or revenue driven initiatives
‚ÄÉ- Must have excellent communication, email etiquette, and be detail oriented
Bachelor's Degree Required - Salesforce Experience
Political experience null

Job Title:
 Script Processor (Temp-to-Hire)
Location:
 Remote with occasional onsite support in Charlotte, NC
Pay Range:
 $17-$18/hour
Schedule:
 Monday-Friday, 8:30 AM - 5:00 PM (remote) / 8:00 AM - 5:00 PM (onsite as needed)
Overview
We are seeking detail-oriented and motivated individuals to join our team as Script Processors. This role plays a key part in ensuring accurate documentation and communication between patients, physicians, and insurance providers in the approval process for durable medical equipment.
Key Responsibilities
Review incoming faxes and documentation, scoring paperwork for completeness and likelihood of medical necessity. 
Contact physicians' offices to request missing information (e.g., pages, signatures, diagnoses). 
Make outbound calls to follow up on documentation requests and build positive relationships with office staff. 
Handle inbound calls, providing status updates to patients on their equipment approval process. 
Accurately document all interactions and maintain compliance with Medicare and insurance guidelines. 
Support scheduling, paperwork verification, and process follow-up to ensure smooth case progression. 
Qualifications
High School Diploma or equivalent required. 
Previous call center or customer service experience required. 
Basic exposure to medical documentation or healthcare processes strongly preferred. 
Strong verbal and written communication skills with professional phone presence. 
Proficient in Windows-based systems and data entry. 
Comfortable in a sedentary role requiring focus and attention to detail. 
Opportunity
This is a temp-to-hire opportunity offering stability, growth potential, and the chance to work in a supportive environment where accuracy and customer care make a real difference.
Pay Details:
 $17.00 to $18.00 per hour
Benefit offerings available for our associates include medical, dental, vision, life insurance, short-term disability, additional voluntary benefits, EAP program, commuter benefits and a 401K plan. Our benefit offerings provide employees the flexibility to choose the type of coverage that meets their individual needs. In addition, our associates may be eligible for paid leave including Paid Sick Leave or any other paid leave required by Federal, State, or local law, as well as Holiday pay where applicable.
Equal Opportunity Employer/Veterans/Disabled

Job Title: Compliance - Registration Renewals Specialist
Work Environment
The position is business professional and requires independent work within an office setting. You will work from Monday to Friday, 8:00 AM to 4:30 PM, with a 30-minute lunch break. The office offers a quiet workspace with individual desks and cubicles and supportive colleagues available for questions.
Qualifications
1+ years of recent office experience in data entry, clerical, or administrative roles. 
Strong attention to detail. 
High School Diploma or equivalent. 
Familiarity with Microsoft Excel and Microsoft Suite. 
Responsibilities
Print title, registration, and tax documents based on owner, state, and specific client or vehicle instructions to ensure compliance within state and county statutes. 
Identify, analyze, and research to resolve state, county, and province license and title rejections or questions related to title, registration, and tax. 
Create, update, and adjust print positions on a form through Forms Definition. 
Order duplicate Manufacturer's Statement of Origin (MSO) directly through the manufacturer website and follow up until received. 
Process title and registration transactions for vehicles moving to new states/provinces, for buyouts, and new vehicle deliveries not completed by delivering dealers. Obtain and issue temporary tags as appropriate. 
Maximize transactions completed timely by following up with appropriate parties to ensure team metrics. 
Perform inquiries with DMV agencies to validate data associated with a vehicle identification number (VIN). 
Perform dealer follow-up to address pending concerns with initial title and registration. 
Manage temporary tags to ensure vehicles comply within the state until hard plates are issued, follow-up as needed. 
Process registration renewals using the appropriate resource for each jurisdiction, achieving department performance standards for accuracy and timeliness. 
Ensure clients are billed correctly for renewals by verifying registration and service fees. 
Reconcile discrepancies using data acquired from databases and vendor reports. 
Contact drivers or clients when jurisdiction requirements are needed to complete renewals and coordinate with other departments to fulfill missing or late requirements. 
Pay and Benefits
The pay range for this position is $20.00 - $20.00/hr.
Requirements
Eligibility requirements apply to some benefits and may depend on your job classification and length of employment. Benefits are subject to change and may be subject to specific elections, plan, or program terms. If eligible, the benefits available for this temporary role may include the following:
 Medical, dental & vision
 Critical Illness, Accident, and Hospital
 401(k) Retirement Plan ‚Äì Pre-tax and Roth post-tax contributions available
 Life Insurance (Voluntary Life & AD&D for the employee and dependents)
 Short and long-term disability
 Health Spending Account (HSA)
 Transportation benefits
 Employee Assistance Program
 Time Off/Leave (PTO, Vacation or Sick Leave)
Workplace Type
This is a fully onsite position in Schaumburg,IL.
Application Deadline
This position is anticipated to close on Sep 17, 2025.

Aston Carter provides world-class corporate talent solutions to thousands of clients across the globe. Specialized in accounting, finance, human resources, talent acquisition, procurement, supply chain and select administrative professions, we extend the capabilities of industry-leading companies. We draw on our deep recruiting expertise and expansive network to meet the evolving needs of our clients and talent community with agility and excellence. With offices across the U.S., Canada, Asia Pacific and Europe, Aston Carter serves many of the Fortune 500. We are proud to be a ClearlyRated Best of Staffing¬Æ double diamond winner for both client and talent service.

Loewe, a prestigious name in luxury fashion, is seeking a dynamic and detail-oriented Media Trainee to join our innovative marketing team in the Americas. This is an exceptional opportunity to contribute to the growth and amplification of a globally recognized brand while gaining hands-on experience across a diverse range of media channels. If you are a passionate and driven individual with a keen interest in media, fashion, and brand building, we invite you to apply.
Role Overview:
As a Media Trainee, you will play a vital role in supporting the planning and execution of paid media strategies that elevate Loewe's brand presence across print, digital, and out-of-home platforms. Collaborating closely with the Retail and Wholesale teams, you will contribute to high-visibility brand projects, ensuring all campaigns align with Loewe's impeccable brand standards and aesthetic. This position offers invaluable exposure to a fast-paced corporate environment and the chance to develop your skills in a dynamic and supportive setting.
Key Responsibilities:
Campaign Support:
 Assist in the strategic planning and flawless execution of paid media and marketing campaigns, guided by the Marketing Manager and Head of Department.
Media Plan Management:
 Maintain meticulous and current media plans, including campaign timelines, specifications, and budget allocations.
Performance Analysis:
 Contribute to the preparation of comprehensive Post-Campaign Analysis reports, providing valuable insights for future strategies.
Asset Coordination:
 Oversee the seamless allocation and delivery of creative assets for print, digital, and out-of-home activations.
Market Research:
 Conduct in-depth competitive research and trend analysis to identify opportunities and inform campaign development.
Documentation and Reporting:
 Manage campaign documentation, including screenshots, proof-of-posting, and meeting minutes, ensuring accurate record-keeping.
Qualifications and Attributes:
1‚Äì2 years of experience in media, communications, or marketing (relevant internships considered).
Unwavering attention to detail, with strong spreadsheet management and data entry skills.
A demonstrated passion for fashion, social media, and the evolving landscape of traditional and digital media.
Exceptional communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to collaborate effectively and contribute to a positive team environment.
Proven ability to thrive in a fast-paced, deadline-driven environment.
Superior organizational and time management skills.
Advanced proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite, particularly Excel.
Department:
 Marketing and Communications, Americas
Reports To:
 Senior Media & Marketing Manager, Americas
Location:
 New York City
Elevate Your Career at Loewe:
This is an exceptional opportunity to join a world-renowned luxury brand and contribute to innovative media strategies that shape its future. If you are ready to take your career to the next level, we encourage you to apply.

$20 hourly

Overview
Data Entry Specialist
About SPAR
SPAR is a global leader in consumer solutions, proudly partnering with top-tier CPG brands and Fortune 100 retailers across 10 countries. As we continue to grow, we're expanding our Team with passionate professionals who are ready to make an impact. If you thrive in a fast-paced environment, enjoy solving problems, and are driven by operational excellence-we want to hear from you!
Why SPAR?
Work Environment: In-office position based in Charlotte, NC 
Competitive Pay: We recognize and reward your expertise 
Robust Benefits: Medical, Dental, Vision, Life Insurance & more 
Retirement Options: 401(k) and Roth plans to help you plan ahead 
Generous PTO: Maintain work-life balance with paid vacation and personal time 
Career Growth: Ongoing learning and development opportunities 
Inclusive Culture: Join a collaborative, diverse team committed to innovation and respect 
What You'll Do
The Data Entry Specialist is responsible for providing high-quality administrative and financial data entry support to the Finance department. Under the direction of the Finance Manager, this role ensures that financial documentation is accurately entered, validated, and maintained in accordance with internal procedures and client requirements. To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to carry out the essential duties with accuracy and efficiency. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and ability required.
Key Responsibilities
Accurately enter supplier and customer invoices into Workday. 
Validate data entries and cross-reference against supporting documentation to ensure accuracy and compliance. 
Maintain well-organized digital and physical records of processed invoices and related documents.Track and monitor invoice statuses across systems, ensuring timely submission and follow-up as needed. 
Communicate with internal teams and external partners to confirm invoice information and resolve discrepancies. 
Follow established finance and data entry procedures and assist with updating process documentation. 
Provide general administrative support and participate in ad hoc data entry or finance-related projects as assigned. 
Function effectively in a fast-paced, team-oriented environment where attention to detail and collaboration are essential. 
What You Bring
Must possess strong attention to detail and demonstrate high levels of accuracy in data entry tasks. 
Organizational skills are essential to manage and prioritize tasks efficiently across multiple systems and stakeholders. 
Must be proficient in Microsoft Excel (e.g., sorting, filtering, and basic formulas); experience with Workday or similar systems is a plus. 
Must have excellent communication skills, both verbal and written. 
Must work well independently and collaboratively within a team structure. 
Experience in a finance or accounting support role is preferred; accounts receivable (AR) experience is helpful but not required. 
Ready to Make an Impact?
Join SPAR and be part of a high-performance payroll team where your work directly supports our people and fuels our success. We're building the future-together.
Apply now and help shape what's next!
DISCLAIMER: The preceding description is not designed to be a complete list of all duties and responsibilities required.
SPAR has over 50 years of experience in retail and consumer goods, serving some of the world's best companies. We offer end-to-end services to ensure our client's product is available and presented most compellingly. We focus on our client's return on investment (ROI) by applying our unique software solutions, experienced resources, and passion for results.

Improper interference with the ability of SPAR's employees to perform their job duties may result in discipline up to and including discharge.

Description
At MercyOne, health care is more than just a doctor‚Äôs visit or a place to go when you‚Äôre in need of medical attention. Our Mission is based on improving the health of our communities ‚Äì that means not only when you are sick but keeping you well.
MercyOne Genesis serves a 17-county bi-state region of the Quad Cities (Davenport and Bettendorf, Iowa, and Rock Island and Moline, Ill.) metropolitan area and the surrounding communities of Eastern Iowa and Western Illinois. But when it comes to clinical capabilities and quality, we exceed those geographical limits. We have earned distinction as a two-time national Top 15 Health System, and recognition for being in the top 1 percent in the nation for patient safety.
Want to learn more about MercyOne Genesis? Click here: MercyOne Genesis | Stronger. Together. As One! 
Join the MercyOne Family! We are looking to hire an Office Receptionist
As an Office Receptionist at MercyOne, you will be responsible for coordinating all patient activities including greeting patient/families, processing patient registrations in an efficient and courteous manner, obtaining accurate patient demographics and insurance information and obtaining all necessary consents. Serves as the initial point of contact for patients coming into the clinics. Ability to explain patient account charges, insurance verification and data entry for patient charges. Greets, instructs, directs and schedules all patients and visitors. Transfers incoming phone calls to appropriate clinic staff and physicians. Serves as a liaison between patient and medical support staff including organizing and coordinating request to Provider‚Äôs inbox and completing medical records request.

Office Receptionist
Department: 
Moline Healthplex
Schedule
Full time 1.0 (40 hours per week)
Day Shift 8am - 5pm M-F
