description:
Data Analysts in People Analytics drive the business by empowering HR, Recruiting, and business leaders to incorporate people insights into workforce and business decisions. In this role, you will create analysis with people data, create dashboards for scaled solutions and efficient reporting, and develop materials for leaders of the company to drive strategy. You will partner with People Analytics teams to influence priorities, perform research, and build solutions for the future. The People Data Analyst is the link between the business and complex data requirements that cannot be accessed through self solve channels. We are currently looking for Data Analysts who are interested in finding the right data to solve business challenges while recognizing opportunities to build new functionally and improve existing systems. We are looking for someone who enjoys building, figuring out the best way to achieve results, and working closely with teams across Meta to solve complex problems.
Data Analyst - People Analytics Responsibilities:
Act as an internal consultant and partner to HR, Recruiting, and business leaders and engage with the broader analytics community to deliver insights, research and scalable solutions
Apply expertise in data analytics to identify business relevant insights and develop executive level presentations to influence people strategy
Recognize patterns and changing requirements to identify opportunities to build new analytics and reporting capabilities to support program evaluation and operations
Focus on impact and propose metrics to understand success of People initiatives
Manage multiple concurrent projects that require inputs from cross-functional stakeholders while balancing impact on business needs
Deliver analytical findings to company leadership
Leverage data analysis tools, such as Python, R, SQL, Tableau, and spreadsheets to develop models, understand trends, and extract insights
Demonstrate judgment and discretion when dealing with highly sensitive people data
Intake on business needs and apply contextual knowledge in order to scope data requests, synthesize insights, and recommend solutions to key business partners in collaboration with others
Proactively manage stakeholder expectations, manage escalations and resolve issues in a timely manner
Minimum Qualifications:
BA/BS in Engineering, Industrial Psychology, Data Science, or related field with 5+ years (or MBA/MA/MS with 4+ years or PhD and 3+ years) experience in fields such as analytics, management consulting, sales operations, finance, compensation, or related areas
4+ years of data analysis, quantitative/qualitative research, experience gathering and evaluating data and validating hypotheses
3+ years of experience working with SQL or relational database, data modeling, and advanced querying
3+ years of experience with data visualization tools (Tableau, Visier, MS PBI, Qlik, SAS VA, etc.)
3+ years of storytelling with data, communicating technical results to technical and non-technical audiences
2+ years of experience with program management, directing tasks and managing multiple streams of work
Preferred Qualifications:
Experience working with HR/organizational people data (e.g., headcount, turnover, recruiting metrics)
Experience working across various levels of an organization, while building trust and fostering collaboration
2+ years of dashboard development using advanced Tableau functionality (e.g. data blending)
3+ years of experience SQL and data pipeline development and automation
3+ years of experience with Python or R and developing solutions that scale
About Meta:
Meta builds technologies that help people connect, find communities, and grow businesses. When Facebook launched in 2004, it changed the way people connect. Apps like Messenger, Instagram and WhatsApp further empowered billions around the world. Now, Meta is moving beyond 2D screens toward immersive experiences like augmented and virtual reality to help build the next evolution in social technology. People who choose to build their careers by building with us at Meta help shape a future that will take us beyond what digital connection makes possible today‚Äîbeyond the constraints of screens, the limits of distance, and even the rules of physics.
Meta is proud to be an Equal Employment Opportunity and Affirmative Action employer. We do not discriminate based upon race, religion, color, national origin, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, or related medical conditions), sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, gender expression, transgender status, sexual stereotypes, age, status as a protected veteran, status as an individual with a disability, or other applicable legally protected characteristics. We also consider qualified applicants with criminal histories, consistent with applicable federal, state and local law. Meta participates in the E-Verify program in certain locations, as required by law. Please note that Meta may leverage artificial intelligence and machine learning technologies in connection with applications for employment.
Meta is committed to providing reasonable accommodations for candidates with disabilities in our recruiting process. If you need any assistance or accommodations due to a disability, please let us know at accommodations-ext@fb.com.
$104,000/year to $146,000/year + bonus + equity + benefits
Individual compensation is determined by skills, qualifications, experience, and location. Compensation details listed in this posting reflect the base hourly rate, monthly rate, or annual salary only, and do not include bonus, equity or sales incentives, if applicable. In addition to base compensation, Meta offers benefits. Learn more about  benefits  at Meta.

Data Analyst I ‚Äì Geospatial & Competitive Insights
We are seeking a Data Analyst to perform geospatial and competitive bid analysis, providing insights that inform strategic decision-making. This role involves analyzing bid locations, creating summary statistics, and developing dashboards to track performance metrics. You will work with geospatial datasets, automation scripts, and state-specific formatting requirements to produce accurate, actionable outputs for the business.
The ideal candidate will have strong analytical skills, experience in Python scripting, and proficiency in Excel, with SQL knowledge as a plus. Attention to detail, adaptability, and the ability to communicate effectively with stakeholders are essential.
Key Responsibilities
Conduct map-based analysis to inform bidding strategies, including data review, Python scripting, and statistical summaries.
Analyze locations bid and won, including competitive bid trends and insights.
Combine geospatial data with reference tables to create meaningful, actionable reports.
Design and maintain dashboards/visualizations for BEAD location statistics.
Generate specification files using automated scripts, ensuring compliance with state-required formatting standards.
Top Required Skills
Analytical & Modeling Skills ‚Äì Ability to perform data analysis, create forecasts, and solve business problems using structured approaches.
Python ‚Äì Basic scripting for automation, data transformation, and analysis.
Excel ‚Äì Proficiency in advanced formulas, pivot tables, and data organization.
Skills & Experience Required
Undergraduate degree in business, finance, engineering, or a related field (Graduate degree preferred).
0‚Äì3 years of experience in data analysis, business forecasting, or a related role.
Experience in building and managing financial models for forecasting and variance analysis.
Basic Python knowledge; SQL experience preferred.
Strong written and verbal communication skills.
Highly detail-oriented, with the ability to prioritize and adapt in a dynamic environment.
Work Environment & Structure
Collaborative team environment with opportunities to work independently on analytical projects.
Mix of technical analysis, reporting, and stakeholder communication.
Exposure to high-impact strategic initiatives through data-driven decision-making.
Why This Role?
This position offers the opportunity to combine geospatial analysis, automation, and strategic insight to directly influence competitive positioning. You will gain hands-on experience in data analytics, visualization, and business strategy in a dynamic and evolving industry.
 JW1

Production Allocation Data Analyst - Offshore Oil and Gas Operations
Job Summary
The Allocation Data Analyst supports hydrocarbon allocation and production reporting by validating data across 
offshore
 operated and non-operated assets within the 
oil and gas industry
. This role is critical to ensuring the accuracy of data used for production accounting, revenue accounting, finance, commercial, partner, and regulatory reporting.
As part of the Production Measurement and Allocation (PMA) team, the analyst will utilize allocation software, applications, databases, and dashboards to support key business decisions and maintain compliance with governance standards.
This position is based at the Houston corporate office, with the option to work remotely on Fridays.
Responsibilities
Perform daily, weekly, and monthly allocation reviews using production/metering data and dashboards from offshore facilities.
Validate and reconcile data from reports, SCADA, and PI/Canary historians.
Support allocation methodologies, including calculation logic for offshore facilities.
Develop and enhance metering and allocation workflows to improve visibility and accuracy.
Collaborate with production engineers, offshore personnel, accounting teams, finance, land/legal, and commercial teams to align on measurement and allocation data.
Validate laboratory analysis data within the sampling database.
Support internal and external audits for offshore operated and non-operated assets.
Assist partners and multiple producers with data-related inquiries.
Resolve data anomalies and identify well test issues in coordination with production engineers.
Detect meter and data input discrepancies in partnership with operations teams and measurement coordinators.
Contribute to continuous improvement of measurement, allocation, and reporting systems.
Qualifications/Requirements
Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Engineering or a related field.
Experience in measurement and allocation, production databases, and allocation tools (e.g., ProCount).
Proficiency in Excel, SQL, Power BI, and Python.
Familiarity with SCADA, PI historian, and Canary.
Experience working with 
offshore oil and gas operations
.
Office Hours:
Monday ‚Äì Thursday: 7:30 AM ‚Äì 5:30 PM
Friday: 8:00 AM ‚Äì 12:00 PM

Job Description
Jefferies Financial Group Inc. (‚Äò‚ÄòJefferies,‚Äô‚Äô ‚Äò‚Äòwe,‚Äô‚Äô ‚Äò‚Äòus‚Äô‚Äô or ‚Äò‚Äòour‚Äô‚Äô) is a U.S.-headquartered global full service, integrated investment banking and securities firm. Our largest subsidiary, Jefferies LLC, a U.S. broker-dealer, was founded in the U.S. in 1962 and our first international operating subsidiary, Jefferies International Limited, a U.K. broker-dealer, was established in the U.K. in 1986. Our strategy focuses on continuing to build out our investment banking effort, enhancing our capital markets businesses and further developing our asset management platform. We are seeking a Data Analyst with a strong foundation in Data Science to help drive data-driven decision-making. The ideal candidate will have expertise in data analysis, statistical modeling, machine learning, and data visualization to extract actionable insights from complex datasets.
Key Responsibilities:
Collect, clean, and preprocess data from various sources.

Develop and implement predictive models and machine learning algorithms. 
Create data visualizations and dashboards to communicate insights effectively. 
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand business needs and provide data-driven solutions. 
Ensure data integrity, security, and compliance with relevant regulations. 
Stay updated with the latest data science techniques and industry trends. 
Required Skills & Qualifications:
Bachelor's or Master's degree in Data Science, Statistics, Computer Science, or a related field. 
Proficiency in Python, R, SQL
Strong understanding of machine learning algorithms, statistical analysis, and data mining techniques. 
Excellent problem-solving skills and ability to translate business needs into data-driven solutions. 
Prior experience in Capital Markets is highly preferred. 
Preferred Qualifications:
Experience with deep learning frameworks (TensorFlow, PyTorch). 
Knowledge of Natural Language Processing (NLP) and Time Series Analysis. 
Familiarity with ETL processes and data pipeline automation.

A CAREER WITH POINT72‚ÄôS MARKET INTELLIGENCE TEAM
On our proprietary research team‚ÄîMarket Intelligence‚Äîyou‚Äôll partner with our investment professionals and Compliance team to work with alternative data to uncover insights about companies, industries, and the broader economy through deep fundamental research and applying data science and engineering techniques. You‚Äôll work alongside a talented team with diverse skills, backgrounds, and perspectives. Our sector data analysts, data scientists, data managers, and engineers work together to build compliant research products that are incorporated into the research process of our investment professionals. We look for other bright, motivated, and collaborative people to join our team and grow with us‚Äîa majority of the leaders in our group were promoted from within.
What You‚Äôll Do
As a sector analyst, you will work with alternative data to gather industry context and business fundamentals. You will then partner with our team of data scientists and engineers to develop analyses that you deliver as synthesized insights to our investment professionals to help aid in their research processes. Produce research for internal consumption by our investment professionals across a variety of mediums, including written research reports, verbal communication, and visualization tools
Interact directly with our investment professionals to learn the discretionary investment process from them and help drive more informed investment decisions

An undergraduate degree or advanced degree with demonstrated academic success

Comfort with analyzing novel data and explaining concepts to non-technical partners

Are you curious about how financial instruments, benchmarks and indices are used within the Asset Management lifecycle? Are you organized and have an eye for detail? Are you motivated by analytical challenges?
We‚Äôre looking for a Data Analyst who can:
 complete and support data lifecycle tasks for security reference, pricing, benchmark, index, and analytics data including setup, maintenance, validation, reconciliation, and deactivation within agreed SLAs.
 respond to internal requests to clarify, verify, reconcile, and control security, index, benchmark, and performance data ensuring completeness, accuracy, and timeliness.
 control, analyze, calculate, and maintain systems/databases to ensure the accuracy and integrity of static and time series data across applications.
 follow, document, and review standard operating procedures, to ensure its fit for purpose.
 conduct comprehensive business analysis and define requirements for data management processes and system workflows.
 engage in User Acceptance Testing (UAT) and oversee Production releases, collaborating with data vendors, operations teams, and stakeholders to resolve data issues and ensure adherence to (SLAs).
Detailed salary information:
 Chicago: the salary range for this role is $52000 to $65000
The expected salary range(s) for this role as of the date of this posting is/are based on factors including, but not limited to, experience, qualifications, education, location and skill level. This role may also be eligible for discretionary incentive compensation. For benefits information, please visit ubs.com/usbenefits .
Your team
You will be working in the Data Services team within Asset Management Chief Data Office. You will be supporting the day-to-day processes carried out by the Data Services team, which would include providing timely, accurate and complete security reference, pricing, benchmark, index, and analytics data to the UBS Asset Management Division ‚Äì in line with defined requirements.
Team provides 24*7 coverage to ensure uninterrupted support and assistance to the Asset Management Division. Team members are in Chicago, Zurich, Krakow, Singapore, and Pune.
Your expertise
 a university degree, ideally in ‚Äì Business Mgmt. / Finance / Information Technology
 solid knowledge of asset classes, financial instruments, benchmarks, indices
 working knowledge of leading market data platforms (e.g., Bloomberg, ICE, Rimes)
 solid experience with reconciliation, root cause analysis and complex troubleshooting
 proficiency in data manipulation and analysis tools (Excel/VBA/Macro, SQL is plus)
 strong communication skills (English) both verbal and written.
 experience with tools such as: SQL, Alteryx, PowerBI, SimCorp Dimension Platform preferred
 Intellectually curious, accountable, and data-driven
 a self-starter with an ability to work with minimal supervision as part of a team.
 an individual who possesses a positive, action-oriented attitude and initiative taker
 able to challenge the status quo and suggest viable and actionable alternative approaches.
About Us
UBS is the world‚Äôs largest and the only truly global wealth manager. We operate through four business divisions: Global Wealth Management, Personal & Corporate Banking, Asset Management and the Investment Bank. Our global reach and the breadth of our expertise set us apart from our competitors.
We have a presence in all major financial centers in more than 50 countries.
How We Hire
We may request you to complete one or more assessments during the application process. Learn more
Join us
At UBS, we know that it's our people, with their diverse skills, experiences and backgrounds, who drive our ongoing success. We‚Äôre dedicated to our craft and passionate about putting our people first, with new challenges, a supportive team, opportunities to grow and flexible working options when possible. Our inclusive culture brings out the best in our employees, wherever they are on their career journey. We also recognize that great work is never done alone. That‚Äôs why collaboration is at the heart of everything we do. Because together, we‚Äôre more than ourselves.
We‚Äôre committed to disability inclusion and if you need reasonable accommodation/adjustments throughout our recruitment process, you can always contact us.
Disclaimer / Policy Statements
UBS is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We respect and seek to empower each individual and support the diverse cultures, perspectives, skills and experiences within our workforce.
Salary Information
US Only: The expected salary range for this role is $52000 to $65000 based on factors including, but not limited to, experience, qualifications, education, location and skill level. Please see ¬´Your role¬ª section for detailed salary information.
industries: Banking, Financial Services, and Investment Banking

description:
About Ascendion
Ascendion is a full-service digital engineering solutions company. We make and manage software platforms and products that power growth and deliver captivating experiences to consumers and employees. Our engineering, cloud, data, experience design, and talent solution capabilities accelerate transformation and impact for enterprise clients. Headquartered in New Jersey, our workforce of 6,000+ Ascenders delivers solutions from around the globe. Ascendion is built differently to engineer the next.
Ascendion | Engineering to elevate life
We have a culture built on opportunity, inclusion, and a spirit of partnership. Come, change the world with us: ‚Ä¢ Build the coolest tech for world‚Äôs leading brands ‚Ä¢ Solve complex problems ‚Äì and learn new skills ‚Ä¢ Experience the power of transforming digital engineering for Fortune 500 clients ‚Ä¢ Master your craft with leading training programs and hands-on experience
Experience a community of change makers!
Join a culture of high-performing innovators with endless ideas and a passion for tech. Our culture is the fabric of our company, and it is what makes us unique and diverse. The way we share ideas, learning, experiences, successes, and joy allows everyone to be their best at Ascendion.
*** About the Role ***
Job Title: Data Analyst
Key Responsibilities
 ‚Ä¢ Formulate requirements by translating business questions into measurable data needs. ‚Ä¢ Develop technical specifications, QA guides for data integrity, and feature-level dashboards that align with OKRs. ‚Ä¢ Validate dashboard data, present outcomes, and provide actionable recommendations. ‚Ä¢ Build and maintain custom reports/dashboards in Adobe CJA Workspaces. ‚Ä¢ Collaborate with agile development teams, product managers, and designers to ensure analytics align with business objectives. ‚Ä¢ Attend standups, design reviews, data analytics touchpoints, and ad hoc reviews to maintain alignment and consistency across projects. ‚Ä¢ Partner with Analytics Launch Developers to coordinate implementation and ensure accurate data collection.
Required Qualifications:
 ‚Ä¢ 10+ years of industry experience. ‚Ä¢ Expert-level data analysis and visualization skills with proven ability to create impactful dashboards and validate data integrity. ‚Ä¢ Specialized expertise in Adobe Analytics / Customer Journey Analytics (CJA). ‚Ä¢ Strong storytelling ability with exceptional attention to detail. ‚Ä¢ Demonstrated success in interpreting and presenting complex data sets to business and technical stakeholders. ‚Ä¢ Excellent collaboration and communication skills with the ability to work effectively in cross-functional teams.
Nice to Have
 ‚Ä¢ Experience in the healthcare industry. ‚Ä¢ Familiarity with UX design principles and ability to design wireframes/mockups (Miro, Figma). ‚Ä¢ Background in agile project management methodologies. ‚Ä¢ Knowledge of R or other statistical tools.
Salary Range: The salary for this position is between $100,000 ‚Äì $110,000 annually. Factors which may affect pay within this range may include geography/market, skills, education, experience, and other qualifications of the successful candidate.
Benefits: The Company offers the following benefits for this position, subject to applicable eligibility requirements: [medical insurance] [dental insurance] [vision insurance] [401(k) retirement plan] [long-term disability insurance] [short-term disability insurance] [5 personal days accrued each calendar year. The Paid time off benefits meet the paid sick and safe time laws that pertains to the City/ State] [10-15 days of paid vacation time] [6 paid holidays and 1 floating holiday per calendar year] [Ascendion Learning Management System]
Want to change the world? Let us know.
Tell us about your experiences, education, and ambitions. Bring your knowledge, unique viewpoint, and creativity to the table. Let‚Äôs talk!

Job Summary:
We are looking for a detail-oriented and analytical Data Analyst to collect, process, and perform statistical analyses on large datasets. The ideal candidate has a strong foundation in data analytics, critical thinking skills, and the ability to transform data into actionable insights to support strategic decision-making.
Key Responsibilities:
Collect, clean, and validate data from multiple sources to ensure accuracy and reliability.
Analyze data to identify trends, patterns, and insights that inform business decisions.
Develop and maintain dashboards, reports, and data visualizations using tools like Tableau, Power BI, or similar.
Work closely with stakeholders to understand data requirements and translate them into technical solutions.
Create and maintain documentation related to data processes and analytics.
Perform exploratory data analysis (EDA) to uncover new business opportunities.
Assist in designing and implementing data models and databases for optimal performance.
Required Qualifications:
Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Data Science, Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science, Economics, or a related field.
Proficiency in data analysis tools and languages such as SQL, Excel, Python, or R.
Experience with data visualization tools like Tableau, Power BI, or Looker.
Strong understanding of statistical methods and data modelling techniques.
Ability to work with large datasets and manage multiple tasks effectively.
Strong communication skills with the ability to present complex information clearly.

Lensa is a career site that helps job seekers find great jobs in the US. We are not a staffing firm or agency. Lensa does not hire directly for these jobs, but promotes jobs on LinkedIn on behalf of its direct clients, recruitment ad agencies, and marketing partners. Lensa partners with DirectEmployers to promote this job for City National Bank. Clicking "Apply Now" or "Read more" on Lensa redirects you to the job board/employer site. Any information collected there is subject to their terms and privacy notice.
If you are hired to this position, you will be employed by Magnit Global. You will not be employed by City National Bank.
The Opportunity
We are seeking a detail-oriented and proactive Data Analyst to support a critical data enhancement initiative.
The Responsibilities
Validate data inputs from sourcing documentation or systems, 
Thorough QA/QC review 
Updating and maintaining our custodian system to ensure complete and accurate data capture. 
Update the custodian system by identifying and populating missing data fields. 
Assist in reviewing client records to identify missing data inputs. 
Track and monitor the progress of data capture, validation, and review. 
Collaborate with internal teams to ensure a coordinated and efficient process. 
Maintain accurate records and documentation throughout the data lifecycle. 
Additional adhoc projects as needed. 
The Qualifications
Bachelor's Degree or equivalent experience 
1‚Äì3+ years in a data analyst, data quality, or operations analyst role 
Experience with data validation, QA/QC, and record management 
Familiarity with custodian systems, CRM, or enterprise data management tools 
Data Management Tools: Excel (advanced functions, VLOOKUP, pivot tables, data cleaning), SQL, Access, or similar 
Data Quality/Validation: Ability to audit, identify inconsistencies, and reconcile missing/incorrect data 
System Knowledge: Experience updating records in enterprise systems or custodian platforms 
Documentation: Strong skills in tracking, monitoring, and maintaining data lifecycle documentation 
Knowledge of financial services, investment operations, or custodian data preferred 
Familiarity with regulatory or compliance-driven data requirements preferred 
Exposure to data enhancement or data governance projects preferred 
Experience with workflow tools (JIRA, Smartsheet, SharePoint, or similar) preferred 
This is the pay range that Magnit reasonably expects to pay for this position: $40.35/hour - $43.25/hour
Benefits: Medical, Dental, Vision, 401K
QUALIFICATION/LICENSURE
Work Authorization :
 Green Card, US Citizen, Other valid work visa
Preferred years of experience :
 1 years
Travel required :
 No travel required
Shift Timings
If you have questions about this posting, please contact support@lensa.com

Job Title
Data Analyst (Business Intelligence)
Job Description
Your role:
Acting as a strategic analytics partner across departments like Finance, Clinical Operations, and Distribution. Translating complex business challenges into actionable, data-driven insights to improve decision-making.
Leading the creation and enhancement of enterprise dashboards using tools like Power BI, Tableau, and Looker, while delivering visual analytics that uncover trends and support performance optimization.
Developing and maintaining robust SQL queries and ETL/ELT pipelines across diverse systems including EMRs, ERPs, and cloud platforms. Collaborating with data engineers and architects to build scalable infrastructure like data lakes and APIs.
Championing data integrity through QA standards, validation protocols, and governance frameworks. Supporting enterprise-wide data governance by defining standardized KPIs and business metrics.
Contributing to the data strategy by identifying emerging tools and best practices in analytics. Mentoring junior analysts, while promoting a culture of data literacy and continuous improvement across teams.
You're the right fit if: 
You‚Äôve acquired 2+ years of experience in business intelligence, analytics, or data engineering, preferably within a healthcare environment.
Your skills include:
Advanced SQL expertise and hands-on experience working with large, complex datasets from multiple sources.
Proficiency in leading BI platforms such as Power BI, Tableau, or Looker.
Demonstrated ability to lead cross-functional initiatives and present insights to senior leadership.
You have a Bachelor's or Master's Degree in Information Management, Information Systems, Computer Science, Data Analytics or equivalent years of experience.
You must be able to successfully perform the following minimum Physical, Cognitive and Environmental job requirements with or without accommodation for this position.
You‚Äôre an strong communicator with a talent for storytelling through data and a highly motivated, self-starter with the ability to multitask and work independently in a fast-paced environment.
How We Work Together
We believe that we are better together than apart. For our office-based teams, this means working in-person at least 3 days per week. Onsite roles require full-time presence in the company‚Äôs facilities. Field roles are most effectively done outside of the company‚Äôs main facilities, generally at the customers‚Äô or suppliers‚Äô locations.
This is an office role.
About Philips
We are a health technology company. We built our entire company around the belief that every human matters, and we won't stop until everybody everywhere has access to the quality healthcare that we all deserve. Do the work of your life to help improve the lives of others.
Learn more about our business.
Discover our rich and exciting history.
Learn more about our purpose.
Learn more about our culture.
Philips Transparency Details 
The pay range for this position in Malvern, PA is $97,000 to $154,000.
The actual base pay offered may vary within the posted ranges depending on multiple factors including job-related knowledge/skills, experience, business needs, geographical location, and internal equity.
In addition, other compensation, such as an annual incentive bonus, sales commission or long-term incentives may be offered. Employees are eligible to participate in our comprehensive Philips Total Rewards benefits program, which includes a generous PTO, 401k (up to 7% match), HSA (with company contribution), stock purchase plan, education reimbursement and much more. Details about our benefits can be found here.
At Philips, it is not typical for an individual to be hired at or near the top end of the range for their role and compensation decisions are dependent upon the facts and circumstances of each case.
Additional Information
US work authorization is a precondition of employment. The company will not consider candidates who require sponsorship for a work-authorized visa, now or in the future.
Company relocation benefits 
will not
 be provided for this position. For this position, you must reside in 
or
 within commuting distance to Malvern, PA
.
This requisition is expected to stay active for 45 days but may close earlier if a successful candidate is selected or business necessity dictates. Interested candidates are encouraged to apply as soon as possible to ensure consideration.
Philips is an Equal Employment and Opportunity Employer including Disability/Vets and maintains a drug-free workplace.
#ConnectedCare

About Air Apps
At Air Apps, we believe in thinking bigger‚Äîand moving faster. We‚Äôre a family-founded company on a mission to create the world‚Äôs first AI-powered Personal & Entrepreneurial Resource Planner (PRP), and we need your passion and ambition to help us change how people plan, work, and live. Born in Lisbon, Portugal in 2018‚Äîand now with offices in both Lisbon and San Francisco‚Äîwe‚Äôve remained self-funded while reaching over 100 million downloads worldwide.
Our long-term focus drives us to challenge the status quo every day, pushing the boundaries of AI-driven solutions that truly make a difference. Here, you‚Äôll be a creative force, shaping products that empower people across the globe.
Join us on this journey to redefine resource management‚Äîand change lives along the way.
The Role
As a 
Data Analyst
 at Air Apps, you will be responsible for 
analyzing and interpreting data
 to drive business insights and optimize product performance. You will create 
reports, dashboards, and performance metrics
 to help teams make informed decisions and improve user experience.
This role requires a 
data-driven mindset, strong analytical skills, and experience with visualization tools
 to turn complex data into actionable insights.
Responsibilities
Analyze user behavior, product performance, and key business metrics to identify trends and opportunities.
Create and maintain interactive dashboards and reports using tools like Tableau, Looker, Power BI, or Google Data Studio.
Collect, clean, and structure large datasets to ensure accuracy and usability.
Define and track KPIs for marketing, product, and business performance.
Work with SQL, Python, or R to extract, analyze, and manipulate data.
Collaborate with product managers, engineers, and marketing teams to provide data-driven insights.
Conduct A/B testing and experiment analysis to improve product features and user engagement.
Identify bottlenecks and opportunities in user journeys and customer funnels.
Present findings in a clear and compelling way to stakeholders and leadership teams.
Stay up to date with industry trends, analytics best practices, and emerging data tools.
Requirements
Around 3+ years of experience in data analysis, business intelligence, or a related field.
Proficiency in SQL for data querying and manipulation.
Experience with data visualization tools (Tableau, Looker, Power BI, Google Data Studio).
Strong analytical skills with experience in Python or R for data analysis.
Knowledge of A/B testing methodologies and statistical analysis.
Experience with Google Analytics, Mixpanel, Amplitude, or similar user analytics tools.
Strong problem-solving skills and ability to communicate insights to non-technical stakeholders.
Experience working with large datasets and cloud-based data warehouses (BigQuery, Redshift, Snowflake).
Familiarity with ETL processes and data pipeline optimization is a plus.
Ability to work in a fast-paced, data-driven environment and manage multiple projects.
What benefits are we offering?
Apple hardware ecosystem for work.
Annual Bonus.
Medical Insurance (including vision & dental).
Disability insurance - short and long-term.
401k up to 4% contribution.
Air Stipend of $3,120/year, paid over 12 monthly installments (for home office, learning, wellness, etc.).
Air Conference ‚Äì an opportunity to meet the team, collaborate, and grow together.
Diversity & Inclusion
At Air Apps, we are committed to fostering a diverse, inclusive, and equitable workplace. We enthusiastically welcome applicants from all backgrounds, experiences, and perspectives. We celebrate diversity in all its forms and believe that varied voices and experiences make us stronger.
Application Disclaimer
At Air Apps, we value transparency and integrity in our hiring process. Applicants must submit their own work without any AI-generated assistance. Any use of AI in application materials, assessments, or interviews will result in disqualification.

Job Summary:
Aaratech Inc is seeking a highly analytical and detail-driven 
Data Analyst
 to join our growing team. The ideal candidate will be responsible for transforming raw data into actionable insights that influence strategic decisions and improve operational performance. If you enjoy working with large data sets, creating impactful visualizations, and collaborating across departments, we want to hear from you!
Key Responsibilities:
üîπ 
Data Collection & Management
Gather, clean, and organize data from various internal and external sources.
Ensure accuracy, consistency, and integrity of datasets.
üîπ 
Data Analysis
Analyze large datasets to uncover trends, patterns, and actionable insights.
Support decision-making through statistical analysis and forecasting.
üîπ 
Reporting & Visualization
Design and build dashboards and reports using 
Tableau
, 
Power BI
, or similar tools.
Present data-driven findings in a clear, concise manner to stakeholders.
üîπ 
Team Collaboration
Work with cross-functional teams to understand data needs and deliver tailored analytics solutions.
üîπ 
Tool Utilization
Leverage tools like 
SQL
, 
Excel
, and BI platforms for analysis and reporting.
üîπ 
Data Governance
Contribute to the implementation of data governance and best practices for long-term data integrity.
Qualifications:
‚úÖ Bachelor‚Äôs degree in 
Data Science, Statistics, Computer Science
, or a related field
‚úÖ Minimum of 
2 years of experience
 in a data analysis or similar role
‚úÖ Proficiency in 
SQL
 and 
Microsoft Excel
‚úÖ Experience with 
data visualization tools
 such as Tableau or Power BI
‚úÖ Strong analytical, problem-solving, and critical thinking abilities
‚úÖ Excellent written and verbal communication skills
‚úÖ Ability to explain technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders

What You'll Do:
A Data Analyst on the Retailer Analytics team is a key player in understanding every aspect of Criteo‚Äôs complex Retail Media business. This role interfaces across the organization to answer challenging analytical questions related to the performance and growth of Criteo‚Äôs Retail Media solutions. The person occupying this position will have an exceptionally broad view of every aspect of Criteo‚Äôs business with a focus on Americas Retailers (Supply side). The scope involves both technically rigorous work, including the use leading-edge data analysis technologies, and daily interaction with other cross-functional business units across Commercial, Technical and Product teams, as well as our retailers.
Criteo‚Äôs high-growth business model brings both opportunities and challenges. This position involves dealing with a considerable amount of complex, real-world data and requires a candidate who is comfortable thinking of new and innovative ways to analyze data, solve problems, and think strategically. The ideal candidate can function with minimal oversight and has a strong ability to learn new concepts quickly.
Collaborate with Partner Success and Technical Solutions teams to drive retailer growth and increase performance through data-driven insights
Conduct ad hoc analyses for top Americas Retailers to identify revenue driving opportunities like inventory expansion, yield optimization, integration and tech improvements, rate card management, second-price auctions, ad rendering studies, etc.
Proactively identify and collect analytical, tooling and reporting needs from Commercial stakeholders (Partner Success Management and Technical Solutions teams); develop self-service tools to answer these needs using Tableau, Python or any other relevant technologies
Provide retailer or industry insights and present as appropriate to internal teams throughout the organization and to retailers when relevant 
Develop intimate understanding of retailers‚Äô goals and needs, and partner with them and our internal commercial teams to formulate strategies for achieving joint objectives
Maintain deep knowledge of Criteo Retail Media products, technologies, and position in the marketplace
Who You Are:
Native-level English fluency
Bachelor‚Äôs degree or higher in a quantitative field (Mathematics, Economics, Engineering, Computer Science etc.)
Minimum 2 years full-time, analytics-relevant work experience ‚Äì experience in the digital industry is preferred
SQL proficiency is required
Background in any of the following is a plus: Tableau, Vertica, Hive/Hadoop, Python
Keen intellectual curiosity and ability to structure & solve difficult problems with minimal supervision
Passion for translating ‚Äòdata-speak‚Äô into relevant, compelling stories
Exceptional attention to detail coupled with an ability to see the big picture
Thorough conceptual and practical understanding of relational databases, data architecture/governance, and real-world application of statistical concepts
Effective presentation and public speaking skills with the ability to present and defend complex analysis both internally and externally to both technical and non-technical audiences.
A passion for story telling with data!
Must have the combination of technical skills, passion for learning, and the soft skills to work with all personality types in a dynamic environment
We acknowledge that many candidates may not meet every single role requirement listed above. If your experience looks a little different from our requirements but you believe that you can still bring value to the role, we‚Äôd love to see your application!
Who We Are:
Criteo is a leader in commerce media, helping brands, agencies, and publishers create meaningful consumer connections through AI-powered advertising solutions. We‚Äôre shaping a more open and sustainable digital future for advertising.
At Criteo, our culture is as unique as it is diverse. From our offices across the globe or from the comfort of home, our 3,600 Criteos collaborate together to build an open, impactful, and forward-thinking environment.
We foster a workplace where everyone is valued, and employment decisions are based solely on skills, qualifications, and business needs‚Äînever on non-job-related factors or legally protected characteristics.
What We Offer:
üè† Own your work style ‚Äì Build your work around your life and not the other way around.
üìà Grow with us ‚Äì Learning, mentorship & career development programs.
üí™ Your wellbeing matters ‚Äì Health benefits, wellness perks & mental health support.
ü§ù A team that cares ‚Äì Diverse, inclusive, and globally connected.
üí∏ Fair pay & perks ‚Äì Competitive salary, equity, performance-based rewards and family-friendly policies.
Additional benefits may vary depending on the country where you work and the nature of your employment with Criteo.
For employees based in the US, certain roles at Criteo are eligible for additional rewards, including quarterly or annual bonus and restricted stock units. US-based employees receive access to healthcare, dental, and vision insurance, a 401(k) plan with company match, short-term and long-term disability coverage, life insurance, family forming and wellness benefits, Flexible Work financial support, learning opportunities, and a robust annual leave plan including volunteer time off and summer vacation days.
The US base salary pay range for this position per year is:
$75,000 - $80,000

Data Analyst
Overview
The Data Analyst is a mid-to-senior level role that supports and advances the analytics agenda by collecting, analyzing, and interpreting data to improve the customer experience and business performance. This role works closely with cross-functional teams to deliver insights, maintain data integrity, and contribute to data-driven decision-making across the organization.
Essential Duties and Responsibilities
Collect, clean, and validate data from multiple sources to ensure accuracy, consistency, and reliability.
Develop and optimize SQL queries, reconciliation checks, and data models to support reporting and analysis needs.
Build and maintain dashboards and reports in Tableau (or similar BI tools) that provide actionable insights to Sales, Operations, and Product teams.
Partner with stakeholders across business units to investigate key questions and deliver clear, data-backed recommendations.
Support customer experience analytics initiatives, including website usage, A/B testing, and integration of online/offline customer journey data.
Apply advanced statistical methods to analyze large datasets, identify trends, and uncover business opportunities.
Collaborate with the data engineering team on preprocessing and source alignment to improve data quality and automation.
Document analysis processes, update internal knowledge bases, and contribute to improving analytics workflows.
Stay current on emerging tools and technologies (e.g., Databricks, AWS) and bring forward recommendations for adoption.
Qualifications
Master‚Äôs degree in Data Analytics, Computer Science, Information Systems, Statistics, Business Analytics, or related field.
3‚Äì5 years of experience in data analysis, reporting, or business intelligence within a fast-paced or enterprise environment.
Strong SQL skills with experience writing, optimizing, and troubleshooting queries.
Proficiency in Excel and demonstrated experience with Tableau, Power BI, or similar BI/reporting tools.
Solid understanding of statistical methods, data modeling, and applied analytics.
Ability to interpret complex data, translate findings into actionable insights, and clearly communicate results to technical and non-technical stakeholders.
Experience working with cloud-based data platforms (AWS, Databricks, or similar) preferred.
Strong organizational and problem-solving skills, with the ability to work both independently and collaboratively.

Responsibilities:
Create routine supporter-facing metrics reports measuring overall educational activity performance and follow a set monthly and quarterly reporting schedule to ensure reporting deadlines are met.
Take ownership of managing internal ad-hoc reporting and data analytics requests and various internal process improvement initiatives.
Ability to work independently, multi-tasking and understanding priorities of requests and projects in a dynamic environment.
Maintain and enhance reporting template(s) and customize as needed using reporting tools such as Tableau, Excel pivot tables, and PowerPoint.
Provide additional insights and customized metrics reports on activity performance and impact to support sales in generating renewals.
Independently QA reports with existing tools and work with the QA team to ensure all reporting issues and defects are addressed before delivery of reports.
Recognize when improvements can be made to dashboards and work with Data and Analytics and Product Management teams to further develop enhancements for the dashboard to improve reporting functionality and efficiencies.
Ensure messaging and branding is consistent across the US business unit and its products.
Work closely with the sales organization and outcomes and insights management to assist in determining reporting needs based on supporter requirements.
Qualifications:
Bachelors Degree or equivalent experience; BA/BS in marketing or information systems is preferred.
Minimum of 2 years of related work experience in data analysis and/or client reporting is required.
Demonstrated experience working with Tableau Desktop and Tableau Server.
Strong Excel skill is required. Must be proficient in Excel and PowerPoint with ability to import and manipulate data from various data sources, aggregate data by using pivot tables, v-lookup, charts and graphs.
Must be proactive and detail-oriented.
Strong organization and time management skills is required.
Experience in writing SQL queries and working in a big data environment, such as Vertica, a plus.
Experience with reporting tools and web analytics tools such as Tableau, OBIEE, Cognos, Omniture, Google Analytics a strong plus.
Ability to manage a high-volume workload in a dynamically changing environment.
Strong analytical skills combined with the ability to communicate with seasoned management across multiple time zones.
Strong verbal and written communication skills.
Previous experience in a sales support environment with communicating data-driven analysis to various departments is preferred.
Prior experience with web analytics and reporting of client data, marketing experience a plus.
Creative thinker who can utilize existing resources in a productive and/or innovative way.

Job Summary
 JOB DESCRIPTION 
At Home Group has an immediate opportunity within its marketing organization for a Marketing Data Analyst. This role is expected to understand complex client needs that can be solved or further informed with the use of data and implement those solutions. The Marketing Data Analyst‚Äôs primary objective is to design data products that quickly drive incremental value to the Marketing team as they address customer acquisition, retention, marketing campaign effectiveness and other sales growth initiatives.
The 
Marketing Data Analyst
 will collaborate with business users, Analytics peers within Marketing and across the Enterprise to maximize the value of insights and shared resources to benefit At Home.They will need to understand common challenges in data structures and strategies to build data products in an extensible, scalable, and performant manner. You would enjoy this role, if you are detail-oriented, logical, and analytical, and like helping organizations drive data-driven cultures to improve operations and solve important business problems, especially with technology.
Essential Functions
 Work collaboratively with Marketing Analytics team members to build consistent, accurate, and available data solutions. 
 Independently receive and conduct ad-hoc data analysis and reporting requests that require data blending from multiple data sources. 
 Calculate incrementality of loyalty offers 
 Define problem statement and extracts user requirements for Marketing related data analysis. 
 Develop and presents analysis and reports using data visualization and storytelling best practices. 
 Produce necessary documentation to ensure consistency, quality, and transparency across the enterprise. 
 Perform data transformation and data analysis on Marketing-related data including email campaigns, SMS campaigns, etc. 
 Identify underlying trends or patterns and generate meaningful insights/recommendations for the business. 
 Participate in data quality issue analysis and resolution recommendations. 
 Collaborates with peer analysts across the enterprise to ensure data accuracy, consistency, and trust from internal customers. 
Qualifications
 Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Marketing, Business, or Data Analytics preferred 
 Minimum 4 years of data analyst/data engineering experience 
 Has profiled, explored, and combined datasets in a cloud data warehouse 
 Experience with real-time POS data, email and SMS campaign data, big data pipelines, structured, semi-structured, and unstructured datasets 
 Has independently created performance reports/dashboards consistently used by non-technical team members 
 Has produced documentation to aid business users, IT users, and administrators (e.g., source to target mappings, data lineage, data dictionaries, data source profiles, in-line code commentary). 
 Has written complex SQL statements to extract and transform data for consumption 
 Has tuned and improved performance of queries using strategies such as indexing, subqueries, and temp tables. 
 Proficiency with Business Intelligence Tools 
 Previous experience in Retail, CPG, Marketing, Loyalty/CRM or eCommerce is a plus. 
 Experience with Agile and Scrum preferred. 
 Experience supporting and working with cross-functional teams in a dynamic environment. 
 Knowledge of data lifecycle 
 Skilled in data analytics, data wrangling, data blending/integration, data processing technologies, and agile development processes 
 Data & Analytics tools; Snowflake (preferred), Redshift, or BigQuery, PowerBI (preferred), Tableau, or Qlik, Alteryx, Excel, Azure, and Mastercard APT Test/Learn 
About Us
When you‚Äôre a part of our team, you have the full support of a diverse, close-knit team in our stores. We consider all applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, national origin, age, disability, gender identity and expression, marital or military status. We also provide reasonable accommodations to qualified individuals with disabilities in accordance with the Americans with Disabilities Act and applicable state and local law. At Home is committed to knitting diversity and inclusion into the fabric of our culture; we respect, appreciate and celebrate the experiences and qualities that differentiate everyone on the At Home team.

Job Description
TriNet is a leading provider of comprehensive human resources solutions for small to midsize businesses (SMBs). We enhance business productivity by enabling our clients to outsource their HR function to one strategic partner and allowing them to focus on operating and growing their core businesses. Our full-service HR solutions include features such as payroll processing, human capital consulting, employment law compliance and employee benefits, including health insurance, retirement plans and workers‚Äô compensation insurance.
TriNet has a nationwide presence and an experienced executive team. Our stock is publicly traded on the NYSE under the ticker symbol TNET. If you‚Äôre passionate about innovation and making an impact on the large SMB market, come join us as we power our clients‚Äô business success with extraordinary HR.
Don't meet every single requirement? Studies have shown that many potential applicants discourage themselves from applying to jobs unless they meet every single requirement. TriNet always strives to hire the most qualified candidate for a particular role, ensuring we deliver outstanding results for our small and medium-size customers. So if you're excited about this role but your past experience doesn't align perfectly with every single qualification in the job description, nobody‚Äôs perfect ‚Äì and we encourage you to apply. You may just be the right candidate for this or other roles. 
A Brief Overview
The Data Analyst utilizes their knowledge of human capital, finance, accounting and business strategies to provide insights to TriNet's management team through various analysis functions. The position is responsible for preparing sales and marketing reports and analyses for the Data & Analytics organization and serves to assist with company needs. The position provides regular support to other Business Transformation, People Team, and Finance-related functions, such as the month-end close process.
Locations
United States (Atlanta, GA)
What You Will Do
 Provide People Analytics insights to the broader organization, with a focus on the Sales organization.
 Provide insights, analysis & recommendations on top of revenue pipeline, and impact on Cost to Acquire customers. Analyze results by Lead Source and recommend actions.
 Develop business knowledge and expertise to drive business process improvement. Identify and address areas of risk that threaten the success of the company. Advise and implement solutions to mitigate risk.
 Coordinate with People Team Leaders, Revenue Leaders, Financial Planning and Analysis, and Insurance Services to ensure revenue and costs are captured accurately
 Responsible for compiling and supporting key reporting metrics (KPI) and other visual materials
 Cross train staff to mitigate risks to key processes
 Assist in automation of repetitive data aggregation/manipulation tasks to enable greater focus on value-add analysis
 Performs other duties as assigned
 Complies with all policies and standards
Education Qualifications
 Bachelor's Degree or equivalent experience preferred
 Masters of Quantitative Management or equivalent experience preferred
Experience Qualifications
 Typically 2+ years professional or educational experience
Skills And Abilities
 Tableau/PowerBI development experience preferred
 Excellent communication and interpersonal skills
 Proficient in Microsoft Office Suite
 Excellent presentation and facilitation skills
 Ability to lead others
Licenses and Certifications
 Tableau or Power BI certified applicants preferred
Travel Requirements
Minimal
Work Environment
 Work primarily in office setting. The work environment characteristics described here are representative of those an employee encounters while performing the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable persons with disabilities to perform the essential functions.
The preferred location for this role is Atlanta, GA, and the salary range for this location is $62,200.00 to $105,700.00. All qualified external applicants will be considered for an in-office role, based in Atlanta. All qualified internal candidates are encouraged to apply and consider relocation to Atlanta and may be considered for remote hire at the company‚Äôs discretion. The candidate‚Äôs final salary offer will be based on the candidate‚Äôs skills, education, work location and experience.
A candidate‚Äôs compensation may also include bonuses consistent with TriNet‚Äôs corporate bonus plan.
Additionally, subject to applicable eligibility requirements, TriNet offers permanent full-time employees a variety of benefits including medical, dental, and vision plans, life and disability insurance, a 401(K) savings plan, an employee stock purchase plan, eleven (11) Company observed holidays, PTO and a comprehensive leave program. Please click the following link for detailed information about our benefits offerings: https://www.trinet.com/documents/blt5b61a1040aae1904
Please Note: TriNet reserves the right to change or modify job duties and assignments at any time. The above job description is not all encompassing. Position functions and qualifications may vary depending on business necessity.
TriNet is an Equal Opportunity Employer and does not discriminate against applicants based on race, religion, color, disability, medical condition, legally protected genetic information, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, marital status, gender identity or expression, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth or related medical conditions), age, veteran status or other legally protected characteristics. Any applicant with a mental or physical disability who requires an accommodation during the application process should contact recruiting@trinet.com to request such an accommodation.
About Us
TriNet is a leading provider of comprehensive human resources solutions for small to midsize businesses (SMBs). We enhance business productivity by enabling our clients to outsource their HR function to one strategic partner and allowing them to focus on operating and growing their core businesses. Our full-service HR solutions include features such as payroll processing, human capital consulting, employment law compliance and employee benefits, including health insurance, retirement plans and workers‚Äô compensation insurance.
TriNet has a nationwide presence and an experienced executive team. Our stock is publicly traded on the NYSE under the ticker symbol TNET. If you‚Äôre passionate about innovation and making an impact on the large SMB market, come join us as we power our clients‚Äô business success with extraordinary HR.

Department Summary
UCLA Social Welfare is centered on advancing social justice, promoting health and mental health, and enhancing child and family well-being. It is dedicated to educating and equipping skilled, compassionate, and innovative professionals and visionary change agents who advance child, family, and community well-being through a person-in-environment framework that integrates global perspectives and scientific inquiry while honoring human diversity in all its forms.
Position Summary
Under supervision, the Research Analyst is responsible for supporting data collection, cleaning, and coding for both qualitative and quantitative research projects. The position will contribute to the development and implementation of data management protocols, assist with survey administration and interview transcription, and apply coding frameworks to analyze open-ended responses and large datasets.
Salary & Compensation
UCLA provides a full pay range. Actual salary offers consider factors, including budget, prior experience, skills, knowledge, abilities, education, licensure and certifications, and other business considerations. Salary offers at the top of the range are not common. Visit UC Benefit package to discover benefits that start on day one, and UC Total Compensation Estimator to calculate the total compensation value with benefits.
Qualifications
Understanding of basic research methods (qualitative and quantitative). Familiarity with survey design and data collection protocols. Proficiency with data management platforms (e.g., Excel, Qualtrics, Stata, Dedoose) (Required)
Knowledge of data privacy and confidentiality practices. Awareness of social science concepts and terminology (e.g., health equity, poverty, early childhood development) (Preferred)
Strong written and verbal communication skills. Ability to create clear data visualizations and summaries. Attention to detail and accuracy in data handling. (Required)
Strong organizational and time management skills (Required)
Ability to work independently and collaborate effectively within a multidisciplinary team. (Required)
Ability to maintain professionalism and discretion when handling sensitive data (Required)
Education, Licenses, Certifications & Personal Affiliations
Bachelor's Degree in a related area and/or equivalent/training (Required)
Master's Degree in a related area and/or equivalent/training (Preferred)
Special Conditions for Employment
Background Check: Continued employment is contingent upon the completion of a satisfactory background investigation.
Live Scan Background Check: A Live Scan background check must be completed prior to the start of employment.
Age Requirement: Candidate(s) must be 18 years or older to be eligible to be hired.
COVID and Flu Vaccinations: The position is subject to providing evidence of inoculation.
Schedule
8:00 a.m. to 5:00 p.m.
Union/Policy Covered
99-Policy Covered

posting_title: Data Analyst, Global Talent Acquisition Reporting
description:
Within Microsoft‚Äôs Human Resources, Global Talent Acquisition (GTA) serves to acquire, develop, and retain talent. Top talent allows Microsoft to shape an aspirational, inclusive, and global culture which empowers our people to do high-impact work and enables our company to thrive. The Reporting, Insights, and Data Quality team (RIDQ) contributes to the all-up mission by providing customers with high-quality data, reporting, and insights.
As a Data Analyst, Global Talent Acquisition Reporting, you'll provide oversight into critical reporting programs. In this role you will be responsible for translating strategy into programmatic solutions, ensuring alignment with leadership priorities, and driving program maturity through continuous improvement. Additionally, you will partner with key stakeholders, business intelligence, and engineering, to deliver reporting solutions using data from our applicant tracking systems and a wide variety of technologies including Power BI and PowerApps.
If you are passionate about data and reporting and opportunities to deploy efficient and scalable solutions that improve services and employee experience, we would love to hear from you!
Microsoft‚Äôs mission is to empower every person and every organization on the planet to achieve more. As employees we come together with a growth mindset, innovate to empower others, and collaborate to realize our shared goals. Each day we build on our values of respect, integrity, and accountability to create a culture of inclusion where everyone can thrive at work and beyond.
Responsibilities
Collaborates with stakeholders to thoroughly understand business objectives and needs, converting them into comprehensive program requirements and technical specifications for reporting solutions. May coach others to help them broaden business knowledge.
Expertise in Data 
Leverages appropriate types and sources of data and/or metrics, understands how business needs translate into data requirements and evaluates sufficiency of data sources, determines needs for integrating additional data, and identifies, anticipates, and addresses gaps and data quality issues with data providers, in partnership with other teams. Leverages relevant data, frameworks, and/or analyses from other teams, and ensures that data access and quality issues are addressed. Begins collaborating with data analysts and data engineers to build data pipelines or integrations used to address business needs and advises other analysts on ways to present and discuss data to influence business stakeholders' decision making. Applies fundamental understanding of data governance to work to ensure the solutions they and/or their project teams produce have the right level of security applied (encryption, role restrictions) and are aligned with company policy.
Data Analysis 
Applies expertise to determine optimal analytical tools and techniques to address business questions. Guides and partners with others to execute analyses, resolve analytical challenges, interpret results across relevant contexts, and provide actionable insights and recommendations to business stakeholders. Critically evaluates assumptions about data or analysis methods to ensure they are appropriate for answering business questions in context and provides feedback on features and functions of analytical tools (e.g., algorithms, statistical models) developed by Engineering or Data Science teams.
Presentation of Results 
Develops appropriate presentations that tell stories of analyses, including dashboards, reports, data visualizations, self-service platforms, slides, and talking points that highlight relevant insights. Synthesizes details across analyses and reporting platforms into a cohesive story that serves to inform business decisions, and identifies opportunities to improve efficiency of reporting and presentations. Guides others to ensure presented results are accessible, and provide information accurately, clearly, and with sufficient relevance to influence decision making for intended audience(s).
Evaluation 
Determines factors and/or data types/frameworks to include in the evaluation of the impact of business, product, and/or operational decisions that provide relevant assessments of impact. Ensures that evaluations can account for anticipated risks and applies learnings from previous evaluations. Synthesizes results across evaluation instances, identifies relevant connections to other work, and makes recommendations for next steps linked to strategic business goals.
Orchestration and Collaboration 
Leverages working relationships within and across teams to ensure quality data sources, methodologies, as well as the appropriate application of analytical tools and processes, and drives their adoption, to facilitate relevant insight generation, reporting, and interpretation. Proactively engages stakeholders to identify and act on opportunities to leverage resources and solutions that were instrumental to success in similar contexts, and consults across teams on decisions related to analyses, insights reporting, and/or their interpretation.
Improvement, Efficiency, and Innovation 
Identifies and promotes methods that create efficiency in core work related to analytics and reporting that are reusable, readily discoverable by decision-makers, self-service, and directed to meaningful interpretation of data that drive business decisions and impact. Recommends and socializes optimal methods for sharing, standardizing, and scaling insights. Evaluates the viability and relevance of automated methods and efficiency gains that leverage AI for use in reporting, and/or analysis to recommend when they should become standard practices.
Other
Embody our culture and values
Qualifications
Required Qualifications
Master's Degree in Mathematics, Analytics, Engineering, Computer Science, Marketing, Business, Economics or related field AND 3+ years experience in data analysis and reporting, business intelligence, or business and financial analysis
OR Bachelor's Degree in Statistics, Finance, Mathematics, Analytics, Engineering, Computer Science, Marketing, Business, Economics or related field AND 4+ years experience in data analysis and reporting, business intelligence, or business and financial analysis
OR equivalent experience.
3+ years experience in Power BI (services and desktop), experience with Power BI Semantic Models, Data Analysis Expressions (DAX), including measures, calculated columns, and tables.
3+ years experience in reporting design, development, and maintenance, understanding of data visualization practices.
Preferred Qualifications
5+ years experience in Power BI (services and desktop), proficiency with Power BI Semantic Models
Proficiency with Power Platform, Power Apps.
Business Analytics IC4 - The typical base pay range for this role across the U.S. is USD $106,400 - $203,600 per year. There is a different range applicable to specific work locations, within the San Francisco Bay area and New York City metropolitan area, and the base pay range for this role in those locations is USD $137,600 - $222,600 per year.
Certain roles may be eligible for benefits and other compensation. Find additional benefits and pay information here: https://careers.microsoft.com/us/en/us-corporate-pay
Microsoft will accept applications for the role until September 12,2025.
Microsoft is an equal opportunity employer. Consistent with applicable law, all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, citizenship, color, family or medical care leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, immigration status, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran or military status, race, ethnicity, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by applicable local laws, regulations and ordinances. If you need assistance and/or a reasonable accommodation due to a disability during the application process, read more about requesting accommodations.

Position: 
Business Data Analyst
Location:
 Greater Boston, MA (Remote, EST Required)
Length:
 3+ years
Job Description:
Our client is seeking a skilled and motivated Business Data Analyst to join their team. This role is critical in ensuring accurate data management, maintaining visibility into IT systems, and supporting business operations through actionable insights. The ideal candidate will have strong analytical skills, hands-on experience with ServiceNow CMDB administration, and the ability to bridge the gap between technical teams and business stakeholders. This position will play a key role in ensuring operational efficiency, minimizing risks, and driving improvements in data quality and process optimization.
Essential Duties and Responsibilities:
Collect, analyze, and interpret data from multiple sources to identify trends, patterns, and insights.
Manage master data, including creation, updates, and deletion.
Monitor data quality, identify issues, and remove corrupt or inaccurate records.
Define, document, and implement new data collection and analysis processes.
Develop reports, charts, graphs, and presentations to share findings with business stakeholders.
Translate business requirements into clear, non-technical language for wider audiences.
Evaluate current business processes and recommend improvements.
Maintain and administer the ServiceNow CMDB, ensuring IT assets, configurations, and service dependencies are accurately tracked.
Collaborate with system administrators, CMDB users, and cross-functional teams to ensure compliance with standards and improve data quality.
Update and maintain technical documentation, user guides, and process materials.
Support service monitoring and observability solutions to improve visibility into IT systems and services.
Qualifications:
Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, Data Analytics, or a related field.
Strong background in data analysis and business reporting.
Knowledge of IT system administration processes and terminology.
Experience with ServiceNow IT Service Management and CMDB administration.
Ability to review and translate business requirements into technical specifications.
Hands-on experience with project execution within Agile software development lifecycles.
Strong problem-solving, organizational, and communication skills.
Excellent customer service and stakeholder engagement abilities.
Experience in preparing technical documentation and maintaining accurate records.
Experience with application and infrastructure monitoring (system performance, troubleshooting, issue resolution) is preferred.
ServiceNow development or ITSM development experience is a plus.
Familiarity with integrating alerts into ServiceNow (ITOM) is a plus.
Exposure to logging and monitoring tools such as SolarWinds, ELK, Splunk, Prometheus, or Datadog is advantageous.
Due to the nature of the work, an Interim clearance is required, however the candidate will need to obtain a Secret clearance (active Secret clearance is a plus).
Selected candidate will be subject to a post offer background check and must be able to maintain a Secret-level DoD security clearance. Why Work For Us
Grubhub, part of Wonder Group Inc, is all about connecting hungry diners with our network of over 375,000 merchants nationwide. Innovative technology, user-friendly platforms and streamlined delivery capabilities set us apart and make us an industry leader in the world of online food ordering. When you join our team, you become part of a community that works together to innovate, solve problems, grow, work hard and have a ton of fun in the process!
Grubhub is seeking an Associate to join our Corporate Accounts Data team. In this role, you will be instrumental in supporting our customer acquisition effort by focusing on mission critical projects including lead sourcing, data enrichment, and lead distribution. You will partner with the broader Sales and Operations team to have the best in class lead and prospect data.
This is a role that requires strong organization, internal collaboration, project management and analytical skills. You will dive deep - into data, process, and the customer experience - to identify the critical insights necessary to improve business performance and translate these into action
The ideal candidate will be a proactive problem-solver with a strong background in data management and a passion for optimizing operational processes in a fast-paced environment.
The Impact You Will Make
Support Lead database for one of Grubhub‚Äôs key business lines

Troubleshoot and resolve data-related issues in a timely manner, minimizing impact on business operations
Collaborate with marketing and sales teams to support lead generation and enrichment initiatives
Prepare regular reports on data quality metrics and operational performance for senior leadership
What You Bring to the Table
2+ years of experience in a data-focused role, ideally supporting a sales team
Analytical mindset and fluency with numbers
Advanced SQL and Google Sheets skills such as pivot tables and lookups
Experience with data visualization and dashboarding tools such as Tableau, Sigma
Familiarity with Salesforce a plus
Comfortable in ambiguous environments while maintaining a strong bias for action
Excellent communication skills, with the ability to explain complex data concepts to non-technical stakeholders
Base Salary:
Chicago: $67,500- 74,000
Wonder Group uses geographic-specific salary structures, which means the salary offered may vary depending on where the job is located. The final salary offer will take into account various factors, such as the candidate's skills, education, training, credentials, and experience.
And Of Course, Perks!
PTO. Grubhub employees enjoy a generous amount of time to recharge.
Health and Wellness. Excellent medical, dental and vision benefits, employee network groups and paid parental leave are just a few of our programs to support your overall well-being.
Free Meals. Our employees get a weekly Grubhub credit to enjoy.

Grubhub Community Fund
. Employees are also given paid time off each year to support the causes that are important to them.

This team is focused on analytics across a product portfolio dedicated to the wireline quality effort, which is the largest segment of customers. They are a team of analysts dedicated to this project, and they are growing to support additional efforts on these product enhancements.

Dedication to keep an open line of communication and provide full transparency.
